story:
What is the #ARTLIVES billboard campaign?

At RAREFORM, we believe in stories. For us, that story begins with bold billboards destined to sit in a landfill. Normally, that’s where the story would end, but we upcycle these billboards and give them the chance to become surfbags, backpacks, duffels, wallets, and other accessories.

This time, we’re getting in on the process from the beginning. During our “Art Lives” series, we’ll be asking some of our favorite artists to design a billboard for RAREFORM. When their artwork is finished, our partner, Lamar Advertising, will print the art on a billboard and display it in Los Angeles.

Once a billboard in our “Art Lives” campaign goes up, our supporters will have the chance to choose what piece of the artwork they want to claim as their own. We’ll then transform their special piece of art into a limited edition RAREFORM bag.

Just like every billboard is unique, every RAREFORM product is also completely one-of-a-kind. We get all kinds of vinyl, and each piece comes with its own style, its own set of wear and tear, and its own story. Every item we make is creative and expressive. We make bags with a story to tell.



The Artist & Art Behind the Billboard

Artist: The Godfather of Graphic Design

Our first artist, Milton Glaser, is known as the godfather of graphic design. Milton has designed a billboard that embodies everything we like: it’s bold, daring and tells its own story. In October, this billboard will be displayed for all of Los Angeles to see.

Milton Glaser is among the most celebrated graphic designers in the United States. His designs include the I ♥ NY logo, Bob Dylan's album poster, and most recently the advertisements for the hit TV show, "Mad Men". Milton also co-founded New York Magazine.          


Art: Own a Piece of History


RAREFORM fans have wanted to know where their bag came from; they have wanted to know its story.  So we're bringing you a set of bags whose origin story is no secret; in fact, it's on display for all of LA. The meaning behind Milton's art and the location of the billboard - it's all open to the public. Individuals that join the campaign and contribute towards a backpack, messenger, or key chain will all own a piece of this exact billboard and own a piece of history. 

The Meaning Behind, 'It's Not Warming, It's Dying'


Glaser's 'It's Not Warming, It's Dying' campaign aims to create a greater sense of urgency around climate change, moving away from benign language like "global warming". Milton hopes to unite the climate change community under one slogan and one flag. 

He originally designed a simple visual for posters and button badges, comprising a green disk obscured by black smoke. The graphic suggests an aerial view of the Earth with only a narrow band of life remaining.

The art that was created for the billboard shows a natural progression of the Earth where Milton describes the art by saying, “…symbolically, the disappearance of light seemed to be an appropriate way to begin."

Be Part of This Story: 

Why We Need Your Help & What's In It For You

We’re already off to a good start: we’ve found the artist, the artwork has been created, the billboard has been reserved. Now we need your help. $5,000 covers our initial manufacturing run for these bags. With your support, we’ll be able to do what we do best: take a bold vinyl billboard and give it new life. Our funds will also be used to continue the search for great artists to collaborate with on a bi-monthly basis and put their art on a billboard.  We hope to offer even more opportunities to make handpicked bags as unique as you.

As thanks for your support, we’re offering some pretty cool rewards:

Pledge to get the project started, $5

Join our community for good karma and a thanks on our website!

Key Chain, Repurposed from the billboard, $15

Keep your keys safe with this billboard key chain.  Perfect for everyday use. 

(5'' long)

                               

RAREFORM Phone case, Repurposed from the billboard, $30

Protect your phone in style. Fits iPhone 6 & 6 Plus.

                         

RAREFORM Stainless Steel Bottle,  featuring Milton's artwork, $35

                             


"The Summit" Backpack, $99 (Limit: 100 pcs)

19 (H) x 12 (W) x 6 (D), 22.5L 

                                       


"The Manhattan" Messenger, $150 (Limit: 100 pcs)

Bottom Width: 14’’, Depth: 7’’, Height: 13’’; 21L


                                             


Combo Pack (Backpack & Messenger), $200 (Limit: 50 packs)

         

3 Posters signed by Milton Glaser + your choice of backpack/messenger, $500 (Only available to first 5 supporters!)


                                 


Who We Are & How We Got Here

RAREFORM's Story

Our company story began when Alec Avedissian made the choice to leave his job in finance to embark on a six-month journey through South America with his closest friends. In El Salvador, Alec recognized the interconnectedness of poverty, environmental degradation, and the outdoor industry, and began dreaming of creating a business that could reduce waste in the world.

In 2012, Alec’s dreams were realized and RAREFORM was born. These days, brothers and co-founders Alec and Aric spend their time dreaming up new ways to improve RAREFORM’s products by pushing new boundaries. Every billboard we collect is washed, hand cut, and carefully stitched together into its new form. 

On average, RAREFORM repurposes over 10,000 pounds of vinyl each month, That means that our products will help you look good, as you do good. We’ve also pledged 1% of our sales to the preservation and restoration of the natural environment.

Our Partner - Lamar Advertising

Lamar Advertising Company, one of the largest outdoor advertising companies in North America, is our partner in the Art Lives series and is pivotal to making this campaign a reality. Lamar is at forefront of green initiatives in the outdoor advertising space and together with RAREFORM share in our passion for a cleaner planet.  Lamar's is donating the billboard space to share artwork with the public. 

Keep Up With the Art Lives Series

If you want to see which artist we choose next, click on the following link to sign up for our newsletter: SIGN UP

RAREFORM in the Press:


Risks & Challenges

We’ve done 90% of the heavy-lifting to get us to this point. We are ready to take the 1st billboard in the #ArtLives Artist Series into production. As with any project, there may be hiccups along the way – but we are no strangers to the ups and downs of a new venture. Some of our initial risks include manufacturing delays and potential material wear on the billboard. Repurposing material into new products has challenges – especially when we have only 1 billboard.

Lucky for us, we know all about ups and downs and launching new products. If we hit any of those bumps along the way, you'll be the first to know. We'll inform you with a current status, why it's happening and how we're going to fix it. If at any point you have questions about our risks or challenges, give us a shout - we're happy to talk it through with you. Check out our updates tab as we continue.  We are excited about building a community with our Indiegogo supporters! 


FAQ's 

1) What material is a billboard made of?

Billboards are made of vinyl. Vinyl material is heavy-duty, waterproof, and the overall perfect material for a bag or accessory with a story. A RAREFORM bag is a cool, durable, and eco-friendly product you can feel good about.

2.) How big is the billboard?

This billboard is 14’x48’ft (ya, it’s pretty big).

3.) How does the process work from printing to the final bag?

Lamar Advertising, our partner in this campaign and long-time supporter, prints the billboard. The billboard is then taken to the location where is it stretched-out over the frame of the billboard. The billboard will be on display for 4 weeks before it is taken down and sent to the RAREFORM warehouse. We will then wash, cut, and meticulously sew the pieces into finished products right here in our factory in California.

4.)  Who is the next artist in the series?

We can’t tell you just yet. We will reveal the next artist once we reach our goal for this campaign.

5.) Where can I see the billboard in Los Angeles?

Great question! You need to see it – so get in your car, get on your bike, or hitch-a-ride, and head to 5957 Crenshaw Blvd, Los Angeles, CA.  Trust us, you won’t miss it. It is that big.

6.) Can I recommend someone to be the next artist in the series?

If there is someone that you would like to be the next artist, send us an email (info@rareform.com) or give us a call (805-419-3507).  We’d love to hear from you and get your thoughts on whose art you’d like to see displayed in L.A.

story:
Georgetown Bound

From the owner, Ryan Blythe: 

"As a Georgetown resident, I'm inspired by its creative community and small businesses that make Georgetown one of the most unique neighborhoods Seattle has to offer. 

By bringing Rainier Glass Studio to Georgetown, I will be able to give back to the community that I call home, by providing a creative space that welcomes inspired artists of all ages, hosts special events and serves delicious craft cocktails.

With over 20 years of glassblowing experience, I've had the opportunity to learn from and work with the some of the best artists in the industry such as Michael Taylor, Petyr Novotony, Leon Applebaum, Richard Royal, Dale Chihuly, Maestro Vitoreo Ferro and Lino Tagliapietra to name a few. 

In the last 3 years, Rainier Glass Studio has provided glassblowing experiences to over 11,000 customers. That's a lot of glass! 

Your donation will not only be supporting the growth of Rainier Glass Studio, but also supporting the growth of the Georgetown community, its emerging artists and neighboring small businesses."

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $50,000 to fund the following:

  • Reconstruction of a 4,000+ sq ft retail space for glassblowing, an art gallery and special events space.
  • Installations and upgrades in equipment and tools to manufacture the highest quality glass products. 
  • Relocation costs to cover licensing, permits, hiring licensed contractors and general labor.
Check out our "Perks" to see what you receive by making a donation.

The Impact on the Community

Rainier Glass Studio will provide a space that welcomes inspiring artists to learn, create and grow. The gallery will support well known and emerging artists of all mediums, and our bar will provide a comfortable space to mix, mingle and browse the gallery. 

  • We will actively be apart of the monthly Georgetown Art Attack, featuring live glassblowing performances as well as featuring other artists of various mediums. 
  • The space will be available for booking private parties, charity events, music events and more.

Risks & Challenges

Rainier Glass Studio will be moving into an older building and the space we will be leasing will need to be redesigned and reconstructed to provide a safe space for artists and customers to enjoy a glassblowing experience, and to host special events. 

In order to create the safest environment, we will be working with the City of Seattle, and other top licensed professionals (architects, electritions, etc) to bring the space up to code and install all measures needed to handle any emergency. 

We care about our customers, our employees, artists and neighbors, and will strive to create the safest environment for all to enjoy.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to support us, but just can't contribute money at this time, we totally understand. How you can help is by spreading the word. Share our campaign on your Facebook page, Twitter, Instagram and any other platform to get the word out there. Remember,  you aren't just supporting Rainier Glass Studio, you are supporting an entire community of artists.

Thank you for your contribution!

story:
The goal of this first fundraising campaign is to demonstrate community support as we formally approach corporate sponsors and apply for grants. Show your support by donating today! 

Mission Statement

Murals at Fort Bliss partners with the local community to bring military members and their families in contact with the region of El Paso through the storytelling of murals.

Objectives

This project will result in four murals to be donated to the U.S. Army for installation at three new state-of-the-art facilities: the Mendoza Soldier Family Care Center, Soto Fitness Center, and Freedom Crossing Food Court - all located on Fort Bliss in El Paso, TX.

The Artist

Gaspar Enriquez grew up in El Paso's Segundo Barrio and began his professional life as a union machinist in Los Angeles, California. He returned to El Paso in his 20's where he earned a B.A. in Art from the University of Texas at El Paso and later an M.A. from New Mexico State University. Enriquez taught art to students at Bowie H.S. for 34 years before retiring to devote himself full-time to his art. He currently lives in the historic town of San Elizario and continues to be involved in work that contributes to his local community.

Enriquez had a memorable 2014. He completed a commission on nine mural panels for the new El Paso Chihuahua baseball stadium that opened in April 2014. In addition, the El Paso Museum of Art hosted a retrospective of the artist's work, "Metaphors of El Barrio.” Another exhibit featuring Enriquez's work as an artist educator was held at the Reuben Center at the University of Texas at El Paso.

Enriquez' art portraying the Chicano lifestyle is exhibited nationwide. The murals drafted for Fort Bliss represent his first military themed designs. Visit Gaspar Enriquez' official website for additional information about this artist here. 

Recent articles profiling Mr. Enriquez can be found here and here. 

Locations

Spc. Hugo V. Mendoza Soldier Family Care Center

East Fort Bliss, El Paso, TX

The Artist
Gaspar Enriquez grew up in El Paso's Segundo Barrio and began his professional life as a union machinist in Los Angeles, California. He returned to El Paso in his 20's where he earned a B.A. in Art from the University of Texas at El Paso and later an M.A. from New Mexico State University. Enriquez taught art to students at Bowie H.S. for 34 years before retiring to devote himself full-time to his art. He completed a commission on nine mural panels for the new El Paso Chihuahua baseball stadium that opened in April 2014. In addition, the El Paso Museum of Art hosted a retrospective of the artist's work, "Metaphors of El Barrio.” Another exhibit featuring Enriquez's work as an artist educator was held at the Reuben Center at the University of Texas at El Paso.Enriquez' art portraying the Chicano lifestyle is exhibited nationwide. The murals drafted for Fort Bliss represent his first military themed designs. Visit Gaspar Enriquez' official website for additional information about this artist here. Recent articles profiling Mr. Enriquez can be found here and here. Locations

Spc. Hugo V. Mendoza
Soldier Family Care Center
East Fort Bliss, El Paso, TXThe Mendoza Soldier Family Care Center (SFCC) is the largest of four medical facilities of its kind in the Army. The $42.5M facility opened in 2010 to serve 38,000 active duty military, their families, and veterans.


The site
for the mural at the Mendoza Soldier Family Care Center is magnificent. Two
stories high, the dimensions measure 26'H x 23.5'W. Located at the entrance to
the facility, the wall is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows that flood the
space with natural light. There are no vents or other obstructions for the
mural. Traffic entering and exiting the building will have full view of the
mural. 

The proposed image will focus on the relationship between parent and child - the tension between fulfilling both the duty of the mission and the responsibility for loved ones at home. 

Sgt. Joshua W. Soto Physical Fitness Center
East Fort Bliss, El Paso, TX





The Soto Fitness Center is the largest fitness center in the Army. It opened in 2010 to serve soldiers, their families, and DoD employees. According to the latest statistics available, in 2014 the facility received 1,700 visits/day with 616,000 total visits during 2014. In addition to daily visitors, tournaments, competitions, and soldier orientations for deploying and returning soldiers are held at this location.

The two murals at the entrance to the Soto Fitness Center will be located on the adjacent wall spaces directly above the reception area. The walls measure 20'H x 73'W and 28.5'H x 74.25'W.
One of the murals will prominently display the 1st Armored Division crest as well as featuring personnel and equipment representative of the division’s multi-branch modular units. The other will showcase an El Paso scene featuring a church located on one of the historic Fort Bliss sites.
The juxtaposition of the combat scene and that of the local El Paso community represents the long history of Fort Bliss and El Paso. The murals also represent why the military is fighting, for Americans and American communities like El Paso. In addition, the El Paso scene reminds visitors of the region where they live and gives them a sense of place.



Freedom Crossing Grand Food Court 
Fort Bliss, El Paso, TX


While the Mendoza and Soto locations are
restricted to Department of Defense (DoD) cardholders, Freedom Crossing is
open to the general public. It is the first ever open air shopping center on a
U.S. military installation. In 2014, there were an estimated 1 million
visitors, 65% military affiliated and 35% civilian.
The
location at Freedom Crossing was recently added to the project to increase the
number of local civilians who would interact with the murals, welcoming them as
guests to this military installation. The theme for this mural is expected
to focus on the vibrant long-standing partnership between Fort Bliss and the El
Paso community. 

For pictures of this location, please visit the Gallery tab located at the top of this page.

story:
Queens of Style, March 5 

We dare you to find a better way to celebrate International Women's Day than this. Female artists from up and down California and neighboring states will come together to showcase their skills in artistic expression. A feast for the eyes and the soul, through art work, live painting and performances, they will elevate the space together in one place.


We are excited to announce that Dj Agana and other members of the Few and Far Women crew will be present to share their gifts and create a live mural. Other event guests include student artists, spoken word artists, vocalists, musicians and more.  


Without the community, the Urbanists, Urban Art Collective would not be able to do the work we do. So in that same spirit of community, in addition to the arts and entertainment, we are also inviting service providers offering valuable community resources to come hang out with us and connect with the public.  


A panel discussion is also scheduled on the morning of March 5 that will feature four well-known successful artists from outside of the area to share their stories, inspire us all, and answer any questions. Help us make this happen!  

 


Where do the funds go?

We need to raise $5,000 to make this event HAPPEN. The money we have raised so far through grants and other donations is only enough to cover the venue logistics such as space rental, portable restrooms, waste services, etc. We are asking for your help to cover the travel costs of the guest artists, purchase art materials for the artists and community to participate, feed our guest artists and volunteers, and purchase promotional items that people can walk away with to later think back and remember the excitement and inspiration they felt at this event.

We thank you in advance for your financial support. The success of this event will all be attributed to your generosity and commitment to the arts.

There are some pretty cool perks being donated by participating artists if you choose to contribute. Make sure to read through them all and take advantage of the limited edition artwork before it's gone!

In a nut shell:

  • More art materials
  • Panelist stage & design
  • Artist transportation & lodging
  • Artist food

Powerful Impact

With your help we will achieve our goal of inspiring young women to awaken and embrace their creative energy. Our hope is that our audience will be influenced by the arts and find new creative ways to express themselves. We also want to help raise more awareness about the valuable resourses in our community available to women and families.

Please visit our website blog and instagram or jump straight to our Taste the Arts 2015 video to find examples of our community impact. You can also chase hashtags like #LumberYardSessions and #ArtBrigade for real time examples.



Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help us spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools.

  • Follow us on instagram/@urbanistscollective #queensofstyleevent and please repost event news and updates.
story_txt:
Queens of Style, March 5 
We dare you to find a better way to celebrate International Women's Day than this. Female artists from up and down California and neighboring states will come together to showcase their skills in artistic expression. A feast for the eyes and the soul, through art work, live painting and performances, they will elevate the space together in one place. 
We are excited to announce that Dj Agana and other members of the Few and Far Women crew will be present to share their gifts and create a live mural. Other event guests include student artists, spoken word artists, vocalists, musicians and more.  
Without the community, the Urbanists, Urban Art Collective would not be able to do the work we do. So in that same spirit of community, in addition to the arts and entertainment, we are also inviting service providers offering valuable community resources to come hang out with us and connect with the public.  
A panel discussion is also scheduled on the morning of March 5 that will feature four well-known successful artists from outside of the area to share their stories, inspire us all, and answer any questions. Help us make this happen!  
 




Where do the funds go?We need to raise $5,000 to make this event HAPPEN. The money we have raised so far through grants and other donations is only enough to cover the venue logistics such as space rental, portable restrooms, waste services, etc. We are asking for your help to cover the travel costs of the guest artists, purchase art materials for the artists and community to participate, feed our guest artists and volunteers, and purchase promotional items that people can walk away with to later think back and remember the excitement and inspiration they felt at this event.We thank you in advance for your financial support. The success of this event will all be attributed to your generosity and commitment to the arts.There are some pretty cool perks being donated by participating artists if you choose to contribute. Make sure to read through them all and take advantage of the limited edition artwork before it's gone! 

In a nut shell:


More art materials
Panelist stage & design
Artist transportation & lodging
Artist food

   Powerful Impact

With your help we will achieve our goal of inspiring young women to awaken and embrace their creative energy. Our hope is that our audience will be influenced by the arts and find new creative ways to express themselves. We also want to help raise more awareness about the valuable resourses in our community available to women and families. 
Please visit our website blog and instagram or jump straight to our Taste the Arts 2015 video to find examples of our community impact. You can also chase hashtags like #LumberYardSessions and #ArtBrigade for real time examples.

story:
Short Summary

We need "seed" money to feed the 2016 Sarus bird:

  • The SARUS FESTIVAL is an annual event organized by the ALBAN ELVED DANCE COMPANY, a 501-c-3 non-profit charitable organization based in Wilmington, NC. It is curated by Karola Luettringhaus and managed by a small staff and a larger "nest" of collaborators. 
  • We aim to create a community of dancers, actors, video makers, visual artists, performance artists, and musicians who interact with the local community in Wilmington, NC and the surrounding areas.
  • July 7-10th, 2016 will be the 5th festival. Artists from both the US and abroad have performed in past festivals. Venues have ranged from Carolina Beach, Cameron Art Center, Bellamy Mansion, Cucalorus Headquarters, Greenfield Lake, and much more.
  • We need $1600 to get our budget on the right course for this year! We are choosing a theme of "sweet 16" as a metaphor for getting us driving independently on the road to financial success. We have 16 days to raise $1600 in order to achieve the first phase of our development plan. Following this event we will host a live fundraiser and festival preview in April. The event will take place at Ironclad Brewery on April 30th in Wilmington. We will also be applying for art grants and corporate sponsorships in order to round out our financial plan for 2016. YOU can help us with this first phase!

What We Need & What You Get

  • To start with, we are looking for artists to support art. That's why we have so many options for small donations. Artists can help by giving as little as $10.
  • We want interested audiences to help produce. We need interpreters, investigators, and innovators to join us in our quest towards a workable budget.
  • There are many choices and options for different wallet sizes. See the information listed in the Perks.

The Impact

  • Funds from this kickoff event will go to payment for publicity, venues, administration, and 2016 artists. You will see the fruition immediately as the Sarus Festival grows its presence in print and online. You can also track venues as they are confirmed on our website and social media platforms.
  • The Sarus Festival will continue to bring together both neophyte and mid-career artists to create and perform in multiple artistic mediums from across the United States and abroad.

Risks & Challenges

  • We have been operating with minimal funding and need help at all levels to be successful in producing this festival. The donation pipeline is crucial to our advancement and longevity.
  • We WANT to pay artists!
  • We also want to be able to pay staff what they are worth and not rely fully on volunteerism.
  • The Sarus Festival produces high quality art and needs sound financial footing to maintain the caliber of work necessary to compete in a contemporary art market. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Artists are wanted to create and sell innovative merchandise at our live fundraiser/festival preview event on April 30th.
  • If you live in the Wilmington, NC area then you can join the Sarus Nest group. They meet monthly to discuss ideas and actions relative to the festival. If interested email sarusfestival@gmail.com
  • Volunteers are always needed at festival in July. Contact sarusfestival@gmail.com

story:
This is the story of how I found myself. I found what truly inspires me.

I have been doing research on visual perception for over a decade, learning about the visual system and how it interacts with our higher-level cognitive functions. Later, I started practicing meditation and studied how it affects our brain and our perceptions.

Then one day I asked myself: What moves me? What  really inspires me?

I looked inside myself and it came to me...

I wanted to share with others what I felt was inside of me, the feeling of being in the moment, of breathing the colors and sounds, and the extraordinary sense of oneness with nature. My photography is the process of understanding with all the senses and the body: feeling like the flower in the sun, being the drop of rain.

And Nature’s Atelier is all these things,  all the colors and forms that give me  incredible energy and joy.


                    


Nature’s Atelier is a celebration of mindful living and our deep connection with nature.

My approach to photography is contemplative. It emphasizes simplicity and the aesthetic experience found in our natural environment. My images embody the beauty of the sensory experience: light, composition, and colors reveal the natural beauty and harmony found in nature, celebrating its sensual experience.


                               



The goal of this campaign is to fund the production of Nature’s Atelier Mindful Living textile products: the tea towel collection is printed and sewn in USA and the silk scarves collection is printed and sewn in Italy.

    


Each photographic image used on these products is a contemplation of nature. A harmony of colors and lines of delicate flower patterns are then digitally printed on natural fabrics: cotton /linen blend and silk that will then become tea towels and scarves.

                    


                    


The technology of textile digital printing offers exciting new ways to translate the nature's beautiful details onto fabric. This process gives an excellent reproduction of photographic images onto textiles. It offers a more rich experience of colors and great detail.

Using this process I can offer a more rich and immersive experience of my nature photography by creating beautiful textile products.

                             

Life is a sensory experience and I believe in creating and developing products that can nourish our senses.



THE TEA TOWEL COLLECTION

I have created nine designs for the tea towel collection. Each design represents a heart-centered quality inspired by nature.


I have printed samples of the tea towels in US. The tea towels are made of a cotton/linen blend and are digitally printed by a company in Durham, North Carolina and sewn in Fall River, Massachusetts. The feedback on these tea towels has been very positive! A retailer in Providence, Rhode Island now carries the first collection of Mindful Inspirations tea towels.
 

Kreatelier store - Providence, RI



THE SILK SCARF COLLECTION

As a scarf lover, I was inspired by the idea of printing my images on silk, as a way to combine the warm and luxurious sensation of wearing a soft scarf with the vibrant colors of flowers and leaves. I have created six designs for the silk scarf collection, inspired by the diverse color palette of the seasons. The samples I have printed show the beautiful and rich colors of the fabric.

Agave - silk crepe de chine



                                                         Tulip Petals - silk satin



                                            Japanese Maple Leaves - silk crepe de chine



                                                                     Rosy - silk satin


                                                     Winter Flowers - silk crepe de chine


                                                       Bird of Paradise - silk satin


The silk scarves are made of 100% silk: satin has a more shiny finish and crepe de chine has a matte finish. The scarves will be digitally printed and hand hemmed by a manufacturer near Como in Italy. Internationally known for their expertise and craftsmanship, the manufacturer delivers premium quality textile products.

The scarves are available in two sizes: 20.5in square (Rosy, Winter Flowers, Bird of Paradise) and 36in square (Agave, Japanese Maple Leaves, Tulip Petals). They come in a tube package with a card of the original photo with caring instructions.




What We Need & What You Get

The textile collections of tea towels and scarves are currently only available for wholesale.

I need your help to produce the Nature’s Atelier line of textile collections and launch them on the retail market!


My goal is to raise $20,000.00 to launch the production of silk scarves and tea towels. With your help I will be able to place orders for large and more cost-effective production runs.

Raised funds will be allocated to:

-  The cost of fabric printing and hemming

-  Packaging and shipping expenses

-  Marketing targeted at increasing awareness about Nature’s Atelier philosophy and products.

-  Test new designs and products

-  Research and test sustainable and innovative materials for our future products

I plan for Nature’s Atelier to be a sustainable business. For this reason I intend to ensure the best quality of my products and work with manufacturers that share my passion for quality and commitment to social responsibility.  


New Bedford, MA

Fall River, MA

The use of digital printing allows for a photographic print with high amounts of detail and no limitations in color. This ensures the great quality in the reproduction of macro photography on my textile products. This type of printing also entails very little waste of fabric, ink, water or electricity. It uses eco-friendly, water-based inks on with no additional chemicals in the printing or preparation process.

Nature's Atelier is committed to researching new sustainable materials to manufacture their products. With your support I will be able to test new materials and natural fabrics for our products such as hemp and bamboo. I also plan to offer vegan alternatives to the silk scarves for future collections, by testing prints on soy silk and ahimsa silk fabrics.


You can help the Nature’s Atelier project grow into an ethically sensitive business and support my commitment to creating high quality products using sustainable methods.

      

                                 

                                                        $5 Lily

A big thank you for your support and a surprise promotional code to be used for a future online purchase at Nature's Atelier!

                                                    

                                                     $10 Daisy

                         


                                                     $25 Tulip

One 8x10 print of your choice mounted on single weight matboard signed on the back. I will personally contact you by email to confirm your specific choices, once you select a perk.

                                                         

                                                         $40 Ginko

One tea towel with the design of your choice + one 5x7 print of your choice (see above photographs from #01 to #06) mounted on single weight matboard. Signed on the back. I will personally contact you by email to confirm your specific choices, once you select a perk.

                          


                                                         $100 Maple

Two tea towels with the design of your choice + one 8x10 print of your choice (see above photographs from #01 to #06) mounted on single weight matboard. Signed on the back. I will personally contact you by email to confirm your specific choices, once you select a perk.


                                                     $150 Chestnut

Four tea towels with the design of your choice. I will personally contact you by email to confirm your specific choices, once you select a perk.


                                                       $100 Rose

One  20.5" square silk scarf  with the design of your choice: Rosy, Winter Flowers, Bird of Paradise. I will personally contact you by email to confirm your specific choices, once you select a perk.

             

                                                        $150 Orchid

One 36" square silk scarf with the design of your choice: Agave, Japanese Maple Leaves, Tulip Petals. I will personally contact you by email to confirm your specific choices, once you select a perk.


                                                      $500 Jasmine
One 11x14 photograph by Erika Scilipoti or your choice printed on aluminum, signed and numbered. I will personally contact you by email to confirm your specific choices, once you select a perk.


 



                                                   $1.000 Hibiscus

Collaborate with the founder Erika Scilipoti on the creation of your Nature's Atelier scarf! Choose what inspires you in nature and the colors you love and name your new scarf. You will receive two silk square scarves, the size of your choice. This new design will be part of an exclusive limited collection named Mindful Collaborations and your name will be included on the website.


                                                   $10.000 Lotus

Fly to Providence and enjoy three days of mindful experiences in Providence, Rhode Island with the Nature's Atelier Team!

The tour will include the following activities:

- Visit to Seven Arrows Farm in Seekonk, MA

- Meditation, music, and creativity with Khipra Nichols

- Contemplative walk with Erika Scilipoti

- Special gift by Nature's Atelier

Details: We will pay for one ticket, in economy class, using a major airline of our choice and provide accommodation for four nights. If you wish to fly business or first class, or bring a friend or significant other, or use another airline of your preference, you will have to pay for the extra costs yourself. If you will be flying in from outside the USA, you will be responsible for complying with US immigration law. We cannot and will not offer legal advice on how to pursue a US visa. We will do our best to accommodate everyone's schedule with ample advance notice. However, should you be unable to participate in the workshop due to scheduling issues, immigration issues, or other reasons, the perk purchase is non-refundable. 


Add-ons and Adjusting Your Pledge

If you’d like to upgrade your perk to a higher-priced perk, you can do so by following the steps in the link below:

How to Upgrade Your Perk

Or you can pledge multiple perks follow the instructions in the link below:

Add a Perk


The Impact

With this project I wish to bring awareness to the restorative effects that natural environments have on all of us, offering relaxation, improving our mood and cognitive functions, and stimulating our creativity. I believe that a more mindful way of living, such as slowing down to see and enjoy our surroundings with all our senses and body, will encourage a deeper appreciation of our natural environment.

            




                     This work is the expression of the depth of my heart.
           It is my desire that my products will speak to your heart, your mind,
                                                       and your love for life

                           


Nature's Atelier is a sustaining member of the Association of Nature and Forest Therapy Guides and Programs




Risks & Challenges

The manufacturing companies that will print and hem the scarves and tea towels are well known for the excellent quality of their work. I have created samples of the scarves and tea towels to test for quality of the products and was very impressed by the result. For this reason I am very confident that the manufacturing companies in US and Italy will deliver excellent products.

The potential challenges that could arise may only be due to production delay for large orders that may take a bit longer, in particular for the scarves which will be hand hemmed in Italy. For this reason I have calculated enough time for the production, packaging, and delivery of the orders.

In the event of potential production delays by my primary manufacturers I have already identified other manufacturing facilities who will be able to fulfill the orders. For the tea towel production they are located in Massachusetts and Pennsylvania and for the scarves production they are located near Como, Italy. In this way I will be able to avoid delays without compromising the quality of my products.

                                                                  SHIPPING

PLEASE NOTE: Duty charges: If you reside outside of the USA, you will be responsible for any applicable duty charges applied at shipping.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you love this campaign but cannot contribute financially, you can still help Nature's Atelier succeed! You can endorse my project simply by sharing on Instagram and Facebook and sending an email to your friends & family. 

Share the love of nature and help me get the word out about Nature's Atelier!


Don't forget to follow Nature’s Atelier on Instagram and Facebook for further updates; and if you have any questions, don't hesitate to reach out to me at info@erikascilipoti.com

Thank you so much!

Erika Scilipoti

Founder

In this way I will be able to avoid delays without compromising the quality of my products.                                                                  SHIPPINGPLEASE NOTE: Duty charges: If you reside outside of the USA, you will be responsible for any applicable duty charges applied at shipping.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you love this campaign but cannot contribute financially, you can still help Nature's Atelier succeed! You can endorse my project simply by sharing on Instagram and Facebook and sending an email to your friends & family. Share the love of nature and help me get the word out about Nature's Atelier!Don't forget to follow Nature’s Atelier on Instagram and Facebook for further updates; and if you have any questions, don't hesitate to reach out to me at info@erikascilipoti.comThank you so much!Erika ScilipotiFounder

story:
About the production

Paper Doll Militia are bringing their show, LoopsEnd, to a number of venues and two festivals in the UK. The company are committed to bringing circus arts to as many people as possible, both in terms of watching their shows, but also trying out circus for themselves, but need your help to make sure that happens.

THE SHOW

LoopsEnd, a darkly magical production, weaves dynamic physicality, high quality visuals, and projection into a contemporary circus spectacle.  With director Al Seed, Paper Doll Militia captures a unique story which unfolds in 3 parts. Both chaotic and neatly timed, LoopsEnd delves into cyclical oppression, friendship, betrayal and the dangerous fixations of a quirky ensemble.

The performers envelop you in their otherworldly environment where gravity is more a suggestion than a law. Appealing to audiences of all ages and languages, LoopsEnd has its foundations in universal human concepts, told with enticing visuals and non-verbal unfolding narrative. With a diverse use of mediums and aerial apparatus, the stage is continuously transformed.  A true journey of the human spirit, LoopsEnd shows us a mirror of our own experiences reminding us of our collective grit and strength.

THE TOUR

LoopsEnd  will be featured at two leading theatre festivals (Manipulate and Vault) as well as several theatres across Scotland. This tour marks a unique opportunity to showcase circus arts in a genuinely broad range of venues to a number of audiences. As part of our commitment to ensuring this is the case, we'll be leading circus workshops (more about that later).

We will be taking LoopsEnd  to the following places over the next couple of months: 

Manipulate* – Traverse Theatre // 02 Feb 

Cumbernauld Theatre // 13 Feb 

Eastwood Park // 15 Feb 

Byre Theatre // 20Feb

Vault Festival** – The Vaults, London // 24-28 Feb 

The Brunton // 02 Mar 

*Manipulate – Traverse Theatre (Edinburgh) 29 Jan – 06 Feb – www.manipulatefestival.org

manipulate Visual Theatre Festival is produced by Puppet Animation Scotland who champion visual theatre, puppetry and animation in Scotland. manipulate Visual Theatre Festival audiences and Scottish-based artists enables to see and engage with world-class visual theatre and animation.

**The Vault Festival, Waterloo (London) – 27 Jan – 06 Mar – www.vaultfestival.com

Vault Festival returns to The Vaults, Waterloo in January - March 2016 to bring the most eclectic, engaging and unforgettable six weeks of underground arts and entertainment. 


THE COMPANY

The child of four artists in Santa Fe, Paper Doll Militia has its roots in circus, original music, puppetry and dreamy, whimsical, dark storytelling. 

Paper Doll Militia’s innovative approach to choreography and poignant use of theatricality have gained the company the reputation of being pioneers in original aerial theatre. Their pieces seamlessly weave dynamic physicality, aerial arts and visual theatre. They emphasize the mixture of modern and vintage mediums, as well as invented aerial apparatus, to create their signature aesthetic; dreamy, whimsical and dark. LoopsEnd was developed by the company during their time as Artists in Residency at Summerhall in 2013/14.

Committed to education and championing the art form they work in, the company also works as choreographers and aerial consultants in projects in India, Egypt, Croatia, the UK and the US.

WORKSHOPS AND ENGAGEMENT 
At the heart what PDM does is its education strand and this tour is no different: we currently hope to hold four workshops alongside LoopsEnd. 
In each location, there will be an open taster workshop for participants of any age or ability. These workshops are focused on using circus as a medium to engage participants and foster creativity, self-esteem, empowerment, and to encourage the spirit of solidarity. Paper Doll Militia has extensive experience in running these workshops, having undertaken training in the area. 
In lower income areas, the workshops will be available at a highly discounted rate as we passionate believe that circus arts needn't just be for professional athletes or dancers. However, our commitment to bringing our work to as many communities as possible during the tour brings with it extra production costs, which is why we are crowdfunding. 

What We Need & What You Get

To ensure each of our participants gets the best experience possible during the sessions, the workshops themselves have a limited capacity. In supporting this campaign, you'll be allowing us to bring circus arts to as many people as possible while still ensuring the production is successful. If we're not successful in our target, any funds we do get will be used to achieve this.

Risks & Challenges

Circus arts is a daring art form and we're excited to share our boldest production yet with you. LoopsEnd  has already been seen at the New Orleans Fringe Festival so we are confident in the production and, as mentioned above, our set of workshops to go alongside the shows. Alongside our producer, Ed, we bring with us a wealth of experience in theatre and performance and so have experience overcoming challenges in production, such as illness. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that not everyone can back us financially, but if you could support us in other ways that would be great too: please do share this on social media and mention our project to friends, family and any potential circus arts enthusiasts.

Thank you!

Team Paper Doll Militia

story:
In 2009 I was laid off as a lead designer for a large company, when the market collapsed. I was able to receive unemployment for a few months and had started a small design business, as a way to utilize my college degree to the best of my abilities without feeling it was going to waste.

My family and I had lost everything during those months, and to this day we are still rebuilding what we had lost. I spent all the money I had left to buy a computer that I could do my graphic design work on. I have one steady client that pays me very minimal wages and what ever work I can pickup throughout the way on my journey.

The overhead cost for my business is very little being I work from home, but had always felt that a store front studio would be the best, I could bring in more business. Word of mouth has been ok, and all my work that I have ever had has come from word of mouth, but its nothing compared to a store front business in my opinion.

My goal is to someday open a store front business with my graphic design. A place where the atmosphere is fun and a place where people may just want to come and check out and most importantly a place that i would be able to provide a living for my family once again. Any help would be greatly appreciated, my wife and my 6 year old son would be very grateful for this as well.

PLEASE note that if there's anything I can do in return to help someone else along the way please feel to contact me and I will do my best to be of some help to others that maybe in need of something I can offer.

Thank you and love to you all,

Troy

story:
Hello, I'm Tammy  @ Warp a Weaver.

I am thrilled to be following my passion for the age-old traditional art form of weaving and I want to invite you to join me. In addition to the good feeling of supporting and sustaining this beautiful tradition, I'd love to give you an original unique textile treat and/or gifts of song (see full range of offerings both below and to the right for donations from $15 to $2500). 

I am eager to attend weaving school debt-free and be able to immediately come home and share this unique craft with our community. 

Thank you for your donation and encouraging your friends to each donate, for example sharing this link on your FaceBook page would be a big help.  And after you take a moment to donate and share with others I hope you'll go sing, dance, play music, make art, go for a walk, enjoy nature, and follow your passions whatever they are! 

 
 Go confidentially in the direction of your dreams!   Live the life you've imagined. ~Thoreau

The Väv Immersion 16 week weaving course is the only one of its kind in the USA.  I am one of four weavers chosen to participate in this prestigious program. The class, which begins on February 1st in Shelburne Falls, Massachusetts, will focus on traditional and modern Swedish weaving, design and business skills for weavers.

During the past 15 years I've had great success as a beginning weaver.  With my basic skills I have been able to create gorgeous and practical dish cloths, tea towels, table runners, scarves, and blankets. Family and friends delight in using these heirloom-quality textiles on a daily basis.  I smile when loved ones are snuggled warm under a blanket I wove especially for them.  During the past few years I was surprised and encouraged when not just once, but twice, former weavers gifted me with their gently used Swedish Glimåkra Looms. 


Perks!!!
You get something out of this too!  The great thing about crowdfunding is you help me and I share my weaving with you in appreciation.

Fiber Gifts... 

About Color and Shipping:

COLOR:  Although the dish cloths and tea towels are not made to order, you CAN indicate your color preference after you choose your perk.  In your message share your 1st and 2nd preference of Weft Colors: 

Natural (linens,whites)

Warm (reds, orange, yellows)

Cool (violets, blues, greens) 

Playful Color Mix (anything goes - Dish Cloth only!)

SHIPPING:  Shipping of all textiles is FREE within the USA.  If your textiles are to be shipped outside of the USA, extra fees are applied.

$15 Weaving Wool Wonders

Weaving potholders is not just for kids.  In this class you will weave one or more potholders with beautiful woolen loops.  You will choose from a multitude of patterns, creating a heirloom quality potholder that will beautify and serve your kitchen for decades!  Indicate your date preference in your message: Saturdays -  July 23, 30 or August 6, 2016 * 9-11:30 am  Materials fee to be paid at class: $10 potholder loom & $7 woolen loops per potholder.  Ages 9-109!!!


$15 USD   Warp Threads

Without the Warp, one has no structure to weave upon! Your gift is the foundation of this project. You will receive an electronic thank-you note with a photo of my weaving and an invitation to follow my weaving adventure through my Warp a Weaver writings.


$25 USD    Weft Threads


Without the Weft, one can not create fabric as the Weft Threads are woven over and under the Warp Threads. You will receive a thank-you note with a photo of my weaving via US Mail and an invitation to follow my weaving adventure through my Warp a Weaver writings.


$  50   Weave Your Very Own Dish Cloth!!!

Come to my weaving studio in Ann Arbor, Michigan.  Choose your colors.  The loom will be warped and ready for you to weave.  Whether you have woven before or this is your first time, with just a few brief weaving tips, you will be blissfully weaving your very own cottolin dish cloth!  After your purchase you will receive an email to determine the date of your weaving!  This is the perfect gift to give to yourself or a dear friend!


$  50   One Handwoven Dish Cloth

$135   Three Handwoven Dish Cloths
$240  Six Handwoven Dish Cloths

Beautiful, practical, stain-resistant, odor-resistant, long-lasting - 5-10 years
Use as a dish cloth, face cloth, or wash cloth
Handwoven with Swedish linen and cottolin on a natural cottolin warp

@10 by 12 inches




$185    One Handwoven Tea Towel
$350   Three Handwoven Tea Towels
$500   Six Handwoven Tea Towels



Heirloom-quality, Swedish designs, super absorbent, large European sizing
Use as a tea towel, dish towel or bread cloth
Handwoven with Swedish linen and cottolin on a natural cottolin warp

@20 by 30 inches


$2,500  One-of-a-Kind Heirloom Blanket

Warm, soft, beautiful, cozy, handwoven heirloom blanket 

Together we will design your one-of-a- kind heirloom blanket.  You will have the opportunity to select your favorite colors, choice of three weaves (plain weave, twill or herringbone) and finishing touches.   

Your blanket will be woven from a lush, soft wool.  And if possible in keeping with my goals of a fibershed,  the yarn will be chosen from wool that is locally grown, processed, dyed and spun.  

You will forever delight in the warmth and lushness of your unique heirloom blanket.

@48 by 72 inches 


Musical Gifts....

Singing

$45   Songs of Gratitude, Love and Life

3 Fridays - January 1, 8, 15, 2016

$90   Songs of Gratitude, Love and Life

1st Fridays - July - December, 2016

Sing together with Tammy!  Singing songs, rounds and chants of gratitude, love and life.  You are sure to return home with a happy heart!  You will also receive an electronic thank-you note with a photo of my weaving and an invitation to follow my weaving adventure through my Warp a Weaver writings.   
7:00pm - 8:30pm.  @ Tammy's home in Ann Arbor.

Piano Lessons

$135   3 Piano Lessons - 30 minutes - Get started!

$455   13 Piano Lessons - 30 minutes
$910   26 Piano Lessons - 30 minutes


Piano lessons with Tammy. Using the Snowman's Dream Piano Method, you will find a fun way of learning to read music with games crafted to create ease and success while learning a skill that will last a lifetime.

Tammy's studies with pianist/pedagogist/composer Brett Youens allow her to bring you into reading music with joy. Snowman's Piano Dice Game Book included for first-time students OR one handwoven dishcloth for returning students.  

Available: mid-June - mid-Dec 2016 @ Tammy's home in Ann Arbor.




Funding Basics 

Crowdfunding allows people to follow their dreams without going into debt.  It's like the old-fashioned barn-raising...when we help others emotionally, physically, and financially, it's easier on everyone. And we are happier when we help one another!

My goal is to be debt-free.  The total estimated cost is $15,000.  This will cover the tuition, materials, room, board and transportation for the 16 weeks of class. 

Imagine if 100 people donated $150 - my goal would quickly be met!  Or if 300 people each shared $50!  

You can give at a level that is both comfortable and generous to you!  

And in return you not only know that I'm on my way to Vävstuga, you can choose from a beautiful handwoven dish cloth, tea towel or wool blanket to enjoy daily in your home.  There are also musical perks to delight your heart while singing and allow you to read music with ease.

When you donate, you will receive a thank-you note with a photo of my weaving, plus you will be invited to follow my weaving progress through my Warp a Weaver writings.  And upon my return you will be welcomed to an open house where you may view all the amazing textiles I wove at Vävstuga and celebrate the opening of my new cottage business!


The $$$ Details....


Course fee: $9,500

Materials fee: $ 1,000 - $3,000  (woven pieces will be charged by weight)

Room & partial board: $1,950 (breakfast for 16 weeks, lunch & supper for 7 weeks)

Additional board: $1,000 (lunch and supper, 9 weeks plus 16 weeks of food to meet dietary needs)

Travel: ?  ( transportation to Shelburne Falls, MA, from Ann Arbor, MI -  3 times - to get there and back plus returning home twice for the weeks of no class)


Risks and Challenges

Warp a Weaver relies on people like you to spread the word.  A fundraiser is successful because you share and help it grow!  As you and others share this campaign widely, it will travel to thousands of homes and be a success!

Some of the yarns I weave with no longer have their labels.  In most cases I can easily distinguish linen, cottolin and cotton from one another.  Yet occasionally I may be fooled and a bit of cotton thread might trick me into believing it is linen or cottolin, thus finding it's way into a dish cloth.

Before and after the Immersion class, I will balance teaching music lessons, directing the Threshold Choir of Ann Arbor, running a household, living the good life, and weaving all the Perks.  It is a lot! I have friends and family supporting me emotionally, keeping the house clean, offering occasional meals and singing with me to be up to the challenge of remaining healthy, positive and fully embracing this project to create a debt-free weaving education.  I've already started weaving dish cloths and towels as my thank-you to you and by my best estimation believe they will be completed by the end of November 2016.


Other Ways You Can Help


Tell others about my campaign.  Share my story with friends, family, and even new people in your life.  Warp a Weaver! 

Write to me occasionally to remind me how awesome I am.

Share on Facebook, Email, and send a Tweet, use social media to tell ALL of your friends about Warp a Weaver!

Have lunch with Dan, he could use a bit of company for the 16 weeks I'm away weaving.


Cottage Weaving

Weaving nurtures me as an artist and is an amazing mental and physical activity!

My goal as a cottage weaver is to produce items for the home that are beautiful, practical and a joy to use.  I plan to continue my focus on textiles for the kitchen and bath along with warming scarves and blankets.  

Local fibersheds, where fiber is locally grown, processed and made into textiles all within a radius of 150 miles, are popping up all over the USA.  Several fiber artists are already selling locally created textiles in Ann Arbor.  I plan to work together with fiber farmers, processors and artists to create a Southeastern Michigan fibershed. 


And imagine your dreams...then bring them to life!

As soon as you take time to pursue a dream, your life wakes up and everything has meaning.  ~Barbara Sher

Take time to awaken your dreams and passions!  You deserve it!  Listen to your heart and become who you've always imagined!

Surround yourself with the dreamers and the doers, the believers and thinkers, but most of all, surround yourself with those who see the greatness within you, even when you don’t see it yourself. ~Edmund Lee


With gratitude to my loving, creative and supportive family!


            Allegra Corwin-Renner, Daniel Corwin and Emily Corwin-Renner

           Hiking in the Norwegian mountains with Peter Vold - Autumn 1999

$90   Songs of Gratitude, Love and Life
1st Fridays - July - December, 2016



Sing together with Tammy!  Singing songs, rounds and chants of gratitude, love and life.  You are sure to return home with a happy heart!  You will also receive an electronic thank-you note with a photo of my weaving and an invitation to follow my weaving adventure through my Warp a Weaver writings.   

7:00pm - 8:30pm.  @ Tammy's home in Ann Arbor.

Piano Lessons



$135   3 Piano Lessons - 30 minutes - Get started!
$455   13 Piano Lessons - 30 minutes$910   26 Piano Lessons - 30 minutes

Piano lessons with Tammy. Using the Snowman's Dream Piano Method, you will find a fun way of learning to read music with games crafted to create ease and success while learning a skill that will last a lifetime.



Tammy's studies with pianist/pedagogist/composer Brett Youens allow her to bring you into reading music with joy. Snowman's Piano Dice Game Book included for first-time students OR one handwoven dishcloth for returning students.  
Available: mid-June - mid-Dec 2016 @ Tammy's home in Ann Arbor.



Funding Basics 

Crowdfunding allows people to follow their dreams without going into debt.  It's like the old-fashioned barn-raising...when we help others emotionally, physically, and financially, it's easier on everyone. And we are happier when we help one another!
My goal is to be debt-free.  The total estimated cost is $15,000.  This will cover the tuition, materials, room, board and transportation for the 16 weeks of class. 
Imagine if 100 people donated $150 - my goal would quickly be met!  Or if 300 people each shared $50!  
You can give at a level that is both comfortable and generous to you!  
And in return you not only know that I'm on my way to Vävstuga, you can choose from a beautiful handwoven dish cloth, tea towel or wool blanket to enjoy daily in your home.  There are also musical perks to delight your heart while singing and allow you to read music with ease.
When you donate, you will receive a thank-you note with a photo of my weaving, plus you will be invited to follow my weaving progress through my Warp a Weaver writings.  And upon my return you will be welcomed to an open house where you may view all the amazing textiles I wove at Vävstuga and celebrate the opening of my new cottage business!
The $$$ Details....

Course fee: $9,500
Materials fee: $ 1,000 - $3,000  (woven pieces will be charged by weight)
Room & partial board: $1,950 (breakfast for 16 weeks, lunch & supper for 7 weeks)
Additional board: $1,000 (lunch and supper, 9 weeks plus 16 weeks of food to meet dietary needs)
Travel: ?  ( transportation to Shelburne Falls, MA, from Ann Arbor, MI -  3 times - to get there and back plus returning home twice for the weeks of no class)

Risks
and Challenges


Warp a Weaver relies on people like you to spread the word.  A fundraiser
is successful because you share and help it grow!  As you and others share this campaign widely, it will travel to thousands of homes and be a success!
Some of the yarns I weave with no longer have their labels.  In most cases I can easily distinguish linen, cottolin and cotton from one another.  Yet occasionally I may be fooled and a bit of cotton thread might trick me into believing it is linen or cottolin, thus finding it's way into a dish cloth.
Before and after the Immersion class, I will balance teaching music lessons, directing the Threshold Choir of Ann Arbor, running a household, living the good life, and weaving all the Perks.  It is a lot! I have friends and family supporting me emotionally, keeping the house
clean, offering occasional meals and singing with me to be up to the
challenge of remaining healthy, positive and fully embracing this project to
create a debt-free weaving education.  I've already started weaving dish cloths and towels as my thank-you to you and by my best estimation believe they will be completed by the end of November 2016.

Other Ways You Can Help



Tell others about my campaign.  Share my story with friends, family, and even new people in your life.  Warp a Weaver! 
Write to me occasionally to remind me how awesome I am.
Share on Facebook, Email, and send a Tweet, use social media to tell ALL of your friends about Warp a Weaver!

Have lunch with Dan, he could use a bit of company for the 16 weeks I'm away weaving.

Cottage Weaving

Weaving nurtures me as an artist and is an amazing mental and physical activity!
My goal as a cottage weaver is to produce items for the home that are beautiful, practical and a joy to use.  I plan to continue my focus on textiles for the kitchen and bath along with warming scarves and blankets.  
Local fibersheds, where fiber is locally grown, processed and made into textiles all within a radius of 150 miles, are popping up all over the USA.  Several fiber artists are already selling locally created textiles in Ann Arbor.  I plan to work together with fiber farmers, processors and artists to create a Southeastern Michigan fibershed. 

And imagine your dreams...then bring them to life!



As soon as you take time to pursue a dream, your life wakes up and everything has meaning.  ~Barbara Sher

Take time to awaken your dreams and passions!  You deserve it!  Listen to your heart and become who you've always imagined!
Surround yourself with the dreamers and the doers, the believers and thinkers, but most of all, surround yourself with those who see the greatness within you, even when you don’t see it yourself. ~Edmund Lee



With gratitude to my loving, creative and supportive family!




            Allegra Corwin-Renner, Daniel Corwin and Emily Corwin-Renner
           Hiking in the Norwegian mountains with Peter Vold - Autumn 1999

story:
Please note! The crowdfunding campaign has ended. All contributors will receive cards - guaranteed - they are now in production...
 
If  you have arrived here too late to contribute to the crowdfunder, you can now pre-order direct from my online shop. 

Please watch the video first... It's only 3m30s. It shows exactly how the cards work.

This set of 44 hand-drawn cards is designed to stimulate creative thinking, help you solve problems and identify clear goals and actions. They are also a powerful tool to stimulate conversations at networking events and business meetings.

Where and when can these cards can be used? 

  • For personal reflection.
  • In networking sessions.
  • For 1-1 and group coaching.
  • Public consultation.
  • Anywhere you need to break the ice and get conversation flowing quickly and without embarrassment.

You can use the cards alone, with a friend or in a group. If you are a coach, trainer or skilled helper, they are an ideal addition to your toolkit. They are a really cool way for like-minded people to work together to generate ideas.

The drawings on these cards are unique, intriguing and loaded with metaphor - so every user will pick, interpret and utilise the cards differently. They are unlike any picture cards you will have used before.

How do the cards facilitate deeper, clearer thinking?

There’s quite a bit of science behind them – illustrated cards have been used throughout history to imagine different versions of the future. Most of our deep thinking goes on without us being conscious of it – metaphor works as a conduit to carry this thinking out into our conscious thought stream. We use around 4 metaphors a minute in normal speech – a metaphor carries over a complex concept in a single word or phrase. These cards reverse that process – we begin with the picture/metaphor and use it to reveal all the hidden thinking that’s going on around an idea or isuue. It’s such a simple and clever tool for generating useful stream of ideas around any given topic.

Why order the cards from this page?

Crowdfunding helps bring useful ideas to life. By pre-ordering the cards from this page you both get the cards and support their development. Buy a set now and you will get them long before they go on sale to the general public.

The story behind the cards

My name is Pete Mosley. I am a speaker, writer and coach specialising in using creative techniques to help people come up with great new ways of thinking about ideas, development and change.

Many moons ago I did a fine art degree and pursued life as an artist in education and community settings for a number of years. I now write, blog and speak about the business of creativity - drawing on thirty years of freelancing - coaching and advising individuals, organisations and small businesses.

These coaching cards started life as a series of doodles – metaphorical images drawn to animate my blog and social media posts. When I did a TEDx talk I decided to illustrate it with my quirky little drawings and they were a hit.

Spurred on, I responded with yet more doodling. My colleagues – professionals in the worlds of coaching, business networking  and the creative industries - started asking if I would turn the images into a resource, something they could use to inspire people, stimulate thinking and help with creative problem solving.

These cards have been produced in response to that request. I’ve designed and tested them thoroughly – in one to one, self-help, group coaching and ideas generation sessions. They’ve passed the test, and here they are.

The testimonials speak for themselves. This crowdfunding campaign is all about getting them out there – into the hands of the coaching and creative professionals that can put them to good use. That’s you, of course. 

The Cards

​The cards are 55x85mm, printed on 350gsm card with soft feel lamination on both sides.  The curved corners make them a pleasure to look at and less susceptible to damage. They are designed for longevity, to feel good to handle, pick up and put down, and move around a tabletop. The boxes are bespoke designed and easy to carry in your bag or briefcase, making the set highly portable for use in the widest possible range of settings.

Here's what people are saying about them:

‘The Art of the Possible cards are brilliant - practical, inspiring and beautiful to hold and use. A vital tool in any coaches' toolbox.’ Sandra Whiles - Creative Coach.
'I love the pictures/words and also the quality of them - both the feel and print quality'. Lucy Hare - Double Bassist & Coach.

'Right off the bat, The Art of the Possible cards prompted our deep thinking, thanks to the combination of words and artful illustrations. Our conversation was meaningful. We used the deck’s simple instructions as  framework for the conversation. We walked away with clarity about our individual expectations and shared challenges related to our latest projects.'  Kate Hammer, Story Designer storyFORMing

How to use the cards

The cards can be used in a whole world of different ways. They are clean, non-directive and encourage creative thinking. Cards can sometimes elicit much more than a question can - here are a few examples:

For networking, consultation and ideas generation:

Working in a group, choose a problem you’d like to solve e.g. how do we get more clients?

  • Spread out the deck – everyone chooses a card which suggest ideas to them.
  • Individually, note down as many ideas as you can that are suggested by the card you chose.
  • Take a round of feedback. Discuss and prioritise.

On your own (when you are feeling reflective, in a cafe, on a journey):

Spread out the cards. 

  • Pick one.
  • What drew you towards that card?
  • What thoughts does it bring to mind?
  • Of those thoughts, which do you want to pay attention to?
  • What comes to mind as a goal or action to move things forward?

To get started with a coaching session:

  • Choose 7, narrow down to 3. What’s the connection? Develop the story of the cards you chose.
  • Let the client choose a card or two. Ask them to tell you what drew them towards those images. Take it from there!

When you purchase the cards you'll get access to a webpage that will show you all the different ways in which they can be used. This page is accessible to everyone that has a set of the cards - and in addition to providing 'how to' information, you'll benefit from other users feedback and be able to add your own comments and ideas for using the cards in a wide range of scenarios. A forum, if you like, for card users to interact with each other. 

'OMG, they are gorgeous! Really fantastic, congratulations! They are all beautiful and some of them have very specifically stayed in my head. I can see how I can use them alone, 1-1, and in pairs or groups.'  Aly King-Smith Coach, BirdTableTech.

My guarantee to you.

You can have confidence in your investment. This my second crowdfunding campaign - the first exceeded it's goal by a long way.

You will receive the cards you order whether or not the campaign reaches its full £4200 goal. I have the flexibility in the production  process to do this. The campaign is an opportunity to get a great idea out into the hands of as many people as possible, and your contribution is great way of ensuring the best possible result. Order via the campaign and you'll get yours before they become generally available.

Questions.

If you have any questions at all - no matter how trivial you may think them to be - email me here. I will respond quickly.

Why am I crowdfunding this project?

I know I'm going to need a bit of help getting the cards out there. Here's what the money is going towards:

  • Design and print costs - to pay the creative people who help me provide you with the best quality products.
  • The costs of designing and producing top quality boxes - I want these packs to last you a long time.
  • Promotion - to ensure as many people as possible hear about the cards and get to use them.

About me

I write about coaching and the business of creativity. I create both online and offline content as business editor for craft&design magazine and prominent blogs in the UK and overseas including Susan Cain's Quiet Revolution website, the Design Trust and Creative Choices.

People love and trust my books and articles. I know this because:

  • My writing is featured on Susan Cain's Quiet Revolution website and my second book, The Art Of Shouting Quietly, is a Cambridge University set text.
  • I get regular feedback from people who have read my stuff and taken action/made progress in their lives as a consequence.
  • My books are Kindle bestsellers and paperbacks are reprinted.
  • I know this material because I've lived it - not because it's of academic interest to me.

Would you like to help?

You can help by:

  • Tweeting a link to this page - or sharing it on Facebook
  • Mentioning it where you can on your own social media, site or blog :)                                           
  • And finally. If you don't want  a set of cards but would like to support the campaign, you can make a donation by clicking the 'Back It' button on the top right of this page.

Thank You!  Pete Mosley 

Main photos: Janet Currie

story:
Short Summary

Our Current project, is the “E.S.B.A. Initiative”, or more poetically, the “Eat, Sleep, Breathe, ART campaign” .

  • My name is Josiah and I am the founder of Can’t Get Right Entertainment and these are the reasons I’m here.

    Many know me by my work with lyricists over the past 7 years: producing, promoting and educating artists about the entertainment industry and the values of pursuing an honest career with a positive message.

    For over 5 years, it has been my passion and personal endeavor to support independent entertainers of all varieties.

    Making music has always been my passion, but experience has taught me that musical talent means nothing if its not recorded on the right equipment and properly promoted.  Since 2009 I've been back in my hometown of Oil City, Pennsylvania.  One of the first things I realized was that there isn't much left here.  During the 2nd World War, we were #3 on the Nazi list of American cities to destroy, because we made the Warheads on the American bombs.  We were an industrial community through and through.  Oil was discovered less than 20 miles away, and Oil Creek runs down our North Side into the Allegheny River.  Now, Quaker State is gone.  The Pennzoil Refinery is gone.  The factories are mostly gone.  The world changed quickly and Oil City wasn't prepared for it.  With no jobs to keep people here, especially young people with fresh ideas on how to spark growth in an area entirely in decline, our population has dwindled to a third of what it was in our prime.  Those who remain, with few other options, have turned to the arts.  Especially music.  Which led me to my second realization... there is too much talent here being allowed to waste away in poverty.

    We aren't just asking you to buy a shirt, or get your name on a banner.  We don't want you to give a group of greedy people $12,200.  We are asking you to support aspiring artists and entrepreneurs that have nothing but music and art to turn to.  Give them the equipment they need to bring their ideas to life and therefore give meaning to their own.  We are asking you to do that, and get yourself an E.S.B.A t-shirt or hoodie to continue to show your support for those artists and entrepreneurs.  That is the impact you can make today.  

    Enjoy a Free Song from Cody Horning; "Back to a Better Time" >>> CLICK <<<

    And Follow Us on Facebook for ALL our LIVE Streams, Open Mic's, Events and Give-Aways >>> CLICK <<< Happening Every Week, All Week Long.

     

What We Need & What You Get


The Impact

This philanthropic initiative we have created will open doors of creativity to members of our community young and old. Our team and all that support us in our historic region have a deep passion for cultural arts and music and have seen fully how it can make a positive impact to so many. 
Our mission is self-serving in the way we receive the joy in earning a living striving for our dreams and self-less as we hope to offer as many of our waking hours bringing joy and hope to our friends and neighbors to show how the love of creativity can truly make the World a better place.
Risks & Challenges

The primary risk we run is reaching an expanded demographic. We are of a smaller population but our influence carries far. If our efforts reach people afar, surly, they too will see the great strides we are making to supporting future generations.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Watch our videos and witness the group effort all in our community are making to benefit Cultural Arts and Music.

And DREAM!! Find what you love, and for the sake of Future Generations and Never stop until you're living it. 

Hope Can't Get Right Entertainment can Help.. just ask*
