story:
Hi, I'm Ron Montoya 

For the past 35 years I have owned and operated many businesses, including sporting goods, software, and color cosmetics. I have always had a passion for creating products that would truly help people. TP-TOO is one of those products.  Not only will you save money, you will greatly help the environment by eliminating  the use of tissue cardboard boxes, and begin recycling toilet paper tubes. There are over 17 billion TP tubes thrown away each year. That’s enough to fill the Empire State Building. Twice!!  That doesn't include the billions of boxes that are also thrown away. That's a lot of trees that turn into a lot of trash :-(   

TP-TOO is made of recycled plastic that can be used over and over again.  Join the cause. Be environmentally smart, while saving money on something that you use everyday. 

The Impact

Since I was a kid, I have never used Kleenex. My parents could barely feed us, let alone provide such costly luxuries. As I got older I never bought Kleenex, but always had to buy toilet paper. Even now that I'm married, I still go for the TP, knowing there are only 50 sheets in a box of Kleenex, while there are 330 sheets in a roll of TP.  Plus, a box of Kleenex can cost $2.50 while a roll of TP  is $0.25 cents.  That's an 800% difference in cost! Designing a tissue box that uses TP rolls made perfect sense!

Challenges

My biggest challenge was getting a patent.  Now that that's accomplished, we need to get the word out.  When people hear about TP-TOO, they totally get it.  All of us, rich or poor, have blown our noses on toilet paper, and now we can help cut the excess use of paper materials from using tissue boxes. With your help, we can get this to the big-box stores and start protecting the environment and our beautiful trees.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe TP-TOO is a  great product that improves the way we use toilet paper (something we can't live without), please help me spread the word by sharing it with friends, family, and social media.  

Thank you.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise money to manufacture and market TP-TOO. It will be "MADE IN THE USA" because I strongly believe Americans should make things in America. That's what made this country so great.

To thank you, we are offering a special discount to all who participate in this project.

I am confident you will love TP-TOO and that it will benefit your everyday needs. We will continue to move forward with this product until our goal is met. TP-TOO is fully patented and will become a house-hold name. 


Purchase The Economy Pack of 3 For $20.00 (regularly $7.95ea)

This rugged little box can go anywhere in your house, office, or even your car! Unlike regular tissue box covers, this has a bottom so the paper will not fall out. It loads from the top and is covered by a lid. Made of high-impact plastic, it is virtually indestructible and designed to last a long time. It will save you money, shopping time, and a whole lot of trees!!  Great for every room of your house, apartment, office, or work space. 



The Mirrored TP-TOO only 250 available

This beautiful mirrored tissue holder will look amazing on any special girl's vanity! Look glamorous while saving money and the environment on something you're using everyday!


The Executive Leather TP-TOO only 250 available 

Everyone wants to contribute to the cause and save money everyday by using TP-TOO,  even VIPs.  This executive leather tissue holder will look great on any desk or in any office. Show that you care, and look good while you're at it!



The Swarovski crystal TP-TOO only 100 available

For those who want and deserve it all - Glamour and Glitz!  This gorgeous limited edition is for those who want to save money, the environment, and look damn good doing it!

story:
Hand Painted Silk Scarves for Breast Cancer Survivors

We are artists from the Vancouver Applied Arts Center in Vancouver, Canada, a centre providing art related employment opportunities for disabled women. We have an awesome inaugural opportunity to hand paint silk scarves for the Nite of Hope breast cancer fundraising event to be held on 16 April 2015. Our project has two options: 

1. To paint 150 silk scarves only for the breast cancer survivors attending this event; or

2. Should funding allow, to paint 450 silk scarves, one for each guest attending this event.

Our priority is to raise a minimum of $5,000 of the overall funding goal so that we can complete the painting of the first 150 silk scarves.

You can view images of some of the hand painted silk scarves in the video, the Gallery at the top of the page, or on our website at www.appliedartscenter.com.

This art project is important in so many different ways:

  • This is an important employment opportunity for disabled women who usually struggle to find, or keep everyday work because of their health. 
  • We will be creating a beautiful product by hand painting silk scarves in a variety of original designs.
  • We will be offering an amazing gift to the breast cancer survivors attending the Night of Hope breast cancer fundraising gala in April.
  • This will positively & directly benefit the Nite of Hope breast cancer fundraiser.
  • As it is our first project, it will be the important stepping stone to build the road map for the Vancouver Applied Arts Center to provide future art related employment projects.

The Vancouver Applied Arts Center was started by Liz Burnett, an artist running an art & jewelry related business in Vancouver.  She believes that art is a powerful force that can be used to help a woman find her creative inner spirit, its voice and through this, her personal empowerment. This arts centre focusses on applied arts as its direction.

What is Applied Arts?
Applied Arts is the art of taking ordinary functional objects, such as dinnerware, ceramic tiles, umbrellas, furniture, etc, and embellishing these objects with artful designs. This creates something unique, raises the product's value and ultimately, its desirability, without losing its function. Hand painted silk scarves are examples of applied arts where you start with an ordinary white scarf, then turn this into an extraordinary, beautiful and colourful accessory.

Some background info about us
Currently the Vancouver Applied Arts Center is being operated from a private art studio. However, the long term vision is to provide a large communal production workshop and studio space for disabled women who wish to pursue their art in a user friendly area built to fit their physical requirements. The overall desire is to offer women with such difficult life circumstances, opportunities to gain personal empowerment through self-employment in the applied arts industry.

But, first things first: we have our absolutely awesome first art project to complete. 

What We Need & What You Get

To paint 150 silk scarves for the breast cancer survivors attending the Nite of Hope event, will cost $5,000.  This is our top most goal.

Should enough funding be contributed, we can go ahead and paint one for each of the 450 attendees of this event. To paint 450 silk scarves will cost $16,000. 

To be able to complete this project, we need funding support from you. These funds will be spent as follows:

  • art supplies, such as silk, paint, brushes, stretcher frames, equipment
  • studio tables
  • labels & packaging
  • studio rent
  • pay the artists for their beautiful hand crafted work. After all, the mission of the Vancouver Applied Arts Center is to provide art related employment opportunities for disabled women, so that they can earn their own income.
  • web & social media management - to show the world what we are doing
  • buy gala event tickets - yes, we would love to attend this gala too where we can meet the guests receiving our silk scarves

Our Thank You to You

To say thank you for your support, there are a whole bunch of perks that will certainly appeal to you. You can view images of the perks in our Gallery at the top of this page, or on our website at www.appliedartscenter.com. By donating:

  • $25 - The Zentangle: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a sponsor, and a fun & funky zentangle designed Thank You postcard in the mail.
  • $50 - The Bandana: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a sponsor, a zentangle Thank You postcard, and an original hand painted silk bandana 18" x 18".
  • $150 - The Silk Shawl: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a silver sponsor, a zentangle Thank You postcard, and a large original hand painted silk shawl wrap 11" x 72".
  • $500 - The His & Hers: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a gold sponsor, a zentangle Thank You postcard, and an original His & Hers hand painted silk scarf & bandana, or tie set in a design and colour of your choice.
  • $1000 - the pièce de résistance is The Painting on the Wall: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a platinum sponsor, a zentangle Thank You postcard, and an exclusive, hand painted silk wall hanging of either the national flower of BC: the Pacific Dogwood, or the national animal of BC: the Spirit Bear. Original artwork by artist Liz Burnett.

Our priority goal is to raise a minimum of $5,000 so that we can complete our goal of painting the first 150 silk scarves.

Should the funding support not meet our request, we will be very sad as this will make our task more difficult. Nevertheless, we will still be very grateful for what we did receive, and continue to find a way to complete our project.

Other Ways You Can Help

We ask that you please spread the word and forward this funding campaign to anyone you know who supports quality craftsmanship and women entrepreneurial projects.

To forward this campaign, please use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of this page.

We have an awesome inaugural opportunity to hand paint silk scarves for the Nite of Hope breast cancer fundraising event to be held on 16 April 2015. Our project has two options: 
1. To paint 150 silk scarves only for the breast cancer survivors attending this event; or
2. Should funding allow, to paint 450 silk scarves, one for each guest attending this event.
Our priority is to raise a minimum of $5,000 of the overall funding goal so that we can complete the painting of the first 150 silk scarves.
You can view images of some of the hand painted silk scarves in the video, the Gallery at the top of the page, or on our website at www.appliedartscenter.com.

This art project is important in so many different ways:


This is an important employment opportunity for disabled women who usually struggle to find, or keep everyday work because of their health. 


We will be creating a beautiful product by hand painting silk scarves in a variety of original designs.


We will be offering an amazing gift to the breast cancer survivors attending the Night of Hope breast cancer fundraising gala in April.

This will positively & directly benefit the Nite of Hope breast cancer fundraiser.

As it is our first project, it will be the important stepping stone to build the road map for the Vancouver Applied Arts Center to provide future art related employment projects.



The Vancouver Applied Arts Center was started by Liz Burnett, an artist running an art & jewelry related business in Vancouver.  She believes that art is a powerful force that can be used to help a woman find her creative inner spirit, its voice and through this, her personal empowerment. This arts centre focusses on applied arts as its direction.
What is Applied Arts?
Applied Arts is the art of taking ordinary functional objects, such as dinnerware, ceramic tiles, umbrellas, furniture, etc, and embellishing these objects with artful designs. This creates something unique, raises the product's value and ultimately, its desirability, without losing its function. Hand painted silk scarves are examples of applied arts where you start with an ordinary white scarf, then turn this into an extraordinary, beautiful and colourful accessory.
Some background info about usCurrently the Vancouver Applied Arts Center is being operated from a private art studio. However, the long term vision is to provide a large communal production workshop and studio space for disabled women who wish to pursue their art in a user friendly area built to fit their physical requirements. The overall desire is to offer women with such difficult life circumstances, opportunities to gain personal empowerment through self-employment in the applied arts industry.But, first things first: we have our absolutely awesome first art project to complete.   What We Need & What You Get To paint 150 silk scarves for the breast cancer survivors attending the Nite of Hope event, will cost $5,000.  This is our top most goal.
Should enough funding be contributed, we can go ahead and paint one for each of the 450 attendees of this event. To paint 450 silk scarves will cost $16,000. 
To be able to complete this project, we need funding support from you. These funds will be spent as follows:

art supplies, such as silk, paint, brushes, stretcher frames, equipment
studio tables
labels & packaging
studio rent
pay the artists for their beautiful hand crafted work. After all, the mission of the Vancouver Applied Arts Center is to provide art related employment opportunities for disabled women, so that they can earn their own income.

web & social media management - to show the world what we are doing
buy gala event tickets - yes, we would love to attend this gala too where we can meet the guests receiving our silk scarves


Our Thank You to You
To say thank you for your support, there are a whole bunch of perks that will certainly appeal to you. You can view images of the perks in our Gallery at the top of this page, or on our website at www.appliedartscenter.com. By donating:


$25 - The Zentangle: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a sponsor, and a fun & funky zentangle designed Thank You postcard in the mail.

$50 - The Bandana: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a sponsor, a zentangle Thank You postcard, and an original hand painted silk bandana 18" x 18".

$150 - The Silk Shawl: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a silver sponsor, a zentangle Thank You postcard, and a large original hand painted silk shawl wrap 11" x 72".

$500 - The His & Hers: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a gold sponsor, a zentangle Thank You postcard, and an original His & Hers hand painted silk scarf & bandana, or tie set in a design and colour of your choice.

$1000 - the pièce de résistance is The Painting on the Wall: A huge Thank You on Facebook & Twitter, getting listed on our website as a platinum sponsor, a zentangle Thank You postcard, and an exclusive, hand painted silk wall hanging of either the national flower of BC: the Pacific Dogwood, or the national animal of BC: the Spirit Bear. Original artwork by artist Liz Burnett.


Our priority goal is to raise a minimum of $5,000 so that we can complete our goal of painting the first 150 silk scarves.
Should the funding support not meet our request, we will be very sad as this will make our task more difficult. Nevertheless, we will still be very grateful for what we did receive, and continue to find a way to complete our project.
    
Other Ways You Can Help

 We ask that you please spread the word and forward this funding campaign to anyone you know who supports quality craftsmanship and women entrepreneurial projects.
To forward this campaign, please use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of this page.

story:
Our latest quest for inspiration took us through the looking glass and down the rabbit hole.

With vorpal sword in hand, we fought the frumious Bandersnatch,
And in the fearsome Jabberwock we found a manxome match.

Then deep amongst the slithy toves, at brillig in the wabe,
Rang aloud, a cry, outgrabe:

O frabjous day! Callooh! Callay!

At last, the thing we sought!
We found it, here, alone, in fear.
We found it lost, in thought...

... introducing Mimsy.

Meet Mimsy

Mimsy is an interactive, geometric light sculpture and art car, debuting at Burning Man 2017. Its structure is made of a 12’ diameter dodecahedron enclosing ten intersecting tetrahedra, each uniquely oriented. Steel fabrication of its frame enables the adventurous to climb around and up top, experiencing geometry like never before.

Mini-Mimsy, a fun-sized prototype and test build

The team assembling Mimsy's skeleton at our build space in Oakland!

12,000 3D-mapped LEDs dazzle the viewer with custom patterns, including the world’s blinkiest math lessons. The polyhedron itself has a symmetry order of 120, creating a 3D kaleidoscope-like effect. The node-edge construction enables visualization of graph theory, including Dijkstra’s Algorithm or Hamiltonian Paths. In addition to these new features, our collection of beautiful abstract patterns from Dr. Brainlove is expanding as well!

Renderings of Mimsy's structure-- looking good from every angle

Mimsy at Priceless-- still missing a few thousand LEDs and the car bits

This structure rests on a purpose-built mobile platform with electric drive train, hovering to and fro across the landscape. Befitting the brainchild of Dr. Brainlove, Frabjous, and the Mathematicians of The Phage, Mimsy is on a mission to infect the playa with a love of curiosity and discovery!

The venerable Dr. Brainlove

Where will the money go?

We're raising $8,000  to make Mimsy a reality!

We estimate about $15,000 in total costs for Mimsy, which will cover:

  • $1,000 - Mini Mimsy - a 1.25 meter chandelier version of Mimsy. This was critical for prototyping our designs, and also serves as a stand-alone art piece that can easily travel to smaller festivals and events. You may already have seen it at Steampunk Masquerade or Priceless.
  • $5,000 - Steel Structure - a custom fabricated 12’ diameter, 800 pound steel structure that meets all reasonable safety criteria for a dozen hippies clamber over it.
  • $1,000 - Electronics - the majority of our blinkies are recycled from Dr. Brainlove, greatly reducing costs. Despite this, new art has specific needs, old parts need replacing, and there’s a surprising amount of consumables from year to year.
  • $6,000 - Platform 
  • $1,000 - Comforts - All the finishing touches that make an art car feel like home: shade, plush, signage, night vision cameras… Seriously, who’s going to ride an art car without shade?!?
  • $500 - Transportation - fuel, registration, insurance, the usual.
  • $500 - Rent in SOMA

 

Risks and Challenges

  1. Building an art car from scratch: we do not plan to use a base vehicle for Mimsy. In addition to being drivable, Mimsy needs to safely support around 30 people climbing on it. Luckily, we’re in good hands. The team building Mimsy has successfully constructed two other awesome art cars, Dr. Brainlove and Strangelove.
  2. Mimsy needs to pass DMV inspection at BRC: As is true for all mutant vehicles, there is a small possibility Burning Man's DMV does not grant us a license to drive on the playa. Our project is pre-approved, and we are following all regulations, so we expect the process to go smoothly. If our license is not granted, Mimsy will be moored at the front lawn of The Phage camp as an art installation. Even while stationary, she will serve as an amazing dancespace, interactive climbing structure, and a science education platform!

 

Beyond Burning Man

Education

Mimsy is the perfect vehicle (ha) for STEAM education. We plan to build a smaller, stable version of Mimsy to use for education and outreach, and we’re currently exploring venues to do this through. Also, we previously did a panel at SXSW about Brainlove, which we’d love to do again with Mimsy.

Share the love

The Strangelove/Brainlove/Mimsy family would like to start a sort of lending library of bits and pieces that are useful in building cool things with LEDs. This would allow others within our community to get more involved in building stuff and facilitate *more cool art* on and off playa.

Perks

Our perks include stickers, patches, super snazzy holographic booty shorts, hoodies, and pendants bedecked with the Mimsy logo! We're also bringing back 3D metal pendants of the Brainlove structure. 

(Please note that the images below are digital mockups of the actual perks.)

 

Sets of three different laptop stickers

 

Rainbow Mimsy patches

Pendants

Holographic booty shorts featuring the Mimsy logo

The classic Phage hoodie, with rainbow Mimsy on the back

Flat pendant design (left), and style (right).

An old favorite-- 3D metal Brainlove pendants

 

Who are we?

The Team 

We have an awesome group of 30+ engineers, scientists, and artists working to make Mimsy a reality!

The Phage

The Phage is a diverse consortium of 100+ scientists, engineers, and artists. Our mission is to infect the playa with science. For the past several years we have been located on the Esplanade. Some of the science outreach activities we have run include:

  • On-playa nightly seminar series. Past topics include subterranean communication, the geology of Black Rock Desert, research on love and emotion, defining reality through information, the neuroscience of meditation, and much more.
  • Micro-zoo. We brought an entire zoo of micro-organisms, and the microscopes to watch them here.
  • Ask a scientist. Go on; you know you want to.
  • A giant, musical Tesla coil!
  • Fun with gallium, Fresnel lenses, and liquid nitrogen.
  • Experience One Joule (now you're curious).

  • Suturing workshop. Learn and practice making medical sutures.

Friends

 Mimsy is able to talk to the Tree of Tenere and display replicated or mutated light patterns.  We’d like to give a special shoutout to our friends Mark Slee, Symmetry Labs, and Light Layer. An extra thanks to APL for letting us use your yard to build in!

 

Thank you for supporting Mimsy!

We want to create something truly beautiful that will engage people’s curiosity as they interact with it. We believe that Mimsy will be a museum-worthy piece that will live on and inspire people for decades. 

Please help us spread the word about this campaign! With your generous support, we are confident that we can create something truly unique and awe-inspiring. Hope to see you on the playa and beyond!

Much love,

The Phage

story:
Hello. My name is Dawid Planeta. 

The story is simple, so I'll make it short.

Last year I became depressed. Nothing seemed to have a purpose. Nothing was exciting. My relationship started to fall apart and I was not able to care.

I started to look for something to distract me from negative thinking. I turned towards art, since that's something I've always been good at.

Quickly I found excitement in depicting dark and mysterious depths of my mind. It helped me realize what am I afraid of. I learned a lot.

I posted some pictures on the internet. I didn't expect anything. I didn't think about my art as something amazing. I didn't expect anybody to like it.



But people loved it. I received dozens supportive messages from people who identify with my art, who feel the same way. I want to thank you for all these messages, they are really important to me.



The story continues. We are almost at the end of it.
Among many emails and messages that came to me lately I found this one:


After asking some questions and getting some answers, I knew that in order to take part in the festival I have to pay a fee, pay for a catalogue, print my works, take them to China, stay there for five days and then come back. It's expensive, but it can be the beginning of a whole new and exciting story. I will be grateful for all your help. It would be amazing to write this story together.

More of my art:
tumblr
facebook

 

In order to take part in the festival, there are several things I have to pay for:

  • Hotel and daily expenses – 500 USD
  • Prints – 1400 USD
  • Flights – 1600 USD
  • Exhibition fee and catalogue – 2 500 USD


You have a possibility not only to make something good but also to join a circle of contemporary art patrons. And it's simple! 

As a token of my appreciation I would like to offer you:

    • personalised 'Thank you' digital card;
    • sending you a postcard with the unique picture I'm making especially for the campaign,
      it's going to be a surprise!
    • regular high quality prints – fourteen pictures in three different sizes, signed
    • collectors' prints unique, limited editions printed on high quality archival paper, with certificate of authenticity, signed

     



    IMPORTANT!
    After claiming a regular print as a reward, send an e-mail to dawid.krk@gmail.com with the name you used making donation and
    a number of artwork you choose.
    You can see all the pictures in higher quality on tumblr

     



    Prints I offer you here are unique, limited editions printed on high quality archival paper, with certificate of authenticity. The number given by the author is a guarantee of the quantity of prints in the edition. Each of them is original work, marked with the sequence number of a series, and signed by the artist. Pictures for collectors edition are specially refined in smallest details for highest quality.

     

    Face of fear

    “One challenge at a time, I try to turn into the face of fear and tell it “you are not my master, you are the product of my self and I am your master.” I look into the monster’s eyes until it disappears. Then I am free.” 
    ― Rohvannyn Shaw

    Author: Dawid Planeta
    Print technology: archival pigment print
    Paper: Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Baryta 315 
    Title: Face of fear
    Image size: 43,5×59 cm (17,1×23.2 inch)
    Number in Edition: 7
    Artist proofs: 3
    Total # of the edition: 10
    Year picture was made: 2017

    ONLY THREE COPIES AVAILABLE HERE!


     

    Deep forest

    “Never go into the deep parts of the forest, for there are many dangers there, both dark and bright, and they will ensnare your soul.” 
    ― Robert Beatty

    Author: Dawid Planeta
    Print technology: archival pigment print
    Paper: Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Baryta 315 
    Title: Deep forest
    Image size: 40×60 cm (15.7×23.6 inch)
    Number in Edition: 7
    Artist proofs: 3
    Total # of the edition: 10
    Year picture was made: 2017

    ONLY THREE COPIES AVAILABLE HERE!


     

     

    Power

    “Allow the power to flow through you. Don’t try to capture it. You wish only to borrow it.” 
    ― G.G. Collins

    Author: Dawid Planeta
    Print technology: archival pigment print
    Paper: Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Baryta 315 
    Title: No choice
    Image size: 45,5×66 cm (17,9×26 inch)
    Number in Edition: 7
    Artist proofs: 3
    Total # of the edition: 10
    Year picture was made: 2017

    ONLY THREE COPIES AVAILABLE HERE!


     

     

    Treasure

    “Where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.” 
    ― Anonymous, Holy Bible

    Author: Dawid Planeta
    Print technology: archival pigment print
    Paper: Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Baryta 315
    Title: Treasure
    Image size: 39,5×69 cm (15,5×27.1 inch)
    Number in Edition: 7
    Artist proofs: 3
    Total # of the edition: 10
    Year picture was made: 2017

    ONLY THREE COPIES AVAILABLE HERE!

     

     

    True Love

    “Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.” 
    ― Jalaluddin Rumi

    Author: Dawid Planeta
    Print technology: archival pigment print
    Paper: Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Baryta 315
    Title: True love
    Image size: 44×70 cm (17.3×27.5 inch)
    Number in Edition: 7
    Artist proofs: 3
    Total # of the edition: 10
    Year picture was made: 2017

    ONLY THREE COPIES AVAILABLE HERE!

    For more of my art, visit my tumblr and Facebook.
     


    I'm going to do everything I can to meet the goal, but if I won't make it, thats okay – I will use the money to organize exhibition in different place and probably with more works than I'm planning to take to China. So it's gonna be great anyway!

    All of this thanks to you!

     

    I really appreciate your help, but if you can't or don't want to help, that's okay! I know it's impossible to be good for everyone, so be good for somebody else instead:)

    But there are others way you can help!

    • share this campaign on your Facebook, or send it to someone, maybe they can help, or have friends who can – here is the link: https://igg.me/at/aminipeople
    • share my Facebook page if you think my art is worth it: https://www.facebook.com/minipeopleinthejungle/​
    • live your life the way you want and make beautiful things if you like to!
    • use #minipeople hashtag, I'm not sure how it works but do it anyway;)
       

    Thanks for all your help, support and good will!
    Whether we'll make it or not, you are amazing! 
    Thank you!

share this campaign on your Facebook, or send it to someone, maybe they can help, or have friends who can – here is the link: https://igg.me/at/aminipeople

share my Facebook page if you think my art is worth it: https://www.facebook.com/minipeopleinthejungle/​

live your life the way you want and make beautiful things if you like to!
use #minipeople hashtag, I'm not sure how it works but do it anyway;) 

Thanks for all your help, support and good will!Whether we'll make it or not, you are amazing! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm Shruti Dandekar and I'm a quilter based in a small town Sangli in Maharashtra, India.
You can find me on my website www.shrutidandekar.com and my blog www.13woodhouseroad.com
I am currently a BERNINA Brand Ambassador, an AURIFIL artisan as well as the SAQA Regional Representative for India and SE Asia.

I was a speaker at QuiltCon 2017 (Savannah, GA,USA) where I spoke about "Quilting in India : A review of Siddi Quilts of Karnataka, Godhadis of Maharashtra and Contemporary Quiltmaking in India". The lecture was well attended and received rave reviews.

What I had not foreseen, while researching for my lecture, is the fact that it will generate a thirst in me. A thirst to find out more about the many different regional styles of India. There is so much to be explored! India is a country where the dialect changes every 50 kilometers! The variety in other forms of culture are reflected in the Quilts too.

That is where the dream started to build. A dream to explore the unknown territory. To collect quilts from the quaint towns of India and to build an exhibition of them. And then to travel the world with my exhibit and show it off, proudly! A dream to sell these quilts and make sure that the money raised goes back to the maker, without a chain of middlemen!

You can help me realize this dream.

You can help me bring recognition to the unknown artist from the quaint village of India.

You can help me put them on the international quilting platform.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $8000 to cover the expenses of travelling to these small pockets of rural India and to buy the quilts from the makers. A lot of them are reluctant to even sell them. I will take care of the persuasion myself.

I will then create a travelling exhibit of these quilts and send them worldwide for people to see. Whenever possible, I will try to travel with it myself so that I can explain the history and the story behind every quilt and every style. 

I will also attach a label to the quilt with a picture of the maker and their story!

In return, for your generosity, I will send you various stuff, as per your contribution, that will remain with you as a memory of the wonderful cause that you supported!

If I don't reach my entire goal, I will use the money that I have raised to visit and buy as many quilts as I can and create a travelling exhibit of the same!

The Impact

The makers of these quilts, come from the lowliest of the financial level from extremely rural India. Sometimes, they are not even accepted in the mainstream society due to caste or race based discrimination.

If these makers are empowered financially, by making sure that they get a fair share of the price the quilt is sold at, the households will also be empowered.

It will mean better clothes for families to wear. Better education for the kids. Safer houses for the families!

Getting these quilts on the International platform will also provide them with the glamour that they need. More and more youngsters will start learning this dying art form just to get their picture on the Quilt label.

Even a small donation by you will help me save a dying art form in India.

 

Risks & Challenges

I am funding a large part of the project from my own income. For me, this project is much more than just an exhibition. It is finally an opportunity for me to do something for the society that has brought me up! 

I have grown up sleeping under a Godhadi made by my grandmother from her old sarees. I want the children of the next generation to enjoy the warmth of these quilts. I want them to feel safe when their moms tuck them in bed because their quilt "smells like grandma" for years to come!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share with everyone around you! The more people you reach out to, the more quilt-makers we can help!!!

Find a show where I can send the exhibit to!

Invite me to come talk about them!

story:
WombShip Temple 

Help Build Oregon Eclipse – !!8 DAYS TO GO!!  

Support our temple at the international Global Eclipse Gathering at the Big Summit Prairie in the Ochoco National Forest  (http://www.oregoneclipse2017.com).

What is the WombShip Temple?

We all come from wombs. We all have our own connection with divine feminine.  This space is a sacred place to honor Yin.  It's important to find our inner softness and connection to goddess, especially during times of transition.  

Overlooking the Eclipse stage, up on the hill.  During the day, Eclipse Chasers can take a bit of time to slow down and look inwards.  This space is a bit off to the side on the far side of the lake, so visitors can have a bit more room to relax and let go.   

What We Need & What You Get

We need your donation to make sure we can finish our Temple.  In exchange for your contribution, we would like to share necklace medallions that use the art by Joma Sipe that we are etching into some our windows.  

Are you attending the Eclipse Gathering?

If so,  please join and share your contribution to help build the WombShip Temple that glorifies the Divine Feminine.

You will be part of a worldwide rendezvous of artists, creative visionaries, and high-vibrational beings communing to manifest one of the most amazing gatherings the world has ever known.  WombShip will be a sanctuary to bask in reflection and appreciation of divine feminine qualities. 

  • We need your contribution to this make this once in a lifetime Eclipse event spectacular!
  •  Our expenses in the making of WombShip Temple have gone above and beyond our festival funding and crew members have contributed more than their share. We ask for you to step in and cheer us on. 
  • Eclipse Chasers and festival attendees alike will know your contribution to Eclipse by your laser-etched medallion that features WombShip's window original design. 
  • 100% of your donation will go to directly covering  expenses of the WombShip Temple installation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contribute funding, and that is ok. You can still help!

How? By... 

  • Sharing this message! - The more people who know of our message and need the more likelihood we can reach our goal without making creative short cuts that may save money but might sacrifice some of WombShip's brilliance.  
  • View the astrological event of a lifetime for yourself! Even if you are not able to attend this Eclipse gathering you can still participate by appreciating mother nature's magnificence.
  •  Acknowledging beauty around you raises the love vibration of Earth and her inhabitants as a whole. So, take a moment to smell the roses!
  • You can honor WombShip's intention by appreciating Feminine qualities within yourself and of those around you.

PERKS

These medallions are *only* available through this Indiegogo campaign or given to artists involved in creating the WombShip Temple.  There is no retail cost and they are *not for sale.*

story:
Short Summary

I am Kabir McNeely, the director, writer, and producer of Peter. I've written two films and have directed and produced three.

I've written Peter with the intention of educating people on why cyberbullying is bad and why it's important to be healthy and go to school.

I will produce a major blockbuster that educates youth about the dangers of cyberbullying, overindulging, and video game addiction.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to execute this film, I will need one million dollars. The funds will be allocated to the following areas: set design, prop design, makeup, costumes, hair, food, drinks, lighting, technology, and audio tools (such as microphones).

Donors will have access to special perks including, early viewings, set tours, walk-on roles, and much more. For the full perk list and descriptions, go to the "perks" page.

If my initial goal isn't met, I will continue to fundraise until the film can be made.

The Impact

This campaign has a strong social impact which will encourage a healthy lifestyle and will provide basic guidelines for struggling students.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some of you may not be able to donate money but there are other ways you can help us out. You can raise awareness for this campaign by sharing this campaign with your friends and family. You can also send me link to sites where I can purchase props, lights, costumes, etc.

story:
The main themes are the animals and the history of man and more especially: the tortoise, the donkey and the stork.

You can enjoy a tea by discovering the library dedicated to the history of man as well as works of philosophy, cooking, biology ...
In addition to a large library, the museum will also offer the possibility of renting DVDs, buying postcards, donkey milk soap and homemade jams and cheeses, and many other products from agricultural and craft cooperatives Of the region, but also t-shirts and mini books published in partnership with the artists and associations solidarity of the project,

The site also serves as an  information office on endemic species in Morocco and the associations and individuals who work to preserve them.

 

A percentage on sales is intended for social and educational actions, the main of which remains the distribution of donkeys and mules to women who live alone in the mountains while guaranteeing a veterinary follow-up to the animals of the farms visited during the distribution.

 

 

 

L'espace " Musée de l'âne et de la cigogne "  est un genre de galerie gastronomique, où se rencontre  la cuisine du monde aux autres formes de créations, on y trouve une collections d’œuvres d'art et d'artisanat venant du monde entier .

Les principaux thèmes sont les animaux et l'histoire de l'homme  et plus spécialement : la tortue, l'âne et la cigogne. 

On peut y boire un thé en découvrant la bibliothèque dédiée à l'histoire de l'Homme ainsi que des ouvrages de philosophie, cuisine, biologie ...

En plus d'une large bibliothèque, le musée offrira aussi la possibilité de louer des DVD, acheter des cartes postales, ainsi que du savon au lait d’ânesse et des confitures et fromages fait maison, et plusieurs autres  produits des coopératives  agricoles et artisanale de la région, mais aussi des t-shirts et des mini livres édités en partenariat avec les artistes et associations  solidaires du projet,

Le lieu sert aussi de bureau de renseignements et d'informations sur les espèces endémiques au Maroc et les associations et personnes qui travaillent pour les préserver.

Un pourcentage sur les ventes est destiné à des actions sociales et éducatives dont la principale reste la distribution d'ânes et de mulets aux femmes qui vivent seules en montagne tout en garantissant un suivi vétérinaire aux animaux des fermes visitées pendant la distribution.

story:
For the most up to date project progress and lots of pictures please check out our Facebook page and Instagram!

Inspired by Strandbeests, the original dream machines of artist Theo Jansen, the PlayaBeest will be a 10ft tall, steel, pedal-powered walking machine weighing over 2500lbs that will be unleashed on Black Rock City at Burning Man 2017!

The inspiration for PlayaBeest comes from the original Strandbeests - kinetic, wind-powered sculptures constructed with PVC tubing that have been wandering wind-blown beaches since the early 90s. Their eerie, life-like motion and animal-like structure walks the line between art, engineering, mechanics, and biology.

The key science behind these incredible creatures is the geometry of the leg mechanism. Each leg has 11 segments defined by  13 dimensions that allow the sculptures to glide smoothly across the earth.  Jansen aptly refers to these "13 holy numbers" as the Strandbeests' genetic code.

Jansen released this "genetic code" out into the wild with the hopes that others would continue the evolution of the Strandbeest by making their own creatures in their own vision.

We've decided to take on this challenge by designing, building, and bringing some kinetic, interactive art to Burning Man 2017!

Additionally, we love making kick-ass things we can ride on, especially big, iconic and beautiful things that can be shared with our community to enjoy.  Just checkout Nate’s last project where he set a world record flight at Red Bull Flugtag in 2013!

Bringing the PlayaBeest to life requires over 2500 lbs of steel, and hundreds of bearings, bolts and nuts.  To break even, we need to raise $10,000 to cover the cost of materials, build space, and transportation.  If we exceed our goal we would love to add some kick-ass lights to allow the PlayaBeest to roam around at night.

Last summer we came up with the crazy idea to build PlayaBeest just 2 short months before Burning Man. We recruited all the volunteers we could find, launched an Indiegogo campaign, and worked as hard as we could to get the Beest up and walking. We made an incredible amount of progress and brought the Beest to the Playa but unfortunately we weren't able to finish it in 2016. We returned from Burning Man with many lessons learned and immediately got right back to work.

We are extremely grateful to all the contributors to our 2016 Indiegogo campaign and without their help there is no way we could have pulled this off, but we have now spent more than double what we raised last year. We are launching this new campaign in an effort to help try to cover some of the additional expenses we have incurred along with the costs of storing and transporting this Beest to and from the Playa this year.

This project wouldn't be possible without your support. Check out our awesome list of perks we've come up with as a way to say thank you for your help. If you can't contribute money, please take a moment to share the campaign with your friends and family as every bit helps!

story:
Soutenez une compagnie de danse unique en son genre et travaillant avec des artistes hors du commun !

Maï(g)wenn et les Orteils est une compagnie de gigue et de danse contemporaine travaillant avec des artistes professionnels différents et marginalisés (syndrome de Williams, syndrome d'Asperger, syndrome X fragile). 

Chacune des chorégraphies est créée très intuitivement, utilisant comme unique matériau les interprètes, leur bagage, leur vécu et la relation qui naît entre eux et la chorégraphe, produisant ainsi des oeuvres vraies et sensibles, toujours en quête d'apporter sur scène vie et authenticité. http://maigwennetlesorteils.com

Avec pas d'coeur est une création qui pose un regard lumineux sur l'intimité et sur notre droit d'y avoir accès, que l'on vive avec un handicap ou non. Une performance unique de danse, de gigue contemporaine et de chant, interprétée avec une authenticité déstabilisante par des artistes atypiques, portant eux-mêmes leur histoire sur scène.   https://vimeo.com/193302696

Nous rendre jusqu'à la bourse Rideau, à Québec, y présenter ce spectacle, exigera beaucoup de travail. Comme les artistes de la compagnie vivent avec différents handicaps, ils ont besoin de plus de temps que des artistes neurotypiques (sans diagnostic) pour remettre sur pieds un spectacle.   http://www.rideau-inc.qc.ca/repertoire/spectacl...

Comme nous aurons besoin de 60 heures de répétition, cela implique :

  • des frais liés aux salaires des artistes, des répétiteurs et de notre coach de voix
  • le coût des studios de répétition
  • les frais de déplacement, d'hébergement et de repas pour sept personnes durant notre séjour à Québec
  • la location d'un kiosque à la place du marché
  • la création d'outils promotionnels pour représenter notre travail
  • l'embauche d'une agente d'artistes pour faire le travail de représentation de la compagnie auprès des diffuseurs, et ainsi nous donner la chance que ce spectacle parte en tournée au Québec et peut-être même à l'étranger.

Le coût total de cette entreprise frôle les 14 000$... La compagnie déposera des demandes de subventions au Conseil des arts et lettres du Québec ainsi qu'au Conseil des arts du Canada qui, si elles sont retenues, couvriront approximativement 75% des frais. C'est pourquoi nous nous lançon dans une campagne de financement participatif, afin d'amasser la somme nécessaire pour que cette aventure ne cause pas de déficit à la compagnie.

Puisque la réalité financière des jeunes compagnies de danse au Québec est très précaire, votre soutien, même symbolique, est plus que nécessaire puisque qu'il permettra à une compagnie de danse unique en son genre, travaillant avec des artistes hors du commun, de faire connaître son travail à l'échelle nationale et internationale. Une chance incroyable !

Passez le mot et faites circuler cette campagne !

Merci de soutenir la relève en danse contemporaine !

Maï(g)wenn et les Orteils est une compagnie de gigue et de danse contemporaine travaillant avec des artistes professionnels différents et marginalisés (syndrome de Williams, syndrome d'Asperger, syndrome X fragile). 
Chacune des chorégraphies est créée très intuitivement, utilisant comme unique matériau les interprètes, leur bagage, leur vécu et la relation qui naît entre eux et la chorégraphe, produisant ainsi des oeuvres vraies et sensibles, toujours en quête d'apporter sur scène vie et authenticité. http://maigwennetlesorteils.com
Avec pas d'coeur est une création qui pose un regard lumineux sur l'intimité et sur notre droit d'y avoir accès, que l'on vive avec un handicap ou non. Une performance unique de danse, de gigue contemporaine et de chant, interprétée avec une authenticité déstabilisante par des artistes atypiques, portant eux-mêmes leur histoire sur scène.   https://vimeo.com/193302696
Nous rendre jusqu'à la bourse Rideau, à Québec, y présenter ce spectacle, exigera beaucoup de travail. Comme les artistes de la compagnie vivent avec différents handicaps, ils ont besoin de plus de temps que des artistes neurotypiques (sans diagnostic) pour remettre sur pieds un spectacle.   http://www.rideau-inc.qc.ca/repertoire/spectacl...
Comme nous aurons besoin de 60 heures de répétition, cela implique :

des frais liés aux salaires des artistes, des répétiteurs et de notre coach de voix
le coût des studios de répétition
les frais de déplacement, d'hébergement et de repas pour sept personnes durant notre séjour à Québec
la location d'un kiosque à la place du marché
la création d'outils promotionnels pour représenter notre travail
l'embauche d'une agente d'artistes pour faire le travail de représentation de la compagnie auprès des diffuseurs, et ainsi nous donner la chance que ce spectacle parte en tournée au Québec et peut-être même à l'étranger.

Le coût total de cette entreprise frôle les 14 000$... La compagnie déposera des demandes de subventions au Conseil des arts et lettres du Québec ainsi qu'au Conseil des arts du Canada qui, si elles sont retenues, couvriront approximativement 75% des frais. C'est pourquoi nous nous lançon dans une campagne de financement participatif, afin d'amasser la somme nécessaire pour que cette aventure ne cause pas de déficit à la compagnie.
Puisque la réalité financière des jeunes compagnies de danse au Québec est très précaire, votre soutien, même symbolique, est plus que nécessaire puisque qu'il permettra à une compagnie de danse unique en son genre, travaillant avec des artistes hors du commun, de faire connaître son travail à l'échelle nationale et internationale. Une chance incroyable !
Passez le mot et faites circuler cette campagne !
Merci de soutenir la relève en danse contemporaine !

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

We're offering many perks including thanks in the credits, a copy of the finished film, production photos, walk on roles (speaking & non-speaking).

The Impact

Every donation brings us one step closer to making this dream a reality. Taking part in this campaign gives you, the contributor, power over the first step in a long line of future productions I hope to create.

Risks & Challenges

As a small student production, we're facing many challenges the biggest being access to money. We are of limited means but not limited in spirit.  The passion of the cast and crew is what drives this project. Any way you can help our project would be greatly appreciated. Please share this on Facebook, Twitter, etc. It's all appreciated.

story:
Who we are and what is modestly ambitious

modestly ambitious will be the studio space of three international artists: Katerina Eleftheriadou, Greece, works in sculpture introducing socially aware themes through her choice of materials shifting them through her prism of experiences. Riikka Enne is a Finnish born artist working in sculpture and performance. Her work examines the gap between an individual’s experience and the tensions of society through identity politics and material contradictions. Sophia Moffa, born in Italy, works in video, performance and sculpture. She is interested in the relations and tensions between the body, and the socio-political and technological events surrounding society. All three artists came to UK to study in the Manchester School of Art and out of common love for the city, decided to stay and launch their own space.

These three women will pull their resources and passion for contemporary art to host exhibitions and collaborative events. modestly ambitious will offer a space for experimental poetry, music and performance with Manchester based artists to work in collaboration with fine art or to venture deep into their own fields to pull out fresh work. Eleftheriadou, Enne and Moffa combined have exhibited in Europe, Asia and North America with many different galleries and artist lead initiatives. They will invite artists from around the world to take part into modestly ambitious’ residency program and create exchange with international artists to import and export contemporary art. modestly ambitious is dedicated to internationalism in the post brexit uk.

 

With your help, we can create a new platform in Manchester to promote and enjoy a variety of art. Whether you are an artist or an art lover from Manchester or beyond, modestly ambitious is worth the look. With your donation you have the chance to support contemporary artists, contribute to the art scene in Manchester and appropriate art for yourself through our perks.

 

What your donation will help to achieve

We are currently acquiring a space in Northern Manchester, an old general practitioner's office that has character and offers an excellent space for everything modestly ambitious will need. We are currently trying to acquire the space of our dreams as a meanwhile use space to keep running costs low. Our initial budget, £5000, is reserved for transforming the space into a professional and functioning art space. We have reserved money towards advertising the initiative and to set up our first exhibition.

We are looking into other forms of funding, e.g. grants and self-funding, but we need your help to get us of the ground! The more we are able to raise with your help, the more security we have in our firsts steps as a new initiative. Every penny raised will go into the maintenance of the space and running our programs (exhibitions and residency)

Eleftheriadou, Enne and Moffa have a varied skill set that will allow them to run the space successfully: Eleftheriadou has organized community workshops in the Centre for Chinese Contemporary Art in Manchester, worked as curator Marianna Tsionki’s assistant for Modus Operandi in Grosvenor Gallery, Manchester and she worked in educational art programs in Children’s Art Museum in Athens amongst others. Enne has set up exhibitions in private and public institutions like Sprengel Museum (Hannover), Icon Gallery (Birmingham) and TR1 Taidehalli (Tampere) to name a few. She has worked in publicity campaigns for films, exhibitions and co-ordinated pop-up art events. Moffa worked as artist assistant for Atelier Van Lieshout in Rotterdam and Micheal Sailstorfer in Berlin. She also worked in CANVASS in Singapore to facilitate art workshops. Between them they have experience of facilitating, co-ordinating, curating, event planning, publicity and loads more. They have not only exhibited but worked internationally, which inspired them to launch an international residency program. To find out more about their past experience you can find their selected works and CV on their websites:

Katerina Eleftheriadou:http://cargocollective.com/katerinaeleftheriadou
Riikka Enne: www.riikkaenne.com
Sophia Moffa: www.sophiamoffa.com

With your help, modestly ambitious will open its doors early next year, 2018. Even if you couldn't donate, please spread the word with your friends, family and neighbors, art lovers, artists and everyone who you think would need more art in their lives. We want the word of modestly ambitious to spread across every gas station, residence, warehouse, farmhouse, henhouse, outhouse and doghouse so if you feel we are worth your curiosity, please share and care.

story:
Short Summary

Cambry Hicks is a mixed-media artist from Fort Wayne, Indiana. Having worked with several different brands and publications in media and the fashion industry, Cambry has an understanding of what is lacking in these areas. Creating his own platforms such as Indigo Sound/Indigo Lounge, and New, Cambry has diversified the world media by showcasing creatives of color and the LGBTQ communities  The BlackExcellence: #ALLABOUTHAIR project hopes to shed light on young black creatives and business owners, but also normalize black beauty in multiple industries. Creating a platform to showcase the next generation of businesses and creatives as well as positively representing African-American people is very important not only to the media but to our own communities as well.

 
 

What We Need

For the BlackExcellence: #ALLABOUTHAIR project to run smoothly without having to cut corners, we will need $1,000 to effectively complete the project.

40% of the funding will be going to renting the proper equipment (lighting, backdrop) and renting a studio to be able to shoot the project.

30% will be going to paying the crew who will be making the project come to life.

The remaining 30% will be going to printing physical works to be placed in various art galleries and online marketing.

If we DO NOT reach the entire goal, the funding will still be applied to the project but at a later date or we will have to make things happen on a limited budget!

The Impact

The BlackExcellence: #ALLABOUTHAIR project aims to inspire young African-Americans to work hard to achieve their goals by seeing someone young, and someone who looks like them achieving their goals and embracing their natural beauty. With Cambry's other 2 platforms, this project would be an addition to assisting the young black community in a positive light but also be driven to be received by a much larger audience.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk with this project is not being able to complete the project in time for Black History Month due to this lack of funding and support. This is why we need YOUR help! Our turnaround time for having our content shot, sent to online publications, and released will be fairly quick but if we do not have proper funds that could delay the project! We plan to overcome these issues by receiving volunteer help instead of paid work but we want to be able to give to the future of black creatives and black businesses. Not only will your donations be going to fund this project, you will be paying it forward keeping black businesses and black art alive.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that's okay!

Please make sure you share this with all of your friends via social media, and tell people about this project in your local community! This project will be shared across a multitude of platforms online so we want you to share online as well! Also, if you have any suggestions or leads on funding please email cambryh@icloud.com!

Thank you for showing interest and support in our project!

story:
( For English and French versions please go to www.antoniofuentes.org )

 

Antonio Fuentes ( Tánger, 1905 - 1995 ), es un Maestro indiscutido de la pintura del siglo XX. Tras su etapa de estudio y formación europea ( Madrid, París, Florencia, Roma ), vuelve a Tánger a encerrarse literalmente en su estudio de la medina, para no volver a salir hasta su muerte con noventa años. No deja de trabajar un solo día en su obra, pero negándose sistemáticamente a vender o exponer.

Su obra, a pesar del reconocimiento crítico del que siempre gozó, no es aún universalmente conocida debido a su adversión al mundo comercial del Arte 

EL objetivo de esta exposición es rendir un justo reconocimiento al valor e importancia de su obra así como un homenaje personal al artista, en el marco de la Bienal de Venecia 2019 y en un emplazamiento histórico.

La exposición, que presentará más de cien obras de Fuentes que abarcan un siglo de creación,contará con el documental :  " Plaza de los Aissauas, el interior de Antonio Fuentes ", del realizador José Ramón da Cruz.

El presupuesto de organización de estas exposiciones internacionales es muy alto, debido al coste del transporte, seguros y selección de salas. Para garantizar la celebración de la exposición, hemos lanzado este crowdfunding, dado el interés que despierta cualquier exposición de Fuentes .

Para ello, garantizamos un agradecimiento individualizado a los partícipes por adelantado.

Y a los doscientos primeros partícipes, con independencia de su aportación, recibirán por correo el Cartel de la Exposiciónde Fuentes, en una edición limitada de 200 ejemplares en formato Din A4 firmado por el Presidente de la A.C. Fuentes. El cartel se remitirá una vez estén cerradas y confirmadas Salas y fechas de exposición.

En www.antoniofuentes.org pueden ver sus series más representativas, así como documentos biográficos acerca del pintor y textos sobre su obra por críticos y literatos de primer orden internacional. 

 

Alfonso Fuentes

Presidente A.C. Fuentes

story:
La Galería del Pueblo • The Village Gallery is located at 2154 Broad Street, Cranston in the heart of Pawtuxet Village. It is in the middle of a fast-growing destination for Rhode Islanders and visitors. It has a beautiful view of the bay, lots of great eateries and ever friendly residents. 

Why Pawtuxet Village?

Why Pawtuxet Village and why not in what one might consider the "heart of a Latino neighborhood," in an urban setting? The mission of Rhode Island Latino Arts is to build bridges, to connect and expose non-Latinos to the art and culture of our Spanish-speaking residents. We feel this neighborhood would appreciate local Latino arts, and store owners would welcome foot traffic and increased business.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Share this with your friends, family and colleagues.
  • Please donate today! We will be most grateful for your support!
  • We are looking for major investors/donors, but any small amount will help.
  • Support the arts - Buy Local!

We are looking for major investors/donors, but any small amount will help.
Support the arts - Buy Local!

story:
Photograph by Fred Ramos.

The Exhibit/La Exposición

Twenty-five years ago, the Salvadoran Civil War officially ended. The ghost of that war, fought between the FMLN guerrillas and the right-wing, U.S.-backed government, remains today. Mass migration, violence, and demands for justice continue to impact the lives of those who stayed in El Salvador, as well as those who fled to other Latin American countries and the United States. Re:Construcción is an effort to archive these histories through critical conversations and art. The exhibit is a transnational collaboration between individual artists, collectives, and community organizations that work with Salvadorans across the United States and El Salvador.

Exhibits will premier in Brentwood; Hempstead; Queens; Brooklyn; Washington, D.C.; Los Angeles; and El Salvador. We have partnered with community spaces to help present the work and host events, including Latin American Youth Center, Brentwood's Salvadoran Consulate, MayDay Space, and CARECEN Los Angeles. Re:Construcción is the result of two years of planning, discussion, and collaboration. Our hope is that the exhibit can serve as a space of reflection and conversation about the effects of the war, diaspora, and contemporary issues facing Salvadorans in El Salvador and the United States.

The exhibition’s artists include Danny Zavaleta, Oscar Diaz, Patricio Majano, The Fire Theory, Mauricio Esquivel of Virgin Studio, Jose Cabezas, Fred Ramos, Carmen Elena Trigueros Melissa Guevara, and the Re:Construcción Team (Sayre Quevedo, Luna Olavarria Gallegos, Juliana Broad, and Amber Vanterpool.)

* * * * *

Hace 25 años se acabó el conflicto armado en El Salvador. El fantasma de esa época, la lucha entre las guerrillas del FMLN y el Gobierno, apoyado por los Estados Unidos, persiste. Migración, violencia, y demandas por justicia siguen impactando a las vida de aquellos que se quedaban en El Salvador y de los que huyeron a otros países de America Latina y los Estados Unidos.

Re:Construcción es un archivo de esas historias a través de conversaciones criticas y el arte. Re:Construcción es una exposición multimedia interactiva. La obra se enfoca en el legado e impacto del Conflicto Armado en El Salvador y también sobre temas contemporáneos: identidad transnacional, conocimiento intergeneracional y los efectos sociales del conflicto. La exposición es una colaboración transnacional entre artistas, colectivos, y organizaciones comunitarias que trabajan con Salvadoreños en los Estados Unidos y El Salvador.

Re:Construcción es un resulto de dos años de planificación, discusión, y colaboración. 2017 es  un momento critical para reflejar en las consecuencias del Conflicto Armado en El Salvador. Miles de inmigrantes viajan desde El Salvador a Los Estados Unidos aún, podría decirse en parte de resulte de efecto colaterales del conflicto. Además, ellos que vinieron antes tiene que enfrentarse al retórico del gobierno de Los Estados Unidos que simultáneamente vilipendia a refugiados y inmigrantes mientras mantiene conflicto alrededor del mundo.

La exposición estrenará en Brentwood; Hempstead; Queens; Brooklyn; Washington, D.C.; Los Angeles; y El Salvador. Estamos colaborando con espacios comunitarios para presentar la obra y evento incluyendo Latin American Youth Center, The Salvadoran Consulate in Brentwood, MayDay Space, y CARECEN Los Angeles. Re:Construcción es resultado de dos años de planificación, discusión, y colaboración.  Nuestra esperanza es que la exposición puede ser un espacio de reflexion y conversación sobre los efectos de la guerra, la diaspora y temas contemporáneos de los salvadoreños en El Salvador y los Estados Unidos.

Los artistas de la exposición incluyen a Danny Zavaleta, Oscar Diaz, Patricio Majano, The Fire Theory, Mauricio Esquivel de Virgin Studio, Jose Cabezas, Fred Ramos, Carmen Elena Trigueros, Melissa Guevara, y el equipo de Re:Construcción (Sayre Quevedo, Luna Olavarria Gallegos, Juliana Broad, y Amber Vanterpool.)

      

      Carmen Elena Trigueros, "La Lavendera"                     

Needs and Rewards/Necesidades y Recompensas

We have been fortunate enough to receive a $5,000 Transnational Cultural Remittances Grant from The National Association of Latino Arts and Culture, but we still need a little assistance to complete and share the work. The $10,000 we are asking for will offset our team's travel expenses to our different exhibit locations (food, transportation, and housing), as well as the expenses of setting up the exhibit (construction and mounting materials, shipping, and honorariums for artists).

In return for your donation, we are offering a selection of prints from our artists, including Fred Ramos, Jose Cabezas, Danny Zavaleta, Mauricio Esquivel, and The Fire Theory. You can learn more about our artists and see examples of their work on our website.

* * * * *

Hemos sido afortunados de recibir una beca de $5,000 de La Asociación Nacional de Arte y Cultura Latino pero aún necesitamos un poco mas de ayuda para cumplir y compartir la obra que hemos estado preparando para este proyecto. Estamos pidiendo $10,000 que nos ayudará con los gastos del viaje para nuestro equipo (comida, transportación, y alojamiento) y gastos para producir la exposición (construcción, materiales para montar la obra, envío, y honorarios por nuestros artistas).


Para devolverle el apoyo, estamos ofreciendo una selección de fotografías impresas de nuestros artistas incluyendo Fred Ramos, Jose Cabezas, Danny Zavaleta, Mauricio Esquivel, y The Fire Theory. Puedes aprender mas sobre nuestros artistas y ver ejemplos de su obra en nuestro sitio web.
story_txt:
Photograph by Fred Ramos.
The Exhibit/La Exposición
Twenty-five years ago, the Salvadoran Civil War officially ended. The ghost of that war, fought between the FMLN guerrillas and the right-wing, U.S.-backed government, remains today. Mass migration, violence, and demands for justice continue to impact the lives of those who stayed in El Salvador, as well as those who fled to other Latin American countries and the United States. Re:Construcción is an effort to archive these histories through critical conversations and art. The exhibit is a transnational collaboration between individual artists, collectives, and community organizations that work with Salvadorans across the United States and El Salvador.
Exhibits will premier in Brentwood; Hempstead; Queens; Brooklyn; Washington, D.C.; Los Angeles; and El Salvador. We have partnered with community spaces to help present the work and host events, including Latin American Youth Center, Brentwood's Salvadoran Consulate, MayDay Space, and CARECEN Los Angeles. Re:Construcción is the result of two years of planning, discussion, and collaboration. Our hope is that the exhibit can serve as a space of reflection and conversation about the effects of the war, diaspora, and contemporary issues facing Salvadorans in El Salvador and the United States.
The exhibition’s artists include Danny Zavaleta, Oscar Diaz, Patricio Majano, The Fire Theory, Mauricio Esquivel of Virgin Studio, Jose Cabezas, Fred Ramos, Carmen Elena Trigueros Melissa Guevara, and the Re:Construcción Team (Sayre Quevedo, Luna Olavarria Gallegos, Juliana Broad, and Amber Vanterpool.)
* * * * *
Hace 25 años se acabó el conflicto armado en El Salvador. El fantasma de esa época, la lucha entre las guerrillas del FMLN y el Gobierno, apoyado por los Estados Unidos, persiste. Migración, violencia, y demandas por justicia siguen impactando a las vida de aquellos que se quedaban en El Salvador y de los que huyeron a otros países de America Latina y los Estados Unidos. 
Re:Construcción es un archivo de esas historias a través de conversaciones criticas y el arte. Re:Construcción es una exposición multimedia interactiva. La obra se enfoca en el legado e impacto del Conflicto Armado en El Salvador y también sobre temas contemporáneos: identidad transnacional, conocimiento intergeneracional y los efectos sociales del conflicto. La exposición es una colaboración transnacional entre artistas, colectivos, y organizaciones comunitarias que trabajan con Salvadoreños en los Estados Unidos y El Salvador. 
Re:Construcción es un resulto de dos años de planificación, discusión, y colaboración. 2017 es  un momento critical para reflejar en las consecuencias del Conflicto Armado en El Salvador. Miles de inmigrantes viajan desde El Salvador a Los Estados Unidos aún, podría decirse en parte de resulte de efecto colaterales del conflicto. Además, ellos que vinieron antes tiene que enfrentarse al retórico del gobierno de Los Estados Unidos que simultáneamente vilipendia a refugiados y inmigrantes mientras mantiene conflicto alrededor del mundo.
La exposición estrenará en Brentwood; Hempstead; Queens; Brooklyn; Washington, D.C.; Los Angeles; y El Salvador. Estamos colaborando con espacios comunitarios para presentar la obra y evento incluyendo Latin American Youth Center, The Salvadoran Consulate in Brentwood, MayDay Space, y CARECEN Los Angeles. Re:Construcción es resultado de dos años de planificación, discusión, y colaboración.  Nuestra esperanza es que la exposición puede ser un espacio de reflexion y conversación sobre los efectos de la guerra, la diaspora y temas contemporáneos de los salvadoreños en El Salvador y los Estados Unidos. 
Los artistas de la exposición incluyen a Danny Zavaleta, Oscar Diaz, Patricio Majano, The Fire Theory, Mauricio Esquivel de Virgin Studio, Jose Cabezas, Fred Ramos, Carmen Elena Trigueros, Melissa Guevara, y el equipo de Re:Construcción (Sayre Quevedo, Luna Olavarria Gallegos, Juliana Broad, y Amber Vanterpool.)
      
      Carmen Elena Trigueros, "La Lavendera"                     

Needs and Rewards/Necesidades y Recompensas
We have been fortunate enough to receive a $5,000 Transnational Cultural Remittances Grant from The National Association of Latino Arts and Culture, but we still need a little assistance to complete and share the work. The $10,000 we are asking for will offset our team's travel expenses to our different exhibit locations (food, transportation, and housing), as well as the expenses of setting up the exhibit (construction and mounting materials, shipping, and honorariums for artists).
In return for your donation, we are offering a selection of prints from our artists, including Fred Ramos, Jose Cabezas, Danny Zavaleta, Mauricio Esquivel, and The Fire Theory. You can learn more about our artists and see examples of their work on our website.
* * * * *
Hemos sido afortunados de recibir una beca de $5,000 de La Asociación Nacional de Arte y Cultura Latino pero aún necesitamos un poco mas de ayuda para cumplir y compartir la obra que hemos estado preparando para este proyecto. Estamos pidiendo $10,000 que nos ayudará con los gastos del viaje para nuestro equipo (comida, transportación, y alojamiento) y gastos para producir la exposición (construcción, materiales para montar la obra, envío, y honorarios por nuestros artistas).
Para devolverle el apoyo, estamos ofreciendo una selección de fotografías impresas de nuestros artistas incluyendo Fred Ramos, Jose Cabezas, Danny Zavaleta, Mauricio Esquivel, y The Fire Theory. Puedes aprender mas sobre nuestros artistas y ver ejemplos de su obra en nuestro sitio web.

story:
Have you ever been touched by my art?  Have you had an emotional reaction while reading about my story as a self-taught artist,

Have you gotten a different point of view, or learned something about the world or yourself?

 

This cause is to enable me create and insure my classic unproduced art sketches in 2D painting so as for the world to experience my unseen art, the art that made me in a traditional manner, Paintings drawn from an extensive collection of 115 works and reveals the impressive result of more than ten years of dedicated art production. With a limited travel insurance budget and production material I will only be able to produce 18 large paintings.  The project is involving people from Europe to reach classical art paintings from Africa so that they may be touched and felt, both in exhibitions and in people's homes

 

The exhibition places represents Destreet’s original compositions in semi-abstract, inspired by the highly expressive painterly explorations of André Butzer, with the unclear lines and freestyle of Jackson Pollock, and the tight grids and optical illusions of Heimo Zobernig. The dramatic painterly movements customized by Destreet are unified by his enthusiasm for intense color and bold expressive gestures. ‘My Unseen Art’ is an invitation to witness one of east Africa’s most renowned visual Artists.

 

"It would be a revolution to get blind people going to art galleries, people hate them because there is nothing there to touch!" though in my early stages as an artist with no professional painting materials I used to force a surface on plain paper while sketching and  I touch the paper to feel the lines  and intensity.

 

 

Your contribution will give people the opportunity to experience paintings for the first time in their lives.

 

Many people around the world have heard or seen my artworks or even purchased one as a gift but never been able to see the original works which healed my soul when I failed to get scholarship to pursue my engineering bachelor.  Very few in the world have ever touched any of them.

 

If you love art, supporting the campaign will give you a beautiful rendition of a masterpiece of art you can touch, experience different texture and eco fabric, and display as a unique part of a home or office.

If you know or love a visually impaired art lover, you can give them a piece of art to experience what the traditional Ugandan fabric used to be for the first time, and make it more accessible for everyone around the world.

 

If you work in an office or own a business, a striking and unique artwork can impress and show philanthropy to your customers and partners.

 

A small contribution and a referral to your friends will make a great difference in my social artistic lives and enable me showcase in various cities in Europe my new works as well as give free practical art workshops. 

 

Anyone will be able to experience them for the first time through touch, and create their own impressions and opinions during the exhibition closing creative workshops. Make a global impact together with me allows disabled and visually impaired people and anyone interested in art  to personally experience the inspiration, education, and thought-provoking feelings that my unproduced meaningful art creates.

story:
Short Summary

We are the University of Manitoba production class and we invite you to contribute to the development of future Manitoba filmmakers and a psychological thriller-in-the-making. Our campaign is to fundraise for the feature film we are creating this year which involves the exploration of the interior mind-scape of a troubled young woman and the dire implications of not knowing how to reach out for help. We hope you will take part in helping us to achieve a professional level production!
 

The Impact & Challenges

The film explores the psychological entrapment of a young woman when she cannot reach out to gain necessary support. The film endeavours to enter into challenging and dark emotional territory. and our goal is to create that tension between sensitivity and surrealism that is found in the best of the psychological thriller genre.

With heavy topics to explore, we anticipate that there will be challenges. Fortunately, most members of our creative team have worked on other productions and have the experience necessary to see the project through to completion, and to produce a quality film. Many of us have also worked in professional settings in design, acting, cinematography and the list goes on. All in all, we have a highly skilled team that is ready to make a memorable film experience! 
 

Why we need your help!

We are working with a very low budget. Our cast and crew will not be paid for this production, as it is generated within a university class. We are utilizing as many resources from our cast and crew as possible in order to lower our expenses. 

With that said, we need a modest $2,000.00 sum so that we can fund our location rental and pay for the materials we need in order to create special effects within our set design. We also need to pay for equipment and fund craft services for the production.

Any amount will go toward these categories even if we don't reach our goal, so we are thankful for even a $5.00 donation!
 

Perks

Our team is excited about the perks we have brainstormed to give back to you for supporting our film! We are offering such incentives as tickets to our final screening, special thanks in the credits or coming onto the set for a day! Take a look right hand side of the screen! :)


Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute money. There are other ways to help! Please get the word out and make some noise about this worthy creative campaign. Make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!
