story:
Bringing to light the Art of Symeon Shimin

Born in Astrakhan, Russia, on the Caspian Sea, Symeon Shimin (1902-1984) immigrated at the age of 10 with his Jewish family to the United States, settling in Brooklyn, New York. He started drawing two years later and never stopped. Over a prolific career, he created numerous canvases, illustrated over 50 children’s books, created the original Gone with the Wind movie poster, and painted the epic 40-foot-long canvas for the promotion of King Vidor’s Solomon and Sheba.

One of his most acclaimed achievements was the mural Contemporary Justice and The Child, awarded by the Public Works Arts Project for the Department of Justice Building in Washington, DC, where it stands today. Sir John Rothenstein, director of the Tate Gallery in London from 1938 to 1964, said of this mural, “Ardent feeling is given expression in a large and noble design.”

The Art of Symeon Shimin presents for the first time a meaningful perspective of this unique artist whose deep involvement in a quest for justice and human rights was paramount to the way he lived and painted. It includes over 100 plates and photographs, with essays by Josef Woodard and Charles Donelan, as well as an autobiography by the artist. 

The artist's daughter, Tonia Shimin, is a dance faculty emerita at the University of California, Santa Barbara, where she taught for 27 years. She lovingly curated the first-ever total collection of all known Shimin paintings and artworks over many years, joining the personal family collection with images of paintings in private, museum and gallery collections. Only this year she discovered the gigantic painting for the film Solomon and Sheba that was exhibited at The Detour Gallery, in Red Bank, New Jersey where it had been stored for many years.

Symeon Shimin was a vessel for the unheard voices of his time. Those who were shunned, he highlighted; for those who were unseen, he provided a stage. He saw the common man for what he was – beautiful, exceptional, and equal. As a Jewish immigrant whose family fled the Pogroms for Brooklyn, as well as a child laborer himself, he understood that viewpoint personally. 

What We Need & What You Get

After over a decade compiling, curating, writing, designing and editing this book, the main work is done and the book is ready to go to print! We need funding to get the presses rolling: 

To print these beautiful paintings on fine paper with excellent print quality, we're doing an offset run with Star Printers at just over $10K. We're crowdfunding to raise money to be able to print these gorgeous, limited edition hardbound books on thick paper with spot varnish on the amazing art plates. 

The book's production, essays, image reproductions, editing, design and publishing are mostly completed. The promotion and launch phase is still to come. The author has paid and will pay all these expenses; substantially more than double the print cost. 

Any amount raised will defray the cost of printing and allow this beautiful project to be realized. To make things fun, we've come up with some perks we hope you love, with the stunning paintings and drawings by Symeon Shimin as art cards, giclee prints, or even an original drawing! 

Our wonderful nonprofit fiscal sponsor, Art Without Limits, is receiving funds for this campaign so your contributions are tax deductible! Many thanks to Jodi McCleod and everyone at Art Without Limits.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute, but you can still help! Thank you for letting friends know about this sweet collection of an incredible artist who captured and shared his passion for the beauty of diversity, human rights and social justice throughout a key period in American Art from the 20s through the 70s. Help shine the light on an artist of rare insight and rich expression. 

  • Please get the word out about this beautiful book campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools for social media

story:
Who are we?

Beyond Paper is an exhibition organised by 10 graduating students from Anglia Ruskin University's MA: Illustration and Book Arts.

As a group we all have a shared passion for art and illustration. As students from the pandemic era our successes in progressing our work have gone unnoticed - this is where you can come in!

Our exhibition will be a showcase for our MA project works and more, helping us to launch our careers as illustrators and share with everyone the work we have all put our hearts into.

What We Need & What You Get

As an external exhibition we are not receiving finances from the university. Instead we have dug into our own pockets to pay for the venue and art production costs.

However we still need:

  • £150 to cover exhibition insurance for our art works and for your safety!
  • £50 to cover alcohol and food costs for our private view
  • £100 to cover advertising costs - this includes the cost of hosting our website, printing our posters and flyers and any paid promotions we use for the exhibition
  • All additional funds raised over the £300 will be put to use in printing out sticker and prints for our backers as well as for helping with the costs of transporting artworks and installing the exhibition

The Impact

By helping us to hosting an exhibition we are all part of a greater movement of bringing creativity and art into more lives - both for us as artists, the visitors to the exhibition and most of all you as our backers who will have the opportunity to own original prints of new artwork!

Risks & Challenges

As we are hosting our exhibition during the current global pandemic we run the risk of having our exhibition closed due to the pandemic - we also are facing difficulties due to the lack of finacial support from our university.

  • If the exhibition is cancelled we are preparing and online showcase and will still print all rewards and host a virtual 'private view' to meet the illustrators

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Share our crowdfunding link!
  • Follow us on instagram

story:
About the Book

The Golden Dolphin, Rainbow Turtle is a kid's book with spectacular artwork and a mythical storyline inspired by a miraculous vision of a golden dolphin by author and illustrator Jhana Bowen.

The story follows two main characters, Dolphin and Turtle who assist Angel to see if humanity can change course so that the Earth can return to balance.

Sadly humanity isn't ready just yet.

Angel transforms Turtle and Dolphin with magic.

 Rainbow Turtle magic opens humanity sensitively to the full spectrum of human emotion.

Golden Dolphin magic inspires humanity to take action on values that support life. 

The world shifts. The book depicts a new earth where life can be sustained. 

This book will captivate the imagination of children and adults alike, offering a new outlook and a shift in consciousness. Much like Eckarte Tolle’s teachings. 

The book can be used in schools, educational centres, libraries, disability organisations, kindergartens, pre-schools and environmental organisations. It goes beyond the that face our environment, social and political issues and addresses the root cause, unconsciousness. 

Jhana has attended kindergartens and schools to share the message of this book with children and teachers with strong, positive feedback.

About the Author & Illustrator

 

 

Jhana's passion for art and story began in childhood where he attended a Tibetan school in the Indian Himalayas. Fascinated by art, nature and the human spirit, he has studied yoga, meditation, massage, art and transpersonal art therapy. 

He has received government grants for art and environmental events and has mentored students students. 

Jhana holds regular exhibitions of his work in Australia and Internationally. His art is deeply  inspired by the themes of spirit, humanity and nature.

The Risks and Challenges

It takes perseverance to produce a kid's book of substance, quality and heart. To undertake this successfully is a journey with some risks and challenges. 

Juggling day to day commitments, family and the tasks required to produce a book that has already been changing my life, I have had to reorient how I approach everything.

My passion for environment, spirit, art and story ensure I overcome any hurdle that faces me as an author and illustrator. My dedication, intention and purpose are set on creating the finest and best quality kid's book possible.

Where the Money Goes 

The target of $12,600 will fund:

$3600 - To complete remaining illustrations approximately 11 left to complete and writing the story.
 
 $8,000 - Publishing costs for a high quality, full colour,  hard copy book, an E-Book, with print on demand, 1000 pre-purchased hard copies, including ISBN and presence on Amazon.  
 
$600 - Professional photography, video and editing of artwork.
 
$400 - Graphic design and editing.
 
 
In the event the funding goal is not reached, funds will go directly towards publishing costs.

 

What You Get

$2 - Thank you!
$5 - HD Download of Balanced World - Illustration of page 5 from the book.
$8 - E- Book
$17 - Hard Copy of the Book
$25 - Autographed Copy of the Book
$33 - E Book & Autographed Copy of the Book
$45 - Signed Art Print of Turtle
$46 - E-Book & 2 Hard Copies
$50 - Mixed Greeting Card Pack
$104 - Balanced World, Print on Paper 
$120 - Earth & Art Session
$140 - 5 Autographed Hard copies of Book
$160 - Original Sketch of Golden Dolphin
$217 - Balanced World Print on Canvas
$220 - One on One Art Mentoring Session
$5550 - Balanced World Original Painting from the Book

 

How Else You Can Help

Share this message, if you're not in the position to chip in right now, that's ok. You might know someone who is. Share this with someone who can and spread the love. The world needs to shift in awareness and a book like this will support this. The fact you are here is no coincidence. Hit on the share button and let someone you care about and love, know about the magic here.

Hit on the share button and let someone you care about and love, know about the magic here.

story:
Short Summary

The Secret Art of Persuasion is a new learning experience developed by Robert Ishoy, a former instructor at Department of Defense intelligence schools, and his son Justin Ishoy. Robert has combined his 40 years of experience working with government, corporate and religious institutions to develop a comprehensive and innovative program that teaches anyone how to use the secrets of the Art of Persuasion to influence others for the better and to change how they deal with the relationships in their lives. 

What We Need & What You Get

Ishoy Corporation has already developed the core training program online for the Secret Art of Persuasion to include the written lessons, audio presentations and practical exercises. We are seeking additional funds to now develop video presentations to enhance the overall training. The videos will utilize roll players to demonstrate the techniques taught in a visual learning experience. We are also seeking our initial customer base  who can then provide feedback on the training program itself. All donors will receive full and continuous access to the total training program to include all written lessons, all 8 audio presentations, practical exercises, and online discussion boards. In addition we are offering a referral program that enables our donors to receive cash back well above their donation amount.

    The Impact

    Becoming an artisan of persuasion can change the very lives of our customers for the better. The Secret Art of Persuasion is designed to provide all our customers with the know how and expertise to use the higher methods of persuasion to get what they want out of life in a positive way and even change the way they deal with others. The methods taught can be learned by anyone and used in all aspects of life. 

      Risks & Challenges

      We have total confidence in the value of our training program both in content and design. Our greatest challenge will be in marketing our product. Rather than investing large amounts of funds into online marketing schemes we have chosen to implement a generous referral program that will payback our customers and allow for growth by old fashion word of mouth. To be successful with this type of marketing idea we will need to establish an initial loyal customer base and then reward them substantially for helping us promote the product. That is were you come in. As one of our donors you will be receiving all of the benefits of the training program at a fraction of the cost. After this fund raising campaign we will then provide our donors with the ability to earn much more than your donation just for referring the product to others.  

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Tell other people you know about this campaign and the opportunity to learn the Art of Persuasion.

story:
Become curator of our unique non-profit "Spring" event celebrating universe of niche fashion, music, scent and photography. All organized by a team of  creative young artists who are joining their forces and talents to make this show special. Help us to make it happen!


"Spring": Our Vision

SPRING- On the 21 of March 2015 (the first day of Spring)  you can witness  one of its kind show- combined effort of young, creative artists from several fields.
In the unused, historical space of the former department store in Poland, a special happening will take place: HarmonyLab Spring  feat. Chmara.

It is going to be multidisciplinary non-profit project organized by young and independent Polish fashion label HarmonyLab. It announces release of new music video called “Spring” by Bartlomiej Chmara- renowned composer, music producer, guitarist and singer representing experimental, club and improvised music genres.

More on Chmara's music: https://soundcloud.com/chmarachmara


"Spring": Our Goals

"Spring" is not only about fashion and live concert- it is also main theme of the whole event: awakening of senses, fresh and new life approach, fulfiling our dreams and visions. 

On the Saturday's night we can all experience mixture of several art fields in the one, complex vision. Guests are going to meet the universe of music, conceptual fashion, film, photography and even special olfactory installation. "Spring"  is about engaging main human senses: sight, hearing, touch and smell.

The whole performance will end-up with after party incl. sets of minimal-techno and electro Djs, The first screening of new music video “Spring” by Chmara is also going to take place that night. The event is opened to all fashion lovers, media and also other young artists whom we want to support, join forces with and promote. We expect ca. 200 people audience.

With your support and engagement we hope to achieve our goal: special, creative show full of positive energy, great music and fashion.

"Spring": The Team

The Event Team is a group of of dynamic artists responsible for separate show elementswhich together create whole experience:

  • Full fashion show will take place. Twenty ladies and men designs are going to be presented. Majestic and artistic collection is being created exclusively for the event by young, vibrant HarmonyLab label from Poland, in collaboration with artist Lukasz Kulpa—graduate of Buckinghamshire New University. We will also use latex elements provided by ltxclothing.com company, http://www.facebook.com/harmonylab7
  • Kamil Stanislaw Olesiak, the HarmonyLab designer, stylist and fashion director will provide mysterious choreography and vision. Set design will be created by Kamil in collaboration with Weronika Wróbel—scultptor and graphic designer. http://verasparrow.com/ and Karolina Jacewicz.
  • Marzena Bukowska, owner of Bukowska Photography Studio will co-direct the event, prepare lightning and special photoshoot which will be later on presented in official, collectable photoalbum. http://www.bukowska.com 
  • Tomasz Wojtaniec- independent and awarded director and operator will provide filming of the event,
  • Scent is another innovative addition to the "Spring" experience. Aleksandra Cacha—artist and independent nose from Olfactura Studio/PerSeFume and Jakub from HarmonyLab/PerSeFume will create special olfactory installation with main scent which will complete the aura of event. You can try it in our VIP perk! http://olfactura.pl/  

"Spring": Our Needs

We have combined efforts of several Polish artists whose work will be unpaid. We also gained support of important Partner-Embassy Models agency who will provide us with young and talented models.

Additionally, renowned make-up artists and hairdressers will work on non-profit basis. Collaboration in such a team never took place before! We also want to bring second life to the old, forgotten venue: ex-department store.

However, several costs must be covered in order to make the Spring Awakening project truly happen:

  • More new fabrics for the Collection—we will use elements of wool, cotton, chiffon and latex —250 USD
  • Scenography components—installation from metal and glass—250 USD
  • Sound system—400 USD
  • Light system—250 USD
  • Olfactory installation (components, rental of ca. 10 diffusers to scent the whole venue)—200 USD
  • Printing the photoalbum—200 USD
  • Travel and accommodation—we have 20 young models working unpaid, but we need to cover costs of basic accommodation and tickets for those coming from other parts of the country—850 USD
  • Additional costs—rental, after-party handling- 200 USD

Help us to make this unforgettable evening happen in its full format and glory!

"Spring": Support the Art

We cherish our all fans and supporters—everybody who is going to contribute here to ourproject will be mentioned in our official acknowledgements. Our good energy will be also spread!

Main Funders will also receive many exclusive and limited items: copy of our photo album from the event, "Spring" scent created just for the show, pieces from HarmonyLab collection: our top (from perks from 100 USD and more—pictured below) and exclusive versatile MyCompanion tunic in Mecenary Pack. More advantages in our perks description.

Make "Spring" bloom!

Thank you for your support and lot of love! / Team of the "Spring" Event.

story:
"faul" = A R T I C Nr. 15
Wir brauchen Deine Hilfe, um den Druck der nächsten Ausgabe von ARTIC finanzieren zu können.


/Help us fund issue 15. of ARTIC magazine! Theme: faul=lazy,foul/


20 Jahre A R T I C Magazin:

ARTIC. Texte aus der fröhlichen Wissenschaft  Zeitschrift für Kunst und Philosophie vor mehr als 20 Jahren gegründet. Jedes Heft widmet sich einem Thema, das durch das jeweilige Titel-Stichwort repräsentiert wird. Jedes Heft ist ein Konzert unterschiedlichster Text- und Gestaltungsgattungen, begonnen beim materialbasierten Einband, getragen durch ein das Stichwort interpretierendes Layout der Lyrik-, Essay- oder Prosabeiträge (es gibt kein Masterlayout!) bis hin zu den Multiples, die  als Originale ins fertige Heft eingearbeitet werden. 

Artic magazine has a 20 year history. It is published in German with occasional texts in English.  The magazine is part hand made. Each copy includes original work/multiples.  Artic has recently been showcased in a major museum show (http://www.wkv-stuttgart.de/de/programm/2014/querungen/artic/)

"faul" = ARTIC Nr. 15 Erscheinungstermin: Oktober 2015. 


Lass diese Geschichte nicht verfaulen! /Do not let it rot!


The Story so far ...


Nr. 14/12 - Netz   /Net

Einband aus Absperrzaun/Cover: Building site fence 

Layout: Jens Mennicke

Nr. 13/10 - integer /Integer

Einband aus beschichtetem Molton; Cover: Absorptive Cloth
Layout: Alexandra Breitenstein & Anika Rudolph 

Nr. 12/08 - Banause /Philistine

Einband aus bedruckbarer Leinwand; Cover: Printed Canvas
Layout: Felicitas Horstschäfer & Johannes Vogt

Nr. 11/05 - Quecksilber /Quicksilver

Einband aus Plastikfolie, Schwefel und Zinnober-Pigment/ Cover: Plastic foil, sulphur and cinnabar pigment
Layout: Claudia Lo Gatto & Christian Partl

Nr. 10/04 - Stimme /Voice

Einband aus Fliegendraht/Cover: Fly Screen

Layout: rosige Aussichten, Designbüro

Nr. 09/03 - orange

Einband aus Klebefolie in Holzoptik/Cover: Faux wood and drink cap.
Layout: rosige Aussichten, Designbüro


Nr. 08/01 - heilig /holy

Einband aus Wischlappen/Cover: Mop cloth
Layout: oktober kommunikationsdesign, Bochum

Nr. 07/00 - zaudern /dither

Einband aus Schaumstoff/Cover: Foam
Layout: Anita Kolb

Nr. 06/99 - Zorn /anger

Einband aus Photopapier/Cover: Photographic Paper
Layout: Bodo Brandes

Nr. 05/98 - nass /wet

Einband aus Buchbindergaze/Cover: Bookbinding Cotton
Layout: Bodo Brandes

Nr. 04/95 - Bastard

Einband aus Isolierfilz /Insulating felt
Layout: Susanne Schmitz, Leander Scholz

Nr. 03/94 - Gift /Poison

Einband aus Baufolie /Construction foil
Layout: Susanne Schmitz, David Link

Nr. 02/94 - Ausschweifung /Excess

Einband aus Schleifpapier /Sandpaper
Layout: Susanne Schmitz, David Link

Nr. 01/93 - ohne Stichwort /without theme

Einband aus Raufasertapete/ Wallpaper
Layout: Susanne Schmitz, Juli Gudehus

Entwurf aller Einbände: Andreas Drewer


... jedes A R T I C-Heft mit handgemachten Seiten, d.h. es werden in 1000 fertig gedruckte Hefte Originale eingearbeitet:

... each copy with hand made pages; ARTIC incorporates more than 1000 original works in each issue:

z.B/Example:  "Quecksilber" und "integer"


Werkzeuge für die Fertigung original gestalteter Seiten/tools for the original pages:

Wieviel Geld brauchen wir und wofür?/ What is the money for/

Wir brauchen 6000 Euro ausschließlich für den Druck von 
ARTIC Nr. 15 
  • Andere Kosten können wir aus den ARTIC-Reserven finanzieren
  • Redaktionsarbeit und Beiträge (Texte, Bilder, Multiples etc.) werden honorarfrei von den AutorInnen und KünstlerInnen beigesteuert
/Help us cover printing costs of Artic Nr. 15. The rest will be financed from our reserves./
 

 

Warum jetzt? /Why now/

Wir haben es bisher geschafft, ARTIC aus eigenen Mitteln fast jährlich herauszubringen. Dieses Jahr stehen wir vor mehreren Herausforderungen:
  • Erhöhte Druckkosten (inklusive des ARTIC-typischen hochwertigen Papiers und spezieller Weiterverarbeitungen wie Stanzungen, Prägungen und Sonderfarben
  • Leider haben wir keine Zeit mehr für längere Messeauftritte und Akquisition von Anzeigen
  • der starke Preisdruck im Buchhandel erlaubt den Händlern immer seltener die Präsentation "exotischer" Produkte

Plus:
  • Wir möchten crowdfunding auch als Direktverkaufskanal nutzen (-> Perks)
  • Wir möchten Inserate als Perks im crowdfunding verkaufen.

/Yes we have managed to publish ARTIC almost annually. While print has become harder, we do not want to give up in the face of:
- higher printing costs
- reduced print advertising opportunities
-  harder times for "exotic" publications on the bookshelves of book stores. 
Crowd funding should help us sell a larger share of our print run through subscription.  We are also selling ad space as a perk and of course we are looking for generous support from our base and from newcomers to Artic/

 

Was wirst Du in "faul" finden/What is in ARTIC 15 :

80 Seiten/pages mit faulen Texten (Essay, Lyrik, Prosa) und Bildern, z. B.:

  • Interview mit Christian Saehrendt
  • Fotoarbeit von Ed Ruscha
  • Erstdruck einer deutschen Übersetzung von Kasimir Malewitschs "Die Faulheit als tatsächliche Wahrheit der Menschheit"/first German print edition of Malevich's text on "Laziness as the Truth of Mankind"
  • Umschlaggestaltung: Schutzschaummatte (aus Grossistenkisten) mit Blattvergoldung/Cover: Booktrade protective foam and gold leaf.

Themenbereiche, an denen wir zur Zeit arbeiten:

  • Müßiggang und Kunst/ otium and art
  • Arbeit als komplexe und problematische Wertvorstellung/ work
  • Fäulnis und Vergänglichkeit/foulness, decay, sloth
  • faule Kompromisse
  • Neues aus der Tierwelt (Faultier)/ news from paradise (sloths)
  • Utopien


ARTIC Nr. 15 wird auf jeden Fall erscheinen - das ist unser Versprechen an Euch.

Über den jeweils aktuellen Stand der Dinge werden wir Euch über unsere Website und via facebook informieren


ARTIC Nr. 15 will be published in any case. This is our commitment to you. We will keep you posted on our website and facebook page.

story:
Aim of the game 

1. Artist - acquired ( Matej's website ) 

2. Projects - Londonscape & Paperchase - completed
3. Imagery - ready for print - various media 
4. Funds for printing - *piggy bank empty* 
Intro 
Londonscape and Paperchase are my most recent art projects. Both exploring pattern and structure, mundane becoming fascinating colourful and exciting. Some time ago I've remembered this video I used to see on MTV years ago. 
It pretty much sums up the feel and inspiration behind what I've been creating lately. I wanted to take the impressions and images trapped in my head, capture them and allow wider audience to see the beautiful repetition and great feeling of freedom you can experience as a part of urban landscape with it's verticality, mass and scale. Seeing metropolis as the ultimate form of human achievement and celebration thereof is what Londonscape conveys to its audience. 
Paperchase is a natural extension of Londonscape as one can find the same form of pattern and structure in this very different environment. Take a piece of paper, fold it , colour it , place it in front of light; the resemblance to microcosm of urban landscape is uncanny. However, working with paper allows a different more hands-on approach where instead of finding the right image and point of view, one can create it. 
Supplies and print 
The next step is putting the imagery (please have a look below ) into print. 
This is where your support will be key ! Fabrics and print on large scale cost many pennies and I'd be grateful for every single one that will bring me closer to accomplishing what I set off to do when I started. 
I would like to print the images onto silk and create sample scarves and pocket squares. 
As well as having these printed as accessories I'd like them printed on the biggest format canvas my pocket could afford to really add impact. Final prints will be used for exhibitions. 
Breakdown of costs : 
Printing on canvas (Giclée) - app £400-600  (per canvas)
Printing on Giclée paper - app  £400-600  (per sheet)
Printing on silk (scarf ) - £54/£99  ( per scarf) 
Printing on silk (pocket square ) - £30 (per item) 
The Images 
Pocket Square - Visualisation of styling options 


These images that will be used for prints 
Londonscape II

Londonscape I


Londonscape III


Canary Scarf


Paperchase I

Paperchase II

story:
The story

Virginia:
writer, PhD student, artist.

I've been invited on very short notice to attend a great event in Denmark to be a headline speaker and exhibitor with my (ex-VNS MATRIX and cyberfeminist) collaborator Francesca da Rimini and Oakland based sound artist Neha Spellfish. The CLICK festival of arts, science and technology futures is at Culture Yard, Helsingør, Denmark.

You can see the Danish website here: http://www.clickfestival.dk/

We will also be exhibiting as part of their exhibition program.

The theme is:
TRANSCEND: Cyborg politics and transhuman publics'

"From future shock to FOMO, accelerating technological change has disrupted our perception of ourselves and the world around us.

Pervasive computing, genetic engineering, artificial intelligence, drones and robotics, neural interfaces and implants, 3D printing, nanotechnology, big data and ever more technologies are redrawing the boundaries of what it means to be human and what it means to be you.

This year's Click festival sets out to explore questions related to identity and perceptions of reality in a world where humans and technology have merged in unexpected ways."

We have also been invited to London to perform at an event called Transmétic which showcases experimental media works, sound, performance and video art. We will be collaborating there with a whole host of artists.

https://www.facebook.com/transmetic

The short notice means that we are ineligible to apply for any grants, and, while the conference has been extremely generous in providing some funding, we are one airfare short.

I haven't traveled outside of Australia for well over a decade, since I am terribly flight-phobic, but I don't want to limit my life experiences any longer, and the opportunity to collaborate and present at an international conference, one which honours the work of women working with, through and around technology, is one I do not want to pass up.

What am I asking for

I need $2,500 for airfare. That's pretty much it! 

At this point I am supposed to offer perks, rewards. And I have a variety of those on offer. You can see them listed on my campaign. All contributions are rewarded, without discrimination based on the $ value you contribute.

Why?

This project is valuable to me as part of the ongoing work I have been doing for decades around feminism, technology, art. It furthers inquiries into this field, and looks into the future of technology mobilised through art, critical thought, culture, philosophy.

Personally, it contributes to my professional and creative development, and readies me for the next flight! (literally and metaphorically!)
Other Ways You Can Help

I understand this is a very personal call for funding, it's really important to me, I am super excited about what might grow out of this. It will feed into my PhD studies, and it feels like something new for me.

If you can't contribute cash but would like to help, please share on social networks, or through your face to face networks. Indiegogo has a bunch of share tools you can use.

Thanks so much. Virginia.

story:
Cultivamos Cultura is a platform for experimentation and development of shared knowledge in contemporary art. At Cultivamos Cultura we provide conditions to foster your creativity. 

Cultivamos Cultura organizes activities in the areas of production, dissemination, research, education and exhibition related to experimental practices in visual arts. It is also part of our mission to contribute a strong sense of cultural identity by fostering the generation of bonds with the local community and environment. 

We are located in an old farm house at the village of São Luís, within the Soutwest Alentejo Natural Park, on the Atlantic coast of Portugal, approximately 200 Km south of Lisbon. One of the most beautiful locations in Europe!

Every year Cultivamos Cultura holds art residencies and exhibits a selection of artworks created by current residents or produced during past residencies. Our exhibition space is an old barn next to our house. 

These exhibitions are intended to provide a context to the work that is being performed during the art residencies. Visitors can therefore experience the final artwork within the exhibition and compare it with the ongoing process that is being developed by resident artists. 

The exhibitions are also used as part of educational and other outreach activities.

Just 40

Cultivamos Cultura is currently organizing an international exhibition and conference called “Just 40” for the Spring/Summer of 2015. This exhibition, curated by Marta de Menezes, will be a major cultural event in Portugal and we hope to generate significant repercussions outside our country, Europe and beyond.

The exhibition is primarily focused on new media in art, with a focus on experimentation and research. The proposed title is: “Just 40” and we would like to invite you to join us as contributors and part of this innovative programme we are preparing for 2015.

The curatorial work is being conducted by Marta de Menezes within the structure of Cultivamos Cultura, a nonprofit organization dedicated to the promotion of the creative arts within a local community in the Southwest of Portugal. Our main focus is the exploration of new avenues for artistic manifestations, namely new media (with an emphasis in technology) and new discourses.

In order to achieve these goals Cultivamos Cultura has established partnerships with Universities and research institutes in Lisbon and Alentejo.

We need your support

At Cultivamos Cultura we are actively fund-raising in order to be able to further support artists and artworks produced for the show and to cover the costs of a nice catalogue for the event. Unfortunately the current financial  situation in Portugal led to significant cuts that mostly affected the cultural sector. As a consequence we need to resort to unconventional fund raising in order to support our activities. 

If you are unable to support us financially, we will be happy if you could show your support by sharing this information with your friends and social media.

How the money will be used

Our objective is to include 20 artists in this exhibition. We will need:

2000€ to support the living costs of the artists while in residency

1000€ for local transportation of artists

12000€ for production costs of artworks and insertion into exhibition space

3500€ for the production of a catalogue


The curator, as well as everybody at Cultivamos Cultura, will be working pro-bono. We want to contribute with our work towards making this exhibition a success!


If we will not reach our entire goal we will use the available funds to make sure the artworks are displayed to their full potential in the exhibition space.

In case we will exceed our goal we will be able to provide a fee and travel assistance for the artists. We may be also able to produce a better catalogue.

Our track record 

We have produced exhibitions related to new media art in several locations, namely in Guimarães 2012 - European Capital of Culture (check the website here, we are very proud of this show!), as well as in Odemira (Sul - Sol) that was also exhibited at the Verbeke Foundation in Belgium. Therefore, we are confident Just 40 will also be a great success!

story:
Where to begin?

Humans of Western Australia (HOWA) is inspired by Humans of New York and a humble copy of its format. A photoblog project started by West Australian Photographer - Stuart Holden. A tribute to the people that make up our great state and a brief glimpse into their lives. It's a copy of a proven format - Humans of New York. The act of asking someone if you can create a portrait of them is both humbling and terrifying. Taking the time to sit and listen to people. Their lives, their stories and to share. The aim is to take 300 portraits in the memory of the late Luke Wales, who inspired us all to look past the exterior of others and to see the person for who they really are. A Human being.

Why has this campaign been started?

Tragically the photographer for HOWA, Stuart Holden had his camera stolen from the back of his ute in a smash and grab. Due to this, HOWA has been put on hold until a replacement has been found. The camera used by Stuart is a FUJI XT1 with 35mm 1.4 lens with a rough estimate of $1800. The main goal is to replace the camera stolen from Stuart and if there is any extra money left over to be used to buy new equipment to better improve and help grow the HOWA community.

story:
Introduction
My name is Marta Cielecka and I come from Poland but now I live in Milan with my beloved man. I'm a sociologist who always dreamed of being an artist, but I was too much influenced by people who advised me to keep my feet on the ground and lead a regular life. Instead I was feeling trapped, carrying the desire of changing my life but being afraid of stepping out my comfort zone. So one day I woke up and decided to follow my heart ...

Business model
There's a new appreciation for unique items instead of mass-produced. Nowadays there is a great demand for handmade products on the worldwide web and market.
My objective is to give to the world an original design combined with superior quality while diffusing eco-awareness.
MyCuddle” brand will be producing different kinds of products according to my original designs. My intention is to cooperate with a tailor servicer who will be sewing pillows, bodies of toys and clothes for cuddlers. I will be responsible for fulfilling toys/pillows with anti-allergic stuffing, combining pieces into a whole and giving the ultimate image to all of my products. I will be responsible also from the beginning to the end for manufacturing brooches, small accessories and artistic toys.

Products I will offer:

• animal cuddlers (bunnies, kittens, teddy bears)
• rag dolls
• artistic puppets
• accessories (pillows, bags, key hangers, brooches and others)

All of my products will be made from organic cotton, natural linen, wool, upcycled fabrics. According to pro-eco policy of my company, I will provide bags, tags and business cards made from recycled materials.

Investment plan / startup cost
Creating a dedicated website with on-line shop ( www.mycuddle.it ) – 70% complete now already in public BETA – all functions are working prototypes
Cost : 1500 €

Getting a safety certificate (CE marking is the manufacturer's declaration that the product meets the requirements of the applicable EU directives) - Cost : 500 €

Creating a physical brochure / catalogue - Cost : 500 €

Establishing a company in the European Union and choosing a smart accountant
Cost : 2500 €

Researching fabrics (deep scouting of reliable sources of organic, natural materials), toy's filler and establishing a durable cooperation with suppliers. Making the first wholesale order - Cost : 3000 €

Cooperation with an Italian tailor servicer for faster production - Cost: 500 € / per month

renting a tiny laboratory where to optimize operations and production lines. - Cost: 500 € / per month

Hiring a professional seles-agent / dealer, in order to find new retail clients
Cost : 2000 €

Packaging solution: tags, wrap paper and bags made from recycled paper, personalized card stamp for tags, ink, labels with the name of company and CE mark (safety certification), brochures with description of production process (500 pcs enough for half to one full year running) - Cost : 1000 € 

Creating brand identity: 500 business cards made from recycled paper, personalized card stamp and ink - Cost : 200 € 

Machinery: dedicated printer for labels, professional sewing machine and accessories (wool balls, threads, needles etc.) - Cost : 600 € 

Taking part in fairs / events for handmade products - Cost : 500 € 

I really love what I do, thus, not only every cent of these funds will be injected in my company, but also all my time and my personal money (I currently work about 10 hours per day). I intend to make the best out of the opportunity that people may kindly give me!

THANK YOU SO MUCH IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT 

Please do not hesitate to ask further questions and remember to check the GALLERY TAB on the top to see other photos or my official website (under construction) www.MYCUDDLE.IT

story:
Who is this Rustin McCann guy?

I am a Cleveland based photographer and mixed media artist.  I have been making images in Cleveland since 2006, but I have never had my own studio.  I am trying to change that!  

What are we funding?

As the Rust Belt boom continues, I can no longer afford to rent studio space. Recently a unique opportunity presented itself to purchase a raw space that I could transform into a live/work photo studio.

What is the deal?

  • I am trying to raise a minimum of $5,000 to cover a down payment on purchase of this unique space.  Any funds above the goal will go toward the purchase, fees, as well as outfitting the studio.
  • Good news!  Instead of some questionable potato salad, your funds entitle you to real photographic services, and you'll be the first clients in my brand new studio space!
  • In the event that I do not reach my goal, you will still get your perks.  Any funding will be put toward the maintenance of my current photographic equipment.  All mugs will ship.  Any portrait sessions will be shot on location instead of in studio, so weather and scheduling will effect the delivery timetable.

The Impact

In addition to my own art making, I have been taking event photography of local art events, comedy shows, and local musicians.

  • Having my own studio would allow me to increase not just the production of my own work, but allow greater photographic opportunities for new clients.
  • I have been shooting out and about at Cleveland events for the last several years but I miss the slowed down workflow of the studio experience.
  • I feel that I have reached the limit of what I can achieve creatively with the facilities currently at my disposal and that having my own space would allow me to grow both as an artist and professional.

Perks galore!


Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is that I would be unable to complete the purchase of this property. But with your help, hopefully we can succeed!  And remember, even if the campaign fails, I will still be photographing about town, and will deliver all perks. 
  • I am working closely with experienced members of the business community in order to minimize risk and maximize the odds of success!
  • You are funding real photographic services, so rest assured all perks will be delivered.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of you are working artists just like me and cannot afford to contribute. Remember, contributing anything gets you out of buying me a beer on my birthday. 

  • Tell your friends. Tell your family.  Tell strangers about the campaign! 


Thank you Cleveland!


Here's what a few hundred 4x6 prints look like installed


An analog (film) portrait


My current studio assistant, don't you want to see this face with your morning coffee?

story:
DIARTSPORA GALLERY ART RESTORATION PROJECT

The Diartspora Gallery is a unique collection of artworks by and of African-Americans, gathered over the past twenty years. Most of the pictures were created by self-taught artists with little or no formal training. I found many of these paintings in odd corners of the urban landscape during my day job as a contractor. The more I discovered, the more I sensed the importance of grouping such works together to represent the creativity and visions of these too-often overlooked members of society. More than 150 of these pieces can be viewed at www.Diartspora.com.

The condition of a number of these works, however, is poor. There are tears, rips, flaking and missing areas of paint, chips and often a build-up of grime. Some pieces need re-matting due to yellowing and warping, some need re-framing, and some have no frame at all. The attention of a professional art conservator can bring these wonderful images back to their original, powerful expression.

With restoration, the entire collection could then be in a position to be exhibited to the public at large. We have already received requests as to where one might view it. The funds provided by generous donors can help make that happen, and be instrumental in the future establishment of a unique cultural institution, exhibiting art by, for, and of the people.

We estimate that $25,000.00 would be needed to accomplish the following goals:

Repair, restore, touch-up and clean at least 15 paintings 

Re-matte, re-frame and provide new frames for approximately 20 pieces.

Properly package and safely store the works in a climate controlled storage facility until such time that a permanent location can be acquired.  

Photograph another 50 to 60 artworks - drawings,photographs and sculptures  which have yet to be catalogued

If our campaign is successful, we estimate the above could be accomplished in 6 to 8 months.

Gifts will be mailed out by September 30, 2015

If we don’t reach our entire goal, we would first forego the storage and its cost, and then the framing. We would exercise artistic triage, of sorts; restoring the paintings with the worst damage first and working our towards those with lesser issues.

Ultimately, we envision a place where people can go and see respectful depictions and renderings of people of color, assembled in a visual narrative which showcases the rich and diverse offerings of that community. Museums in Western countries are filled with images that reflect their native populations; with people of color often shown in positions of primitivism or servitude. The Diartspora Gallery is one place where the artwork of that underserved community can be viewed online. The contributions to our campaign will go a long way towards the day when the art can be viewed in all its colorful, dramatic power in the material world.

We had an exhibit of 35 pieces focussing on portraiture last February ( 2014) at the University City Arts  League in Philadelphia during Black History Month. The website currently has over 2500 Twitter followers. We have had other requests for exhibits. We feel like this collection has been accumulating and gestating for 20 years; its launch into the world feels just around the corner.

A lack of funding would delay such a launching indefinitely. The art deserves the facelift it needs to insure its impact on the viewer. Without professional help, it runs the risk of suffering amateurish attempts at repair, as well as perhaps never meriting public exhibition.

If financial contribution isn’t possible, we can certainly use help in getting the word out about the campaign.  Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest or any other social media platforms .  We appreciate your interest and support of Diartspora Gallery.  Thank you!

story:
Hello, my name is Ram Samocha and I am the founder and curator of the Draw to Perform symposium, a unique and exciting art event dedicated to Drawing Performance.  

Draw to Perform1, which was carried out in Dec 2013, was a huge success, a great celebration of the exceptional discipline of drawing performance and a real treat for all art lovers. I am approaching you to gain your support to help us make it happen once again and turn Draw to Perform into an annual convention and an established tradition.

Draw to Perform is an international symposium for Drawing Performance. The symposium is dedicated to exploring the connection between drawing and Performance Art and the relevance of drawing as a modern medium. The symposium presents a refined collection of international Drawing Performance artists and includes live drawing performances, discussion panels, artists’ talks and lectures of art historians. The goal of the symposium is to promote the growing stream of live drawing performance, to distinguish it as a unique entity and allow it to rise from the eclectic, wider definition of performance art.

The first symposium was produced with no external funding. It was fuelled by great passion, personal funds and many voluntary hours of work that were dedicated to this project. It became possible due to the enthusiasm and faith of the participating artists who came from all over the world, drawing from their own expenses, and by the generosity of Performance Space and Arbeit Gallery, London, who hosted this event. 

The upcoming Draw to Perform2 symposium will take place on Sat & Sun May 16 and 17, 2015 at NUM3ER, South London. We already have a superb collection of local and international artists keen to participate, however this time we have to pay a fee for hiring our space. We would also like to be able to help performing artists with some of the travel expenses and material cost and if possible to be able to offer artist fee for participating artists.

Any fund collected in this campaign would be dedicated to the venue cost and travel expenses. This would be the initial stage that would literally give life to this project. Next, if we are successful in obtaining a grant from the Art Council, we could use any extra funding for equipment, public relations and advertising activities that would allow this event to become even more successful and attractive.

We cannot do it without your support! Please support this project and help establish it. Your support will help promoting awareness to the growing phenomenon of communicating with live art that uses the most basic creative element – drawing; a contemporary and relevant form of art that exposes and shares the artist process with the audience.


Our unique perks:

Please take a look and choose from the unique perks that we made especially for this campaign.

Do not miss having our limited editions of badges, postcards, posters, T-shirts, DVDs, art prints and original drawings.


How will your donations help?

1.  Pay towards the two days hiring fees of the venue.

2.  Help performing artists with some of the travel expenses and material cost.

3.  Cover the photo and video documentations fees.

4.  Allow this event to be free of charge for the audience.


Please share this information and get the word out.

Make some noise about this campaign – help us make it happen!

story:
Edit: Wow! Thank you all so much for your donations! This will go a long way toward helping me get home and care for my family. I'm hoping to make at least 50% of my goal by the end of this thing. One week left! Please keep spreading the word! Feel free to contact me if you have any questions about perks - I'm happy to give what I can in return!

~~~~~

Hello! My name is Dana. I was born and raised in Grand Marais, MN and I love it there, though I currently live in Southern California near Los Angeles. For the last six years I've been living back and forth between the north woods of Minnesota and sunny SoCal. My most recent move was in April 2013 and I expected to live here for no longer than a year - long enough to help my Midwest-born boyfriend Jordan save money and pack up for a move back to MN so we could begin our lives together up north where we belong.

Unfortunately I did not fully understand how expensive living in Southern California is compared to my humble homeland, and I've been stuck here since. You can read my whole story in my first blog post here: http://backtothenorthwoods.blogspot.com/2014/11...

With recent news, a sense of urgency has taken over. My mom has been diagnosed with stage four (IV-B) lung cancer. I need to get back to Minnesota as soon as possible to be with her and my dad to help them through this. I'm worried and scared and not ready for the road ahead, but I'm determined to help however I can.

The money raised from this campaign will go toward my travel and moving expenses, finding a place to live in MN, and possibly a down payment on a used car (the one I was driving back home is a year younger than I am, and it's rusted out so bad I'm worried it may not be safe to drive). All the rest of the money will go straight to my folks to help them not only cover their bills, but let my mom  have some much deserved fun the next few years. Thankfully insurance is covering most of the medical side.

My parents are some of the most generous, kind, caring people you could ever meet and have gone out of their way to help people all their lives, but times have been hard lately. My dad is still working when he should be enjoying retirement. It breaks my heart to see them struggling and I want to do whatever I can to make sure they're taken care of because they've cared and helped me so much throughout my life. 

I find it difficult to accept money for nothing, so instead of setting up an Indiegogo Life campaign I opted for a regular one so I could include perks. My personal goal is to one day be able to make a living off of creative pursuits (writing and art), but I don't yet have a strong portfolio with examples of what I'm capable of. Through this campaign, you can help me build this portfolio and make my dream come true.

All rewards will be negotiated and delivered via email. Feel free to contact me personally if you have any questions - aurorawolf@gmail.com

My first creative pursuit when I move back is to write a book. I intend to write a memoire about what it's been like living two lives between the northern country and a southern city over the last few years. If it's well received I will look into publishing later.

Everyone who donates at least $5 to this crowdfunding campaign will receive a digital copy of the book, no matter which perk level you choose. For example, if you sign up for a large custom art piece,  you will receive the book in addition to the art piece.

Art perks may take me a year or two to deliver on. I want each piece I do to be my best ever. The book is my first priority, but I plan to complete at least one art piece a month, if not more. The "January 2017" date is arbitrary - I hope to have most done long before then.

EDIT: Today (03/27) I added a $20 perk for custom digital sketches as a more affordable art option for anyone who might be interested!

You choose the animal species and whether you want the drawing to be realistic or whimsical. If you'd like a pet portrait I will need you to email me some really good photos of your pet.

Realistic = Animals as true to life as I can draw them

Whimsical = Fantasy creatures, animals showing human emotion or ability, cartoony style, anthropomorphic animals and character portraits. 

And here are two OLD examples (10+ years old!) from when I was in high school that some of you may recognize. This is the kind of work I want to do again, now that my skills have improved.

Many more examples can be seen at my Deviant Art gallery: http://aurorawolf.deviantart.com

Artwork will be fully rendered with some kind of background (not just blank paper) to the best of my ability. You will get art worth what you donate - higher amounts will receive full backgrounds and more detail. The art you will receive will be higher quality than my current examples and could be completed in a variety of traditional media (graphite, colored pencil, charcoal, watercolor, acrylic, pastel). These art pieces are a chance for me to experiment and grow as an artist and expand my portfolio, so you will be receiving my best work yet!

I am happy to draw any and all animals including mammals, reptiles, insects, fish, farm animals, pets, amphibians, birds, extinct species and fantasy creatures. No humans or humanoids (centaurs, mermaids, etc) at this time, please, though unicorns and dragons are quite welcome!

I'm happy to help bring your personal vision come to life if you have one, or you can let me "wing it." 

I retain all reproductive rights to my work, but you will receive the finished original artwork mailed to you for you to mount and frame or keep as you wish. 

Here's a run down of art reward levels:

$25: A quality print of any animal drawing/painting I do as part of this fundraiser

$20: A digital sketch commission - not eligible for prints (New 03/27)

$50: Small size 5"x7" - graphite, ink, or limited color palette 

$75: Small size 5"x7" - full color 

$100: Medium size 9"x12" - graphite, ink, or limited color palette 

$200: Medium size 9"x12" - full color 

$500: - large size 11"x14" (possibly larger) - full color

One of my other creative pursuits is costume design and creation. Taking a drawing and turning it into a 3D wearable walking character is pretty awesome. As part of this crowdfunding campaign I am taking on one costume commission. As with the rest of the art, this may take a couple years to complete, but you are guaranteed a quality costume done to the best of my ability.

This will be a partial costume including the head, hands, feet, and tail. This is an "artistic liberty" costume creation. You choose the species, whether you want it realistic or toony, and whether you want natural or unnatural colors. I do the rest! I'm happy to entertain other personal requests though, so let me know if you have something specific in mind - I might like it!

If you have questions about anything, please email me! aurorawolf@gmail.com

To follow progress on my book, all artwork associated with this campaign, and my homesteading aspirations, please follow my blog here: http://backtothenorthwoods.blogspot.com/

I also have a new website in the works: http://www.auroraswoods.com

Thank you for stopping by! If you're not in a position to help right now (I know times are tough) please consider spreading the word to others, I really appreciate it.

- Dana

story:
Moiré Clock - The Clock That Catch Your Look

Hi backers,

Im Manh from Vietnam, im 17, with a dream becoming an engineer, yet being in school or work, watch the time slowly drifting so you can finished jobs and doing what you love ( go gym, movies, listening music or even sleeping, etc.. )

That not fair for time, watch the video for more details:


The Moiré Clock, watching clock is now your hobby!!!

  • Bumping Heart
  • Smiling Cat
  • Or even.... Er?? Retro Pacman???
  • Etc....


So we add a feature for yourself to modify your own background, add your lifestyle to it!!!! 

We even more careful, add a glass to protect it, now it not about your life style it can be a cool accessory to your house.
Help us make it came true, backer!!!
From Hanoi with love, cheers!!
Cảm ơn

story:
"My Main Goal in Art is to find the beauty: beauty lives all around us, we just have to feel it and take it". Hi ! My name is Isabel Garmon and welcome to my travel to The Florence Academy of Art: Bealive me when I say that I feel passion for painting and drawing. Since three years someone very special in my life woke up this feeling inside me. Sometimes people tell me that I am an old soul because I love all themes related with ancient history: painting, sculpture, arquitecture... I think we can find magic in every place we are. I am working everyday inside of artistic projects because art is part of me and because I feel the need of improving my skills. Nowadays I am living and working in Madrid. It is a good city with very nice people living here, but I have to travel to Florence. A big impulse is growing inside me for two years to go to this italian city and live close the artistic crew that is there. And to enroll in The Florence Academy of Art is the place to start this journey. Because I want to be a great painter and this is the best place to be: Florence and this Academy !

 I would like to show you part of my work, as an academic artist and illustrator:



Like I have said before in the video, I won a scholarship from The Florence Academy of Art to attend a figure painting workshop in the month of july of the past year  (and i felt in love with it...). Some time ago I heard people talk about FAA and the incredible discipline that students have there to learn exactly how to draw and face the long way of creating a good painting. All those things that an artist has to know to resolve an scene and produce good art! My life goes hand in hand with drawing and painting. I love them! And I try to move always with passion for every project. It is for that I have to enroll in FAA and know exactly the process for painting. The Florence Academy of Art wrote me a Letter of Acceptance, so this academy accept me as student. I just have to get the enough amount of money to enroll: this is my big dream and I would like to make it a reality with your help. This Academy trains very hard to their students and teach inside of the classical method of painting because it wants the best quality for them: it is the only way if someone wants to be a good painter. FAA is one of the best academies around the world: http://florenceacademyofart.com/ This is one of the paintings I was working in Florence the past year in the workshop:




- The amount of money I have to get to attend the full painting program of one year      is around $21.000 (payment are done in dollars in the Academy, but the rest of life in Florence is in euro, for that this crowdfunding works in euros) : 

  • Academic Year: U.S. $ 16,875.00 
  • Room renting and living in Florence: U.S. $ 3,700.00 
  • Materials and others: U.S. $ 700 
- Fees from IndieGogo (9% if I don't meet my goal, 4% if I do), Paypal (3%) and Credit Cards (3%) 
- I will have to invest time and money to make your rewards (paper, charcoal, oil painting, mediums, brushes...)
- Shipping costs will be included in price of reward.

Be sure that I will be updating and keeping you informed by email to know the progress of your reward. I want you to be glad and happy with your investment!

 You choose what you want from the illustration collection or academic collection! I will send it to you as a postcard. I think it is more personal than having a "normal copy" :

This is a surprise reward! I will take a sketch from Prado Museum here in Madrid, and you will not know wich drawing will be until it reach your home. I use toned paper (mostly times I prepare the paper, so each one is entirely different ) for this kind of drawings because I get easily high impact with contrasts :

 I will make one portrait drawing study on charcoal for you. It will be part of a limited edition just made for this crowdfunding. It will be a surprise until it reaches your house! This sort of drawings are really beautiful when you frame them because they have a lot of expression in them:

 Limited edition of one study in oil. It will be a painting portrait on panel. Limited edition for this crowdfunding. Surprise reward too! It can be really excited not to know the result until the painting go to your hands, I think it is more private:



I will work on a painting or drawing from a photo that you choose, like a commission! You will email me a photo to work from and I am going to ask you to find the one with the best resolution and illumination. Please keep that in mind! . Working from photo is complicated so it is great if it is a good one:
       - Drawing: Graphite or charcoal on paper.
       - Painting: Oil on canvas.


!! For me it is very exciting to create limited editions: It is a very personal way of working in which you let me do a drawing or painting inspired on my feelings. A painter has two options of making : personal works or commissioned works. Ok... we are going to produce good work always, with good quality ! So do not worry if you choose your reward as a commission. 

I need your support. I need your help to reach my goal and enroll in The Florence Academy of Art. We win together: ... I go to Florence, and ...you can have in your hands original works by me !

My goal with this crowdfunding is to get the enough money to attend the full academic year. But in the case it is not, I will attend at least one trimester in that Academy. Every cent of your support will be invested in Florence, no question.

Definitely most of you do not know me, or maybe just know my work... And you ask yourself the question: why should I help this person? Well, I have always thought that if all world would help with at least a little piece to anyone who need it, everyone could get their goals. Art is something very necessary for us. Good art pieces create peaceful moments for people who look at them. The art is part of our life.If you decide to invest on my project, and help me to enroll in The Florence Academy of Art, think that you can have one of my works on your property. It will be yours ! Like a painter said: "good art is like good cooking, if you want to make a good meal you have to put love and enjoy every part of the process". I believe in these words and be sure that your investment will be made following this argument. 

Well... I am aware that this crowdfunding could not work... But I have to try it !. I have to work hard and use all the oportunities that I find, and I will be so greatful for your help, the amount of your investment will not, you are helping, that will be the best gift you could give me. So your support will be very welcome! Please share with your people if you believe on my words.

Eternally greatful !!!!

VERSIÓN ESPAÑOLA click aquí
story_txt:
"My Main Goal in Art is to find the beauty: beauty lives all around us, we just have to feel it and take it". Hi ! My name is Isabel Garmon and welcome to my travel to The Florence Academy of Art: Bealive me when I say that I feel passion for painting and drawing. Since three years someone very special in my life woke up this feeling inside me. Sometimes people tell me that I am an old soul because I love all themes related with ancient history: painting, sculpture, arquitecture... I think we can find magic in every place we are. I am working everyday inside of artistic projects because art is part of me and because I feel the need of improving my skills. Nowadays I am living and working in Madrid. It is a good city with very nice people living here, but I have to travel to Florence. A big impulse is growing inside me for two years to go to this italian city and live close the artistic crew that is there. And to enroll in The Florence Academy of Art is the place to start this journey. Because I want to be a great painter and this is the best place to be: Florence and this Academy !

 I would like to show you part of my work, as an academic artist and illustrator:












Like I have said before in the video, I won a scholarship from The Florence Academy of Art to attend a figure painting workshop in the month of july of the past year  (and i felt in love with it...). Some time ago I heard people talk about FAA and the incredible discipline that students have there to learn exactly how to draw and face the long way of creating a good painting. All those things that an artist has to know to resolve an scene and produce good art! My life goes hand in hand with drawing and painting. I love them! And I try to move always with passion for every project. It is for that I have to enroll in FAA and know exactly the process for painting. The Florence Academy of Art wrote me a Letter of Acceptance, so this academy accept me as student. I just have to get the enough amount of money to enroll: this is my big dream and I would like to make it a reality with your help. This Academy trains very hard to their students and teach inside of the classical method of painting because it wants the best quality for them: it is the only way if someone wants to be a good painter. FAA is one of the best academies around the world: http://florenceacademyofart.com/ This is one of the paintings I was working in Florence the past year in the workshop:














- The amount of money I have to get to attend the full painting program of one year      is around $21.000 (payment are done in dollars in the Academy, but the rest of life in Florence is in euro, for that this crowdfunding works in euros) : 


Academic Year: U.S. $ 16,875.00 
Room renting and living in Florence: U.S. $ 3,700.00 
Materials and others: U.S. $ 700 

- Fees from IndieGogo (9% if I don't meet my goal, 4% if I do), Paypal (3%) and Credit Cards (3%) 

- I will have to invest time and money to make your rewards (paper, charcoal, oil painting, mediums, brushes...)- Shipping costs will be included in price of reward.
Be sure that I will be updating and keeping you informed by email to know the progress of your reward. I want you to be glad and happy with your investment!





 You choose what you want from the illustration collection or academic collection! I will send it to you as a postcard. I think it is more personal than having a "normal copy" :

story:
Hi, my name is Amber Baldwin, and I am excited to announce that I will be leaving for Edinburgh, Scotland at the end of August for a four month long journey. This is a journey of a lifetime, my lifetime, for I have never embarked on a journey quite like this before. This is an expensive journey. I’ve been saving up my money, and working very hard to come up with the funds so I can go explore. However I need your help coming up with the funds, and I am willing to work hard to get it. I have come up with a campaign to not only ask for donations, but also to offer my services in return.

I have never been out of the country before. As a graphic artist and photographer, I think it is important to see the world, and be influenced by the art and culture of other countries. It is important to me to make this journey because I want to learn and be influenced by this art. I want my art to grow. I want to capture the aesthetic and glory of Scotland and the other countries I will visit while I’m over there. Donating will help me achieve the goal of bettering myself as an artist, strengthening my skills in not only my art, but in life.

The goal of my campaign is to raise $5000 to cover my school expenses, artist equipment, and other living expenses while I am abroad, since I am unable to work while I’m traveling. I am offering my freelance services in return for donation. I will be offering photoshoots for portraits and events, as well as graphic designs, logos and advertisements for your companies and for all other purposes.  I am also selling my printed photographs, and paintings, which can be made to order. All of these services are offered at a discount, in order to help promote my adventure, and advertise my services.

Reaching my goal of $5000 is ideal, however any amount of money will help, and will go towards funding for my trip. Please help me, help you. If your project isn't listed under the perks, please contact me and we can work something out. If you like something you see under the gallery tab, let me know and I'll sell it to you. Let me help you with your projects, and ideas, while you help me get to Scotland.

story:
Aloha ya'll - and mahalo for checking our fundraiser!


Your donation directly supports the Hawaii National Slam Poetry Team in their journey to compete in Oakland this year. Over 70 teams will be facing off, from cities across the nation. Will Hawaii rank in the top five for the second year in a row? Only one way to find out . . . 



All donations will go toward sending our 2015 slam poetry reps - and their coach - to the national show down. If you're curious about how the funds will be distributed, these are our fundraising goals, in order of priority:
  • Airline ticket for coach
  • Hotel rooms
  • Per diems for each poet
Although the team already has four airline tickets and one hotel room paid for by Hawaii Slam, your donations will ensure all team members will have travel, comfortable lodging, and some money for food during the five day competition.

    The Big Picture Impact of Your Contribution

    Donating to this fundraiser doesn't just support this year's national slam team. Your donation supports the slam poetry movement - a contribution to spoken word art for the people, by the people. The slam poetry stage is a unique arena where the most controversial and impactful of subjects have space to breathe, and stir a captive audience of participants.

    Your donation also supports the arts in Hawaii. Hawaii is a land known for its vibrant and distinct indigenous culture, rich with dance, crafts, mythologies, and story telling arts. With such a strong oral tradition, even an urban-birthed form like slam has had fertile ground to grow on Hawaii's shores.

    Meet the Team

    Jenna Robinson

    As the descendent of back-porch storytellers, Jenna believes music and poetry are the perfect tools to heal from trauma and grief by empowering people to reclaim their past. Jenna works with several youth based organizations to inspire the therapeutic nature of writing and spoken arts performance: with foster youth as a mentor with Family Programs Hawaii, with youth bereavement groups at the Queen Liliuokalani Children’s Center, and with adjudicated youth through Girls Court at the Hawaii State Judiciary. She has performed across the U.S. as a street musician and as a part of several national slam poetry teams (Hawaii Slam 2012, 2014, 2015 & UH CUPSI 2013). She is also the reigning two-time grand slam champion of Hawaii Slam. Jenna holds a B.A. in History and Ethnic Studies from the University of Hawai`i at Manoa.

    Will Gilles

    Will Giles is a Kundiman Fellowship recipient and a former International Youth Poetry Slam Champion who studied with the First Wave program at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. He has been involved with Youth Speaks Hawaii/Pacific Tongues since 2007 and has performed and facilitated workshops across the Pacific, the United States, and Europe. He writes about people, the things that bring them together, and the ways we take ourselves apart.

    Simply Tee

    A native of a Prince George, Virginia, Tee was an Army brat, traveling all over the world in the name of war. So when it was time for her to provide for herself, she too joined the Army. Tee learned the art of spoken word in 2003 when her mentors, Willie “Black” Baker and Christopher Michael, molded her into herself. She won slams all over Texas, including Best Female Poet in Central Texas in 2005. Tee was then deployed to Kuwait where she helped create Camp Arifjan Poetry night, which still exists today. She has also opened up for Floacist of Floetry, hosted her own shows, and spoken at various schools and colleges. Tee is the co-founder of Silent Treatment Ent. LLC, a non-profit that mentors and tutors children and young professionals, as well as providing food and clothes to homeless shelters.


    TravisT

    A Pacific Islander, scholar, worker, activist, poet, mentor, and organizer, TravisT is also co-founder of the award-winning youth literacy non-profit, Youth Speaks Hawaii. He also co-hosted Words @ Ward Rafters, re:VERSES, 2nd Saturdays, and the Hawaii Theatre Slam; he has taught Creative Writing at Palama Settlement's ICTP and the Kapolei Juvenile Detention Center, and has has visited countless classrooms across O'ahu. TravisT is currently pursuing his MA in Pacific Island Studies at UH Manoa, and is a part-time raw-vegan chef.


    Sam Skeist

    Sam was born and raised in Chicago and moved to Hawai`i to join family living on `Oahu and earn his Master’s degree in Second Language Studies from the University of Hawai`i. Sam manages the English Language Learner program for a non-profit which offers free English classes to immigrants living in low-income housing. He first began performing spoken word in 2000 and has performed on stages across the United States, sharing written and improvisational poems, stories, and slam pieces. Most recently, Sam was commissioned by the University of Hawai`i Dance Department to create and perform two original pieces for the show Dancing off the Page. This is Sam’s second time on the Hawai`i National Slam Team and he is honored and stoked to be a part of the movement.

    Coach Sterling Higa

    Sterling Higa is a poet, hip-hop artist and scholar.  He has represented Hawai'i at eleven national slam poetry competitions at the youth, collegiate, and adult levels.  He was the HawaiiSlam state champion in 2010 and the first poet to represent Hawai’i at both youth and adult competition in a single summer.  He received his Ed.M. from the Arts in Education Program at the Harvard Graduate School of Education.  This fall, he will begin a Ph.D. in Education at the University of Hawai'i at Mānoa College of Education.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If donating isn't an option for you right now, fret not! You can always contribute by spreading the word and making some noise about this effort. Check out dem handy Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who We Are

The Royal NoneSuch Gallery is a 100% volunteer-run, non-commercial alternative art gallery & event space located at 4231 Telegraph Avenue in Oakland, California. RNG is currently Co-Directed by Elizabeth Bernstein, Zoë Taleporos, Hillary Wiedemann, and Dana Hemenway.

Image by Carolyn Porras

What We Do

Since 2009, the Royal NoneSuch Gallery has been dedicated to creating community around art-based experiences that are thought provoking and conceptually rigorous, while also being accessible and fun. Our innovative programming includes exhibitions, installations, film screenings, lectures, artist talks, workshops, and more. 

About Our Campaign

In our sixth year of programming (WOW!), the RNG 2015 Indiegogo campaign will be live from now through July 4th. Donate and receive hand selected music mixes with custom cover art by twenty four Bay Area artists, curators, and collectives! Choose between digital downloads, CDs, or old school mixtapes, that, of course, come with an RNG pencil for winding loose tape…. A few limited edition prints by Amanda Curerri are available too. Don’t miss out!

Along with the Indiegogo campaign, we are also having a benefit party with custom artist-made cocktails, one-night-only performances, and a dance party at the Temescal Arts Center on June 20th to raise a combined $10,000. All the funds we raise will go directly towards the basic cost of keeping the gallery doors open for the next twelve months including rent, utilities, and installation supplies. 

We truly thank you for your support!

Zoë, Liz, Hillary, and Dana

About the Perks:  

*For a complete list and description of the all the mixes please click on the gallery tab. 

*Mixtapes are in editions of 3 and CD's are in editions of 5--they are available first come first serve. After you pick your perk we will contact you via email to confirm your selection. (Please allow up to 24 hours for a follow up contact.)

Here's just one of  the *twenty four* possible mixes.... 

Carissa Potter Carlson, Mixtape, "Music For the 5 Stages of a Relationship"

Play list includes songs for hooking up, dealing with unruly bathroom habits, sexual differences, power struggles, making up, life evaluations, unemployment, unexpected pregnancy, expected pregnancy, sexual validation, deciding what is for dinner, polyamory, making large purchases, accounting, yard work, schedules, time management,  keeping it together, etc, and perhaps becoming a team. Featuring such musical legends as Bonnie Raitt, the Weeknd, The Modern Lovers, and more! 


Here's another way to donate-- You can send a check via Snail Mail to:

Royal NoneSuch Gallery
4231 Telegraph Ave. 
Oakland, CA 94609

*Checks should be made payable to FRACTURED ATLAS with Royal NoneSuch Gallery in the memo line.
