story:
Short Summary

Right at Home is an art-driven non-profit organization whose purpose is to enrich the lives of others by providing them opportunities for creative experiences in their own back yard. Our goal is to plant seeds in the lives of the younger generation; the seeds of self-awareness, acceptance, tolerance and confidence.

Definition of RIGHT AT HOME /rīt/ /at/ /hōm/ - a.k.a. RAH

Noun

•  Where the heart is.

•  Satisfaction with who you are.

Adverb

•  Being a positive influence to the world around you.

•  Making the best of your experiences.

•  Feeling comfortable with who you are

•  Sharing joy with others

What We Need & What You Get

Right at Home, along with local Las Vegas artist CJ the kid, Las Vegas based non profit Green our Planet, and celebrity chef/trainer Zac Browning are raising $5,000 to successfully host a RAH Project at Crestwood Elementary. The RAH Project will be a fun filled, 4 day event taking place at the school. Our goal is to teach the habits and benefits of living a healthy lifestyle while empowering the youth. Our message were coming to share "Life is Beautiful when you're Right at Home". 

The $5,000 we raise will cover the costs of:

1) All the equipment, material, and paint needed in order for us to complete two large scale murals with the kids

2) Personalized Right at Home posters, backpacks, pens, hats, stickers and shirts for the students

3) Food to cook and prepare with the kids as we teach the benefits of a healthy diet

4) Video production (shoot/edit) of the event 

AS A SUPPORTER, the number one gift you receive is satisfaction knowing you're  helping share the gift of love to these youth of our nation. What Right at Home looks to provide our supporters is with meaningful gifts which capture the essence of Right at Home. Its peace of mind, love, community, art, passion, gratitude, humility and the comforts of being true to one self.

The Impact

Its been proven time and time again the benefits of arts, especially with youth! We strive to create a solution with finding new ways to support the arts in schools and creating a positive atmosphere that empowers the students involved. 

Sadly funding toward arts education has been diminishing year after year, yet on the bright side the love of art and freedom it offers has only continued to grow. Bringing art, along with our message of living a positive lifestyle, into schools will give youth the opportunity to open their minds which will help allow them to realize they have the power to do whatever is they wish to do! The impact this event will make is priceless to the youth directly involved

Risks & Challenges

We risk the challenge of falling short financially through this online project by not clearly stating our mission and what we are looking to accomplish. If we fail, its from our own doing but we will get back up, we will learn from our mistakes and we will let people know we are growing from each experience we encounter, which is why we will succeed!

Other Ways You Can Help

- SHARE OUR PROJECT 

- PASS ALONG OUR MESSAGE AND STORY

- JOIN US ON SOCIAL MEDIA

www.facebook.com/raheffect

Instagram- @theraheffect
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Right at Home is an
art-driven non-profit organization whose purpose is to enrich the lives of
others by providing them opportunities for creative experiences in their own
back yard. Our goal is to plant seeds in the lives of the younger generation;
the seeds of self-awareness, acceptance, tolerance and confidence.
Definition of RIGHT AT HOME /rīt/
/at/ /hōm/ - a.k.a. RAH
Noun
• 
Where the heart is.
• 
Satisfaction with who you are.
Adverb
• 
Being a positive influence to the
world around you.
• 
Making the best of your experiences.
• 
Feeling comfortable with who you are
• 
Sharing joy with others
   What We Need & What You Get Right at Home, along with local Las Vegas artist CJ the kid, Las Vegas based non profit Green our Planet, and celebrity chef/trainer Zac Browning are raising $5,000 to successfully host a RAH Project at Crestwood Elementary. The RAH Project will be a fun filled, 4 day event taking place at the school. Our goal is to teach the habits and benefits of living a healthy lifestyle while empowering the youth. Our message were coming to share "Life is Beautiful when you're Right at Home". 
The $5,000 we raise will cover the costs of:
1) All the equipment, material, and paint needed in order for us to complete two large scale murals with the kids
2) Personalized Right at Home posters, backpacks, pens, hats, stickers and shirts for the students
3) Food to cook and prepare with the kids as we teach the benefits of a healthy diet
4) Video production (shoot/edit) of the event 
AS A SUPPORTER, the number one gift you receive is satisfaction knowing you're  helping share the gift of love to these youth of our nation. What Right at Home looks to provide our supporters is with meaningful gifts which capture the essence of Right at Home. story:
(English)

Please find these postcards that deliver you Japanese cultures and atmospheres.

We started Post air project to offer postcards with iconic Japanese' sights, full of cultures and traditions to people around the world. But we didn’t stop there. 

Not like any postcards, a vintage flavored photo decorates the front, but on the back you can find a QR code that can be scanned by your smart device's QR code reader. You will experience a 360 degree panorama view of the landscape that is shown on the front for a life-like immersive experience.

Here is an example(you had better try by your smartphone);
This is the famous “Shibuya Scramble Crossing”.
http://post-air.com/vol1/shibuya_1.html




Try it! How do you feel ?

Send these postcards to your family and friends. They will feel as if they are actually walking along the street of Japan.
Or keep these postcards on your desk for a 360 degree visual trip to Japan.

We are proud of delivering Japan’s unique cultures to you and important people around you.
Thank you so much for visiting our project.
We will release next series this year so we are appreciate your support!

Vimeo: How to use Postair



Other Photos

Kaminari-mon(Asakusa)


Tokyo tower


Matsuri(Local Festival)



We have more Scenic Japanese Postcards!!


We need your support to release many series of Japanese cities, at first, Kyoto, Kanagawa and Tohoku. 


Our target funding is USD 12,500.

When we make 10 postcards with 360 degree panorama view, we need to plan logistics, hire a photographer, use 5 days to take photos by single-lens reflex camera & 360 degree panorama camera, ask a designer to retouch, upload photos to a server, issue QR codes and order postcards for publishing. We estimate it costs USD 2-3K for one series(10 cards) for one city. 

If we achieve the goal we will make at least 5 series in Japan. We want to turn a spotlight on  rural areas. There are many places that are not famous to foreign travelers, even for domestic travelers. In Japan, those rural areas have unique traditions and cultures but they are vanishing.

Do you remember Tohoku area?

Tohoku, a northeastern part of Japan, suffered from the catastrophe tsunami in 2011.  Tohoku area has not overcome yet. We know Tohoku area has full of rich traditions, cultures and landscapes. We are eager to let you know Tohoku and contribute recovery of post-tsunami Tohoku by showing scenic photos and attracting tourists.

We are planning to take this images;

https://www.pinterest.com/postair/tohoku-especially-miyagi-iwate-fukushima/



If we don't reach our entire goal, we still make postcards for many cities after earning margin. As a startup company, we have limited resources so it's not easy to hire distributors and retailers. But our enthusiasm to spread our postcards with 360 degree panorama view will not end after this project!


Vimeo: CEO message



The Impact

We think this technology is a new archive for vanishing cultures, traditions and landscapes. There are videos to record but it's not easy to access from smartphone because of size. Our solution is invented particularly for smartphone because you only need to scan QR code on paper(postcard, brochure, report and so on).


Possible Risks & Challenges

We recognize our risks;

  1. OS issue : iOS devices(iPhone&iPad) don't have QR code reader. We did not test all Android OS devices so we can not guarantee you can scan QR code. We recommend you to install free QR code reader to your device.  
  2. Bandwidth : If you are in circumstance where you have poor internet connection, it is not smooth to show 360 degree panorama view.

We have next challenges;

  1. 360 movie : We are planning to test and deploy 360 degree panorama movie next year. We may offer you another life-changing experience!
  2. B2B biz : We recognize this 360 degree panorama view can be applied to business use. We have meetings with companies to prospect business needs.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that sometime you may not have interest in Japanese postcards or our story. But if you know someone who like Japanese cultures, please let them tell our project.
Your recommendations and sharings to SNS are also a huge support for us!


(日本語)

360°パノラマ画像を使った絵葉書で、日本の文化や風景を世界中にアピールします

観光地で見かける絵葉書はありきたりではありませんか？
わたしたちは絵葉書に360°パノラマ画像を見ることができるQRコードを追加し、あたかもその場に立っているような気分が味わえる体験をできるようにしました。外国人受けする被写体を選定して絵葉書にしていますが、日本人の皆さんでも楽しめるものです！
ぜひ渋谷のスクランブル交差点の360°パノラマ画像をスマホで試してみてください。指で画像を動かすこともできますし、スマホを傾けて見たいところを見ることができます。
http://post-air.com/vol1/shibuya_1.html


いかがですか？

この絵葉書を外国人や海外に居る日本人の方に届けてみてください。きっと喜んでくれると思います。あるいは興味を持って日本を訪ねてくれるかもしれません。

どのような形であっても皆様のご支援・ご協力に感謝いたします！


Vimeo: 360°パノラマ画像の見方（日本語字幕付き）


東京版15枚の絵葉書はこちらからご覧いただけます。

https://jp.pinterest.com/postair/our-postcards/


今後の展開：京都版・神奈川版・東北版の作成 

このプロジェクトで150万円のゴールを設定しています。

もしこのゴールを達成できれば、絵葉書を最低5シリーズ発売できます。

1シリーズ作成にかかる費用（約20-30万円）：調査費用、カメラマン日当、一眼レフ写真画像修正費、360°パノラマ画像加工費、試作版印刷費、カメラマンの日当、交通費、撮影場所によっては宿泊費

当初は大都市ばかりですが、わたしたちの計画が順調に行けば訪日外国人どころか日本人でさえあまり訪れない知名度の低い場所にスポットライトを当てることができ、観光客誘致や地方復興の手助けになると考えています。

2011年に東日本大震災があったのは記憶に新しいです。東北の被害はあまりに痛ましいものでした。東北は復興の途上にあります。そしてわたしたちは様々な記事や文献から、東北が古き良き日本の文化・生活様式・風景を多く残していることを知りました。それらが失われつつあるのをただ見過ごすのではなく、わたしたちはこの360°パノラマ画像によってそういった貴重な文化や美しい風景を後世に残すことができると考えています。

東北版は以下の写真のような景色を撮る予定です。

https://www.pinterest.com/postair/tohoku-especially-miyagi-iwate-fukushima/

もし目標額に達しなかったとしても、わたしたちは資金の続く限り、できるだけ多くの絵葉書シリーズを作成したいと思います！


Vimeo: 代表ご挨拶



想定されるリスクと今後の挑戦

以下のリスクを想定しています。

  1. スマホOS： iPhone・iPadにはQRコードリーダーが標準で入っていません。またアンドロイドOSのスマホ・タブレットでも古いOSや独特な設計のスマホの場合はQRコードリーダーを読み取れない場合があります。App StoreやGoogle PlayからQRコードリーダーをダウンロードしてお試しください。  
  2. 帯域幅（回線速度）：読み込みに時間がかかると、360°パノラマ画像をスムーズに見られない場合があります。Wi-Fi環境でお試しください。 

私たちの次の挑戦はこちらです。

  1. 360°パノラマ動画：360°パノラマ動画の実装を来年に予定しています。これにより、さらに新しく面白い体験を皆様にお届けできます。好きなアーティストのライヴや贔屓のサッカーチームの試合、を360°パノラマ動画で見たくありませんか？
  2. ビジネス用途：わたしたちはこの360°パノラマ画像体験を、不動産/旅行/教育関係の企業にも提案しています。


indiegogo登録方法

1.　以下初期画面右上の「Sign Up」を押す
https://www.indiegogo.com
2. 「First Name」「Last Name」「Email」「Password」を入力する
3. 「CREATE AN ACCOUNT」を押すと登録完了する

ご支援方法

1. 　画面右「SELECT A PERK」から「PERK」（ご支援内容）のプランを選ぶ、PERKを選択せず「Your contribution」を選ぶと寄付になります
2.　住所をローマ字で記入する（送料が必要なプランのみ）
3.　支援者の名前を見せたくないときは「Hide my name on the campaign page.」にチェックを入れる
4. 「CONTINUE PAYMENT」を押す
5.　VISAかPaypalで払う
6.　支払確定後、Facebook・Emailなどで友人にシェアできる


「PERK」ご支援内容の説明（*送料は国内向け）

・Thank You！：$5　2015年12月予定
　ご支援に感謝し、弊社ウェブサイトにお名前を掲載いたします。
・Plan 1：$8+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版の中から5枚のセットです。（指定はできません）
・Plan 2：$15+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚の先着順割引プランです。内容は以下サイトにあります。http://g.post-air.com
・Plan 3：$20+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚のセットです。（Plan 2と同内容）内容は以下サイトにあります。http://g.post-air.com　（秋葉原、浅草1&2、銀座、皇居、祭り1&2、表参道、渋谷、新宿、東京タワー、築地1&2、上野、谷中)
・Plan 4：$40+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚と神奈川版10枚のセットです。神奈川版の写真は以下サイトのような写真を予定しています。https://www.pinterest.com/postair/kanagawayokohama-shonan-kamakura-hakone/
・Plan 5：$60+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚と京都版10枚のセットです。京都版の写真は以下サイトのような写真を予定しています。https://www.pinterest.com/postair/kyoto/
・Plan 6：$80+送料$2　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚、神奈川版10枚、京都版10枚のセットです。
・Plan 7：$100+送料$2　2016年2月送付予定
　東京版15枚、神奈川版10枚、京都版10枚と東北版10枚のセットです。東北版の写真は以下サイトのような写真を予定しています。
https://www.pinterest.com/postair/tohoku-especially-miyagi-iwate-fukushima/　
　東北版はわたしたちにとって特別なものです。この東北版によって東北の魅力・自然・文化を世界中に発信し、東北の復興や観光客の誘致に少しでも貢献できればと思います。東北版の売上の10%を発売後1年間「Japan Earthquake Relief Fund」に寄付します。（弊社ウェブサイトで報告予定）http://www.japansociety.org/earthquake
・Plan 8：$150+送料$3　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚x10セットと販売店契約をお送りします。また今後、販売店向け価格でPost airポストカードを卸します。ショップをお持ちの方やポストカードのヘビーユーザーが対象です。
・Plan 9：$300　2016年3月予定
　専用カメラのデータを送付いただければ、360°パノラマ画像に加工し、URLとQRコードを納品します。会社概要、パンフレット、入学案内、お客様向け資料、年賀状など幅広くご活用いただけます。
・Plan 10：$800+送料$3　2016年3月予定
　日本国内ご指定の1ヶ所を撮影し、360°パノラマ画像と一眼レフ写真を3点選定します。そしてオリジナル絵葉書を3点それぞれ30枚ずつを、QRコードとURLと共にお送りします。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。*撮影時期は冬です　*法律で禁止されている場所・国境紛争が起きている場所・アクセスするのに特別な技術を要する場所や交通機関がない場所での撮影はお断りする場合があります　*写真の権利は弊社が保持します（シリーズ化して販売する可能性があります）
・Plan 11：$1,600+送料$3　2016年3月予定
　日本国内ご指定の2ヶ所を撮影し、360°パノラマ画像と一眼レフ写真を6点選定します。そしてオリジナル絵葉書を6点それぞれ30枚ずつを、QRコードとURLと共にお送りします。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。*撮影時期は冬です　*法律で禁止されている場所・国境紛争が起きている場所・アクセスするのに特別な技術を要する場所や交通機関がない場所での撮影はお断りする場合があります　*写真の権利は弊社が保持します（シリーズ化して販売する可能性があります）
・Plan 12：$2,400+送料$5　2016年3月予定
　日本国内ご指定の3ヶ所を撮影し、360°パノラマ画像と一眼レフ写真を9点選定します。そしてオリジナル絵葉書を9点それぞれ30枚ずつを、QRコードとURLと共にお送りします。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。*撮影時期は冬です　*法律で禁止されている場所・国境紛争が起きている場所・アクセスするのに特別な技術を要する場所や交通機関がない場所での撮影はお断りする場合があります　*写真の権利は弊社が保持します（シリーズ化して販売する可能性があります）
・Plan 13：$2,400　2016年4月予定
　ガイドつき国内ツアーをご提供します。カメラマンつきであなたが行きたい場所をご案内します。含まれる内容は、1泊2日の宿泊と3食、カメラマンによる撮影と360°パノラマ画像の撮影および絵葉書の作成です。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。あなたの肖像権に抵触しない写真はシリーズ化して販売する可能性があります。
・Plan 14：$12,000　2016年4月予定
　世界中どこでもご指定の1ヶ所を撮影し、360°パノラマ画像と一眼レフ写真を選定し、オリジナル絵葉書としてQRコードとURLと共にお送りします。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。*撮影時期は冬です　*法律で禁止されている場所・国境紛争が起きている場所・アクセスするのに特別な技術を要する場所や交通機関がない場所での撮影はお断りする場合があります　*写真の権利は弊社が保持します（シリーズ化して販売する可能性があります）


他のご支援も大歓迎です

一部の方はわたしたちのストーリーや絵葉書に興味を持たれないかもしれません。金銭的なご支援をいただけないこともあるかと思います。

ですが、こういった新しい体験を楽しんでくれそうな方をご存知であれば、是非このプロジェクトをご紹介ください。あるいは、SNS・ブログ・メールでシェアしていただければ、本当に有難いです。

どうぞよろしくお願いいたします！

Vimeo: 360°パノラマ画像の見方（日本語字幕付き）

東京版15枚の絵葉書はこちらからご覧いただけます。
https://jp.pinterest.com/postair/our-postcards/



今後の展開：京都版・神奈川版・東北版の作成 

このプロジェクトで150万円のゴールを設定しています。
もしこのゴールを達成できれば、絵葉書を最低5シリーズ発売できます。
1シリーズ作成にかかる費用（約20-30万円）：調査費用、カメラマン日当、一眼レフ写真画像修正費、360°パノラマ画像加工費、試作版印刷費、カメラマンの日当、交通費、撮影場所によっては宿泊費
当初は大都市ばかりですが、わたしたちの計画が順調に行けば訪日外国人どころか日本人でさえあまり訪れない知名度の低い場所にスポットライトを当てることができ、観光客誘致や地方復興の手助けになると考えています。
2011年に東日本大震災があったのは記憶に新しいです。東北の被害はあまりに痛ましいものでした。東北は復興の途上にあります。そしてわたしたちは様々な記事や文献から、東北が古き良き日本の文化・生活様式・風景を多く残していることを知りました。それらが失われつつあるのをただ見過ごすのではなく、わたしたちはこの360°パノラマ画像によってそういった貴重な文化や美しい風景を後世に残すことができると考えています。
東北版は以下の写真のような景色を撮る予定です。
https://www.pinterest.com/postair/tohoku-especially-miyagi-iwate-fukushima/もし目標額に達しなかったとしても、わたしたちは資金の続く限り、できるだけ多くの絵葉書シリーズを作成したいと思います！



Vimeo: 代表ご挨拶




想定されるリスクと今後の挑戦
以下のリスクを想定しています。

スマホOS： iPhone・iPadにはQRコードリーダーが標準で入っていません。またアンドロイドOSのスマホ・タブレットでも古いOSや独特な設計のスマホの場合はQRコードリーダーを読み取れない場合があります。App StoreやGoogle PlayからQRコードリーダーをダウンロードしてお試しください。  
帯域幅（回線速度）：読み込みに時間がかかると、360°パノラマ画像をスムーズに見られない場合があります。Wi-Fi環境でお試しください。 

私たちの次の挑戦はこちらです。

360°パノラマ動画：360°パノラマ動画の実装を来年に予定しています。これにより、さらに新しく面白い体験を皆様にお届けできます。好きなアーティストのライヴや贔屓のサッカーチームの試合、を360°パノラマ動画で見たくありませんか？
ビジネス用途：わたしたちはこの360°パノラマ画像体験を、不動産/旅行/教育関係の企業にも提案しています。




indiegogo登録方法1.　以下初期画面右上の「Sign Up」を押すhttps://www.indiegogo.com2. 「First Name」「Last Name」「Email」「Password」を入力する3. 「CREATE AN ACCOUNT」を押すと登録完了する


ご支援方法1. 　画面右「SELECT A PERK」から「PERK」（ご支援内容）のプランを選ぶ、PERKを選択せず「Your contribution」を選ぶと寄付になります2.　住所をローマ字で記入する（送料が必要なプランのみ）3.　支援者の名前を見せたくないときは「Hide my name on the campaign page.」にチェックを入れる4. 「CONTINUE PAYMENT」を押す5.　VISAかPaypalで払う6.　支払確定後、Facebook・Emailなどで友人にシェアできる
「PERK」ご支援内容の説明（*送料は国内向け）

・Thank You！：$5　2015年12月予定
　ご支援に感謝し、弊社ウェブサイトにお名前を掲載いたします。


・Plan 1：$8+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版の中から5枚のセットです。（指定はできません）

・Plan 2：$15+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚の先着順割引プランです。内容は以下サイトにあります。http://g.post-air.com


・Plan 3：$20+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚のセットです。（Plan 2と同内容）内容は以下サイトにあります。http://g.post-air.com　（秋葉原、浅草1&2、銀座、皇居、祭り1&2、表参道、渋谷、新宿、東京タワー、築地1&2、上野、谷中)

・Plan 4：$40+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚と神奈川版10枚のセットです。神奈川版の写真は以下サイトのような写真を予定しています。https://www.pinterest.com/postair/kanagawayokohama-shonan-kamakura-hakone/


・Plan 5：$60+送料$1　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚と京都版10枚のセットです。京都版の写真は以下サイトのような写真を予定しています。https://www.pinterest.com/postair/kyoto/


・Plan 6：$80+送料$2　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚、神奈川版10枚、京都版10枚のセットです。

・Plan 7：$100+送料$2　2016年2月送付予定
　東京版15枚、神奈川版10枚、京都版10枚と東北版10枚のセットです。東北版の写真は以下サイトのような写真を予定しています。https://www.pinterest.com/postair/tohoku-especially-miyagi-iwate-fukushima/　
　東北版はわたしたちにとって特別なものです。この東北版によって東北の魅力・自然・文化を世界中に発信し、東北の復興や観光客の誘致に少しでも貢献できればと思います。東北版の売上の10%を発売後1年間「Japan Earthquake Relief Fund」に寄付します。（弊社ウェブサイトで報告予定）http://www.japansociety.org/earthquake


・Plan 8：$150+送料$3　2015年12月送付予定
　東京版15枚x10セットと販売店契約をお送りします。また今後、販売店向け価格でPost airポストカードを卸します。ショップをお持ちの方やポストカードのヘビーユーザーが対象です。

・Plan 9：$300　2016年3月予定
　専用カメラのデータを送付いただければ、360°パノラマ画像に加工し、URLとQRコードを納品します。会社概要、パンフレット、入学案内、お客様向け資料、年賀状など幅広くご活用いただけます。

・Plan 10：$800+送料$3　2016年3月予定
　日本国内ご指定の1ヶ所を撮影し、360°パノラマ画像と一眼レフ写真を3点選定します。そしてオリジナル絵葉書を3点それぞれ30枚ずつを、QRコードとURLと共にお送りします。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。*撮影時期は冬です　*法律で禁止されている場所・国境紛争が起きている場所・アクセスするのに特別な技術を要する場所や交通機関がない場所での撮影はお断りする場合があります　*写真の権利は弊社が保持します（シリーズ化して販売する可能性があります）

・Plan 11：$1,600+送料$3　2016年3月予定
　日本国内ご指定の2ヶ所を撮影し、360°パノラマ画像と一眼レフ写真を6点選定します。そしてオリジナル絵葉書を6点それぞれ30枚ずつを、QRコードとURLと共にお送りします。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。*撮影時期は冬です　*法律で禁止されている場所・国境紛争が起きている場所・アクセスするのに特別な技術を要する場所や交通機関がない場所での撮影はお断りする場合があります　*写真の権利は弊社が保持します（シリーズ化して販売する可能性があります）

・Plan 12：$2,400+送料$5　2016年3月予定
　日本国内ご指定の3ヶ所を撮影し、360°パノラマ画像と一眼レフ写真を9点選定します。そしてオリジナル絵葉書を9点それぞれ30枚ずつを、QRコードとURLと共にお送りします。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。*撮影時期は冬です　*法律で禁止されている場所・国境紛争が起きている場所・アクセスするのに特別な技術を要する場所や交通機関がない場所での撮影はお断りする場合があります　*写真の権利は弊社が保持します（シリーズ化して販売する可能性があります）

・Plan 13：$2,400　2016年4月予定
　ガイドつき国内ツアーをご提供します。カメラマンつきであなたが行きたい場所をご案内します。含まれる内容は、1泊2日の宿泊と3食、カメラマンによる撮影と360°パノラマ画像の撮影および絵葉書の作成です。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。あなたの肖像権に抵触しない写真はシリーズ化して販売する可能性があります。

・Plan 14：$12,000　2016年4月予定
　世界中どこでもご指定の1ヶ所を撮影し、360°パノラマ画像と一眼レフ写真を選定し、オリジナル絵葉書としてQRコードとURLと共にお送りします。本プロジェクト終了後、場所の選定などで相談させていただきます。*撮影時期は冬です　*法律で禁止されている場所・国境紛争が起きている場所・アクセスするのに特別な技術を要する場所や交通機関がない場所での撮影はお断りする場合があります　*写真の権利は弊社が保持します（シリーズ化して販売する可能性があります）


他のご支援も大歓迎です

一部の方はわたしたちのストーリーや絵葉書に興味を持たれないかもしれません。金銭的なご支援をいただけないこともあるかと思います。
ですが、こういった新しい体験を楽しんでくれそうな方をご存知であれば、是非このプロジェクトをご紹介ください。あるいは、SNS・ブログ・メールでシェアしていただければ、本当に有難いです。
どうぞよろしくお願いいたします！

story:
What is DRØME? Who is DRØME?

 

DRØME is an artist collective based in Providence, RI, run by three engaged and passionate women, focused on exposing emergent talent. These three women are: Rebecca Blandón, Ellen Taylor, and Caroline Gorman. Rebecca and Caroline went to high school together in New York, conceiving of the idea for DRØME this past winter at Brown. They met Ellen individually through a film course and a music-writing course before connecting the dots and bringing her onboard.

We were inspired to create a women-curated artist collective that promotes a diverse set of media and artists, each one precisely selected by a group of women from different racial, socioeconomic, and cultural backgrounds.We wish to create an online platform to showcase and sell DRØME artists’ works spanning sculpture, painting, textiles, audio, writing and more. We hope to brand these works as consciously curated by women today.

We do not however wish to limit our image to exclusively feminist or women-made art. We hold these issues very close to our hearts and have used this concept as a jumping off point for the creation of DRØME, though we are excited to welcome all forms of socially meaningful art into the collective.

 

How we intend to go about this:

Before we engage specific artists however, we need to establish some base funding so that their participation in DRØME can be meaningful and fruitful from day one.

In the beginning stages, DRØME will function as an online boutique and artist exposure. Every month, a group of artists will be assigned one item to design with a limited number being sold through the site. Initially these would be smaller items, like decorated canvas shoes, though eventually becoming more significant projects. The DRØME site would also act as a platform for each artist to display his or her work created independently from DRØME. This will be a unified space for artists to extend their reach beyond what they could achieve individually.

By sharing art and vision, DRØME will continue to inspire and facilitate collaboration between artists that otherwise would remain unknown to one another. Starting with a modest number, approximately 10, we will expand our artist network over time. We want to keep the collective contained while also allowing for expansion and interaction within and across artistic communities.

The year’s to-do list looks something like this:

 

  • Print stickers and totes (ideally, budget permitting, other logo wear as well).
  • Buy a website domain and make a site to put on the World Wide Web from which we will run the store and artist profile part of the collective.
  • Bring three community-oriented guest speakers to the Providence area to talk about their experiences as artists and their approach to collaborative creativity.
  • Throw three community art events, with some combination of concerts, pop-up artist shows, and live art-making performances.
  • Provide the initial DRØME artists with seed money to work on small monthly projects associated with the collective.
  • Publicize all these things online and in print.

Our first year is all about bringing together a community. We are incredibly lucky to be surrounded already by a group of talented, enthusiastic, young people and our goal is to leverage this pre-existing community to support and nurture DRØME’s growth while bringing in all of you guys to help get us off the ground. While we of course would love it if a few big donors swooped in and meet our fundraising goal, we know that in order for DRØME to thrive, it needs to have a larger circle of enthusiastic supporters and smaller contributors. All levels of support are appreciated—your engagement is what we most care about.

 

Why DRØME matters:

 

We want to be the organizing infrastructure for emergent artists. A united front is much more powerful than a dispersed one. We believe that by uniting artists under DRØME, while still allowing them creative control and ownership of their intellectual property, we can generate more visibility and growth for the individuals.

All three of the founders care deeply about supporting the smaller artistic communities we are already a part of and we have personally witnessed and experienced how relationships form naturally between artists. These collaborations result in brilliant new outputs.

Down the road we see DRØME as a self-sustaining non-profit that supports the artistic community through financial and administrative support of artists across media and within several creative hubs of the U.S. DRØME is founded on a belief in the power of symbiotic relationships between and among artist and patrons.

It is remarkable the joy, satisfaction, and gratitude that come from sharing beautiful things with other people, whether this be a story, a song, a photograph or a sculpture. We want to build spaces where this happens naturally and enthusiastically. 

 

The risks:

We are currently launching DRØME with little more than excitement and general smarts. We do not have artists signed on nor do we have dates for events planned. However, we have a logo and some serious motivation and momentum. It would be foolish not to have misgivings at this point in the process, but we’ve chosen to move forward and take the first step rather than timidly waiting until some combination of stars align and we receive a sign from the universe telling us what to do next. We believe—in all our Millennial self-confidence—that we can deftly adjust DRØME and our expectations of it as the year develops.

 

Other ways you can help out:

 

If you’ve read this far and are into what we’re into—art, community, people helping other people—but are unable to donate your $$, consider instead donating your opinions/questions/suggestions/words of encouragement at dromeanartistcollective@gmail.com as well as a “like” on our Facebook page. And if you know of anyone else in your life that might be even the slightest bit interested in DRØME, please do pass along the link to this campaign.

 

Be on our team!

We’ll be sending out updates as the project develops but don’t hesitate to contact us in the meantime. We are so unbelievably excited to start making this idea a reality and your support is what’s going to get us there. Let’s make it happen.

All of our most sincere appreciation and thanks,

 

The Women of DRØME

Rebecca + Ellen + Caroline

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I’m Aluna Ille and I’m in my final year as a master student at the Faculty of Arts and Design in Cluj-Napoca. This year my city is the European Youth Capital and because I have a passionate heart for different cultures and the people that vivifies and inspire them, I believe that this year is the perfect opportunity for my piece of artwork to have a voice!

The artwork will be exhibited at the University of Arts and Design graduates
exhibition, that is "The greatest manifestation of the artistic society in Romania. The exhibition is the result of an enormous effort from students, parents and teachers" said the President of the University of Arts and Design, John Sbârciu.

The interesting thing about my artwork is that it will not only be an ergonomic object but will be a voice, a call and invitation to peace, friendship and harmony in these times of conflict, war and division. A call for the new generation that will have the power in their hands soon. My work is not limited to a comfortable, lovely object. It will have a story to tell, it will be a symbol and a way of unceasingly raising awareness of the value of life.

The Concept

I have designed a set of 2 swings. As for me the flight symbolizes a liberation and detachment from human powerlessness. I aspired for a way to save the broken, fragmented, unstable earth. So the concept of my swings is born in the middle of the earth and is created from a perfect sphere, but suffers from separation, alteration and leakage  due to the conflicts, preconceptions, cruelty and indifference of mankind.
I chose to split the earth into two parts, as a symbol of relationship. The relationship is the essence, the juncture between both the fall  and the ascension.

So my swings as a means of escaping degradation asked me to save them and I gave them their flight. I transformed their deformation into a different formation. The remains of my spheres gradually started to metamorphose into wings. This very metaphor is only for the heart, as the heart is the only one that can overcome human helplessness. And if the heart hears and if the heart sees, then it ought to let go of all the preconceptions and heavy barriers in order to fly.

Needs

The sad thing is that the university does not support us financially in all of our major projects. The alternative is a mediocre project that does not represent me, but that can help me in getting a diploma. I dare to hope and to want more, I want to believe that art is not going to die but will live in the hearts of those who are inspired by it.

So here’s where you can help:

Cost for the entire project: 1,500 euro (1632 USD)
  • 600 Euro (653 USD) for plywood: the swings that I have designed will be made of plywood, creating the form through the contour lines. The swings are over 1 meter long, the plywood is 2.5 cm thick, and so I will need many boards.
  • 400 Euro (435 USD) for swing holders: the swing holders will be made of metal in order to sustain such a massive weight. 
  • 500 Euro (544 USD) for the manufacturing cost of the whole artwork.

The Impact

I want my work to be interactive and belong to everyone! The swings will be placed in a chalk writing area, so all those who want to get rid of their preconceptions, envy, jealousy, hate and will be invited to write their decision and fly the liberation flight! Nothing else will matter except that we have but the same heart that beats for life, love and peace. 

I have to accomplish my Master’s project regardless of whether I will raise financial support or not. But if I do, I will be able to make a change in design presentation approaches from the interactivity point of view. And this will have a great impact on young designers encouraging them not to compromise art due to the lack of resources and not to kill their ideas by being forced to be mediocre.

If I will not manage to raise all the support here, I will also try elsewhere. If nothing works and I will still not have all the money I need for the project, I have to limit myself to the resources I have access to and to create a mediocre work. In this case, I will refund your money.

Achievements

In the last 2 years of high school a National artistic contest is organized. In the National artistic contest that I was chosen to participate in, I won the third place. The last project I created was my artwork for my Bachelor's Degree Thesis, accredited with 10 points out of 10 and the title “Magna Cum Laude”.

You can find out more details here:
 http://ziarulfaclia.ro/arte-expo-transilvania-iunie-iulie-2013-expozitia-absolventilor-uad/

Risks & Challenges

There will be great challenges, but there are challenges in every stage of a project, like there were in working on my Bachelor's Degree Thesis.  The polystyrene model had to be cut automatically with a polystyrene carving machine. After a month of vectorization and three-dimensional designing, the workers decided the project was too complex. So in the last month I started to do it manually. It was the most exhausting month of intensive work of my life. It was extremely demanding and risky, but the result was so rewarding. Honestly I did not expect to finish it in time, but I pushed myself to the limit because I could not accept failure. Challenges have already occurred in the swing project but I have not let them defeat my passion.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially at this time, please make some "noise" about the campaign. Use indiegogo to share it!
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Hi! I’m Aluna Ille and I’m in my final year as a master student at the Faculty of Arts and Design in Cluj-Napoca. This year my city is the European Youth Capital and because I have a passionate heart for different cultures and the people that vivifies and inspire them, I believe that this year is the perfect opportunity for my piece of artwork to have a voice! The artwork will be exhibited at the University of Arts and Design 
graduatesexhibition, that is "The greatest manifestation of the 
artistic society in Romania. The exhibition is the result of an enormous
 effort from students, parents and teachers" said the President of the 
University of Arts and Design, John Sbârciu.The interesting thing about my artwork is that it will not only be an ergonomic object but will be a voice, a call and invitation to peace, friendship 
and harmony in these times of conflict, war and division. A call for the
 new generation that will have the power in their hands soon. My work is
 not limited to a comfortable, lovely object. It will have a story to 
tell, it will be a symbol and a way of unceasingly raising awareness of 
the value of life. The ConceptI have designed a set of 2 swings. As for me the flight symbolizes a 
liberation and detachment from human powerlessness. I aspired for a way 
to save the broken, fragmented, unstable earth. So the concept of my 
swings is born in the middle of the earth and is created from a perfect 
sphere, but suffers from separation, alteration and leakage  due to 
the conflicts, preconceptions, cruelty and indifference of mankind.I
 chose to split the earth into two parts, as a symbol of relationship. The
 relationship is the essence, the juncture between both the fall  and the ascension. So my
 swings as a means of escaping degradation asked me to save them and I
 gave them their flight. I transformed their deformation into a 
different formation. The remains of my spheres gradually started to metamorphose into wings. This very metaphor is only for the heart, as the heart is the only one that can overcome human helplessness. And if the heart hears and if the heart sees, then it ought to let go of all the preconceptions and heavy barriers in order to fly.
  Needs 


The sad thing is that the university does not support us financially in 
all of our major projects. The alternative is a mediocre
 project that does not represent me, but that can help me in 
getting a diploma. I dare to hope and to want more, I want to believe 
that art is not going to die but will live in the hearts of those who 
are inspired by it.
So here’s where you can help:
Cost for the entire project: 1,500 euro (1632 USD)
600 Euro (653 USD) for plywood: the swings that I have designed will be made of plywood, creating the form through the contour lines. The swings are over 1 meter long, the plywood is 2.5 cm thick, and so I will need many boards. 

400 Euro (435 USD) for swing holders: the swing holders will be made of metal in order to sustain such a massive weight.  

500 Euro (544 USD) for the manufacturing cost of the whole artwork. 




  The Impact
I want my work to be interactive and belong to everyone! The swings will be placed in a chalk writing area, so all those who want to get rid of their preconceptions, envy, jealousy, hate and will be invited to write their decision and fly the liberation flight! Nothing else will matter except that we have but the same heart that beats for life, love and peace. 
I have to accomplish my Master’s project regardless of whether I will raise 
financial support or not. But if I do, I will be able to make a change 
in design presentation approaches from the interactivity point of view. 
And this will have a great impact on young designers encouraging them 
not to compromise art due to the lack of resources and not to kill their
 ideas by being forced to be mediocre. 
If I will not manage to raise 
all the support here, I will also try elsewhere. If nothing works and I 
will still not have all the money I need for the project, I have to 
limit myself to the resources I have access to and to create a mediocre 
work. In this case, I will refund your money.
  AchievementsIn the last 2 years of high school a National artistic contest is organized. In the National artistic contest that I was chosen to participate in, I won the third place. The last project I created was my artwork for my Bachelor's Degree Thesis, accredited with 10 points out of 10 and the title “Magna Cum Laude”. You can find out more details here: http://ziarulfaclia.ro/arte-expo-transilvania-iunie-iulie-2013-expozitia-absolventilor-uad/Risks & Challenges
There will be great challenges, but there are challenges in every stage of a project, like there were in working on my Bachelor's Degree Thesis.  The polystyrene model had to be cut automatically with a polystyrene carving machine. After a month of vectorization and three-dimensional designing, the workers decided the project was too complex. So in the last month I started to do it manually. It was the most exhausting month of intensive work of my life. It was extremely demanding and risky, but the result was so rewarding. Honestly I did not expect to finish it in time, but I pushed myself to the limit because I could not accept failure. Challenges have already occurred in the swing project but I have not let them defeat my passion.
  Other Ways You Can Help 
If you cannot contribute financially at this time, please make some "noise" about the campaign. Use indiegogo to share it!

story:
(scroll down for English translation)

Katyuscia e Simona sono le fondatrici dell'Associazione Culturale IL FILO D'ARTE, un gruppo di donne accomunate dalla passione per la creatività e l'espressione artistica. Ognuna di noi proviene da background differenti: accademia d'arte, pittura intuitiva, psicologia, tecniche miste, passando anche attraverso letteratura e poesia.
Il nostro desiderio è quello di creare un luogo di incontro e collaborazione tra artisti (e non) in un'atmosfera rilassata, per condividere conoscenze ed esperienze tramite le quali ognuno possa liberare la propria energia creativa.
L'obiettivo dell'Associazione nasce dall'esigenza di aiutare quelle persone che non riescono ad esprimere se stesse attraverso i "normali" canali di comunicazione.
Tramite incontri tematici e corsi proponiamo un viaggio alla scoperta della propria creatività.
Inoltre, il ricavato delle attività dell'associazione verrà devoluto a questi Enti Benefici/ONG:
MEDICI SENZA FRONTIERE
GNU SOLIDARIO
E.N.P.A. (ENTE NAZIONALE PROTEZIONE ANIMALI)
Chiediamo il vostro contributo per poter realizzare il nostro sogno.
Tutto ciò che raccoglieremo verrà usato per pagare l'affitto iniziale dei locali e acquistare i materiali e l'arredamento.

In cambio della vostra generosità offriamo:
- TESSERA ASSOCIATIVA o BUONO SCONTO per la partecipazione a corsi ed eventi (per chi abita in Italia)
- OPERE DI NOSTRA CREAZIONE (per chi vive all'estero o in Italia e non ha la possibilità di partecipare a corsi ed eventi)

Se non avete la possibilità di contribuire finanziariamente, potete aiutarci condividendo il link della campagna con i vostri amici sui Social Networks e spargendo la voce.

GRAZIE DI CUORE!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Katyuscia e Simona are the founders of IL FILO D'ARTE Cultural Association, a group of women who share a passion for creativity and artistic expression. Each one of us has a different background: Art academy, psychology, mixed media, intuitive painting up to literature and poetry.
We wish to create a relaxing place where artists and non artists can meet, collaborate and share their knowledge and experiences with the goal of expressing our creative energy.
Our aim arises from the need of helping people who aren't able to express themselves through the standard channel of communication.
Through themed events and courses we will take you to a trip into your creative Self.
Moreover, we will donate a sum from the group activities to the following charities:
DOCTORS WITHOUT BORDERS
GNU SOLIDARIO
E.N.P.A. (ENTE NAZIONALE PROTEZIONE ANIMALI)

Your donations will be used to realize our dream and to pay for initial rent, furniture and supplies.

In return we offer OUR ARTWORKS and our INFINITE GRATITUDE.
Perks are in English, too!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR HEARTS!

story:
In Rooms Photo Book Pre-Sale

Hello everyone, 

I am a fine art photographer and traditional darkroom printer located in Brooklyn, NY. I've decided to publish a book of my work to extend the world of my prints to all those who desire the magic of In Rooms. In the winter of 2011 I began photographing "In Rooms", which has evolved into an ongoing narrative documenting my most vibrant thoughts, dreams and observations about the human experience. In 2012 I moved to New York and immediately joined an introductory traditional black and white printing. I have remained self taught ever since and now print all of my photographs at a darkroom in Brooklyn.  

I create because I have to; it gives me vitality. That being said, it is my hope that people are able to enjoy my work, that it inspires those who seek to have it in their lives. Whilst social media and the internet has made it possible to enjoy art from our computers and phones, I feel living with art and having a tangible object such as a book or print  resonants with the viewer in deeper, more personal way. Owning gallery prints, especially a large collection of works is out of the financial realm of possibilities for so many people, myself included. This is why I feel inspiration to create a book, a more affordable keepsake that allows a viewer intimate access to an artist's world. The photo books I've collected over time have changed my life; there have been countless times when I've needed them, and looking through them has realigned and rejuvenated parts of my troubled and hungry soul.  It has been my dream to have this narrative, In Rooms, unfold in the pages of a high quality book and I am excited to have found the perfect publisher to do so. 

Learn more about In Rooms HERE

Press on In Rooms HERE

Podcast on In Rooms HERE

The Book

The book will be produced in Brooklyn by a small team of women who will hand cut and press each copy. It's important to me that every silver gelatin print of mine comes to life through my hands and I am pleased this company has an incredible team of women that will continue this effort with every page of the book. Once they receive the deposit there is a 1-2 week turn around to see the proof. And a 5-8 week turn around to receive the 500 copies. If all goes smoothly then the book should be released in March 2016.
specs:
  • Limited Edition 9"x10" Hardcover book , (60-80 pages depending on available funding)
  • offset black and white printing (4 boards plus gloss) on warmtone silk paper imported from Germany (This special paper will do justice for the quality and tones of my own warmtone silver gelatin prints)
  • The Book includes 55-80 (depending on funding) unpublished and published photographs with titles/dates from 2014-2015 and unpublished diary entries. Each book is numbered (and some signed) in the back.
  • The Collector's Edition includes a handmade book case with a leaflet including a signed limited edition silver gelatin print
**For now I am keeping the coloration and visual design of the book/cover a surprise

**Limited Edition 11x14 and 5x7 silver gelatin prints pictured above (available as perks)


What I Need and What You Will Receive

With your help I will be able to fund the deposit of $13,600 to the book publisher to produce 500 limited edition books (60pgs). They require a deposit upfront to start the job. I am hoping to reach this goal by pre-selling enough copies of the book. If I do not reach the goal, I will still move forward and fund it out of pocket. I may have to result to having fewer copies made at a higher cost per book  if I do not meet my goal. If I go over the goal I will hopefully continue to sell copies of the book. At this point I can also consider adding 10-30pgs to the book to include more images. This $13,600 does not cover the expenses and cost of producing any of the work, additional funds also contribute to my photographic costs (darkroom, paper, film, shoots, etc) 

I have already met with the publisher and designed my book, they are just waiting on the deposit and hopefully you can help by pre-ordering a copy or donating toward another unique perk!

In addition to pre-ordering the book you can contribute to this fund by purchasing limited edition silver gelatin prints. I have also added more unique opportunities such as personalized postcards, coffee mugs, darkroom visits, portrait sessions and portfolio reviews. It is a gift for me to learn and share the craft of photography and I hope for the right person I can inspire you through my knowledge of the darkroom, photography, or even my vibrant experiences "in rooms".

If you want to help but can't afford a book, print or other perk,  there is also the option to donate $1! Every dollar helps and I can't say thank you enough for your support.

The Impact

With this Campaign and Pre-Sale I will be able to move forward with producing and publishing my first high-quality photobook. This will be a dream come true and a huge step forward for my photography project. 

Challenges & Moving Forward

I have worked hard to find a great publisher and have committed the last 2 years of my life to live and breath In Rooms. I cannot afford to produce this book without your support.  I know what my next steps are and need the deposit to have it all come together

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you again for taking the time to read this through and show support. In addition to ordering the book or contributing other donations it would greatly help if you share the campaign. I cannot afford advertising and am relying on word of mouth and sharing through social media to fund this campaign. 

- With Love,

Brittany Markert

Let Go, 2015

story:
What is the Queens Book Festival?

There are many little ways to enlarge your child’s world. Love of books is the best of all. –Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

New York City is currently facing a literacy crisis and Queens is not immune from its effects. Many of the children in Queens do not enter school with the tools that they need to succeed. According to 2013-2014 English Language Arts standardized test scores, 70% of New York City’s third grade students are reading below grade level. Amongst the City’s poor, 76% are not reading on grade level. Once these students fall behind, it becomes increasingly difficult for them to catch up.

We need those numbers to change. 

The Queens Book Festival (QBF) is a grassroots project begun by Queens’ residents in the fall of 2014. We've incorporated and become an organization dedicated to creating tangible change in the literacy challenge facing the children in the borough, and have been thrilled at the support we've received from organizations, writers, artists, businesses throughout NYC. The Festival, debuting in June 2016, will introduce the borough and area residents, especially the children and young adults, to the many facets and genres within the literary world including new and immerging technologies that revolutionize how the written word is consumed. You can read more about our mission here. 

To date we've been a volunteer corps surviving on vigor and verve alone - but we can and will do so much more with your help. 

With your donation, QBF will be able to:

  • Create a Pop-up Bookstore: With your support, we’ll be able to stage beautiful mobile bookstores throughout the borough featuring the works of Queens authors. Our partners will be curating the talented writers, authors and poets. They will also provide updated furniture pieces and bookshelves for the books to be displayed upon. Plus, the borough residents and youth will have the opportunity to meet and chat with their favorite local authors. You’ll help us purchase the inventory for the shelves, get the word out to the public, cover the traveling expenses of our partners and keep our authors fed, shorn, and mostly clothed. 
  • Early Intervention: EI is a lifeline and starting point for parents and children on any point of the Autistic spectrum. As this reality becomes more concrete, many families come to the realization that they are not equipped with the proper tools to help their children along in the process. Those tools include the simplest things, toys and books, and some are even unable to purchase them. We want to assist parents and caretakers of children in early intervention get access to these books. We intend on doing this by holding a book drive in the Spring of 2016 to collect and distribute these much need items to parents, ABA teachers, speech therapists, occupational therapists, and physical therapists whom all care for the needs of autistic children.
  • Develop the first major literary crawl in Queens: This event will be the first of its kind in the borough. Not only will it highlight our talented authors, it will showcase our local businesses, and sponsors. This is an opportunity to expose the adults in the community to the local writers, poets, and other literary projects that operate throughout the year. 
  • Promote diverse programming: QBF will have an active presence in the community from March 2016 till mid-May 2016, where we will be quenching its insatiable fun in the sun appetite. We will be honoring the work of local authors with book release parties, pop-up events, and live performances. 
  • Host QBF’s Inaugural Festival: The event will be a celebration of literacy and literature. Of the 100+ authors invited to speak, a third will be local, and a third national; 200+ exhibitors from independent bookstores, publishers, literary nonprofits, writing programs, library services, and literacy programs—making the Queens Book Festival the most international public literary festival in the borough. 

FAQ

Q: Will my donations be tax deductible?

A: Yes! Per our generous fiscal sponsor, FJC, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, all your donations are tax deductible.

Q: Are the perks listed the only ones that will be available? 

A: Nein! ALL OF OUR PERKS ARE LISTED HERE. We are only allowed to post 20 perks at a time according to Indiegogo guidelines. We will be rotating new perks in as others get sold out. Perks that will be revolving include limited edition artwork, special offers from authors, and some further exciting offers from chefs and musicians!

Q: So what does the t-shirt and tote bag look like? 

A: See for yourself! 

Q: I love what you are doing! How can I help?

A: The quickest and easiest way to help us right now is support us with your generous donation! We also welcome help in many other ways as well:

1.  Share this page with your family and friends, including a personal message describing why the campaign is important to you!

2.  Use Twibbon to add a small QBF support logo to your social media profile picture, and add some QBF Queens Pride!

3.  Create your own sign by taking a picture with #SupportQBF at your favorite Queens business and submit pictures to our Facebook or Twitter pages about why you support QBF. Bonus! The photos with the most reblogs will win a QBF prize pack! Woot! Woot!

4.  Follow us on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and use the #SupportQBF hashtag to spread the word about our campaign!

Q: Is shipping included in the perks?

A: Yes, if you live in the US. However, for international donors, please add the specified shipping after you choose your perk.

Q: Will any of the perks be available for Christmas?

A: All of the perks will be shipped in the new year. There are so many other holidays to use them for such as birthdays (those are holidays to us!), Valentine's Day, and more!

Q: What will the QBF Queens Lit poster look like?

A: We will be posting a copy of the poster in the coming weeks! Yeepee! Something new to look forward to!

Q: I purchased your t-shirt! So, how do I tell you the size I'd like?

Our rewards coordinator will contact you via email. GRACIAS!

Q: I bought an experience-related reward. What happens next? 

Our rewards coordinator will contact you to give you more information. Grazie for the contribution! Nothing like a live experience!

Q: I bought a perk to help with the fundraiser, can I give more?

A: ABSOLUTELY! There is an option at checkout to add more to your contribution. MILLE GRAZIE!

Q: What if I want to donate but don't want a perk?
A: We appreciate your support for our campaign and we welcome your donation even if you do not wish to pick a perk. That just means 100% of your donation will go directly to QBF!

Q: Can I donate via check?

A: Yes! Please make your check out to "QUEENS BOOK FESTIVAL." If you would like the contribution to be tax deductible, please make your check out to "FJC" our fiscal sponsor. In the memo line of your check, please write "Queens Book Festival" so that FJC will ensure your money is earmarked for the campaign. Our mailing address is:

36-46 37th Street 
Unit 2
Long Island City, NY 11101

ARIGATO!

We are grateful for your support. As we are a grassroots campaign, by definition we owe any success we have to you.

how the written word is consumed. You can read more about our
mission here. 
To date we've been a
volunteer corps surviving on vigor and verve alone - but we can and will do so
much more with your help. 
With
your donation, QBF will be able to:


Create a Pop-up Bookstore: With your support,
     we’ll be able to stage beautiful mobile bookstores throughout the borough
     featuring the works of Queens authors. Our partners will be curating the
     talented writers, authors and poets. They will also provide updated
     furniture pieces and bookshelves for the books to be displayed upon. Plus,
     the borough residents and youth will have the opportunity to meet and chat
     with their favorite local authors. You’ll help us purchase the inventory
     for the shelves, get the word out to the public, cover the traveling
     expenses of our partners and keep our authors fed, shorn, and mostly
     clothed. 

Early Intervention: EI is a lifeline and
     starting point for parents and children on any point of the Autistic
     spectrum. As this reality becomes more concrete, many families come to the
     realization that they are not equipped with the proper tools to help their
     children along in the process. Those tools include the simplest things,
     toys and books, and some are even unable to purchase them. We want to
     assist parents and caretakers of children in early intervention get access
     to these books. We intend on doing this by holding a book drive in the
     Spring of 2016 to collect and distribute these much need items to parents,
     ABA teachers, speech therapists, occupational therapists, and physical
     therapists whom all care for the needs of autistic children.

Develop the first major
     literary crawl in Queens: This event will be the first of its kind
     in the borough. Not only will it highlight our talented authors, it will
     showcase our local businesses, and sponsors. This is an opportunity to expose
     the adults in the community to the local writers, poets, and other
     literary projects that operate throughout the year. 

Promote diverse programming: QBF will have an active
     presence in the community from March 2016 till mid-May 2016, where we will
     be quenching its insatiable fun in the sun appetite. We will be honoring
     the work of local authors with book release parties, pop-up events, and
     live performances. 

Host QBF’s Inaugural
     Festival:
     The event will be a celebration of literacy and literature. Of the
     100+ authors invited to speak, a third will be local, and a third
     national; 200+ exhibitors from independent bookstores, publishers,
     literary nonprofits, writing programs, library services, and literacy
     programs—making the Queens Book Festival the most international public
     literary festival in the borough. 

FAQ
Q:
Will my donations be tax deductible?
A:
Yes! Per our generous fiscal sponsor, FJC, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, all your donations
are tax deductible.
Q: Are
the perks listed the only ones that will be available? 
A:
Nein! ALL OF OUR PERKS ARE LISTED HERE. We are only allowed to post 20 perks at a time according to Indiegogo
guidelines. We will be rotating new perks in as others get sold out. Perks that
will be revolving include limited edition artwork, special offers from authors,
and some further exciting offers from chefs and musicians!
Q: So
what does the t-shirt and tote bag look like? 
A:
See for yourself! 
Q: I love
what you are doing! How can I help?
A:
The quickest and easiest way to help us right now is support us with your
generous donation! We also welcome help in many other ways as well:
1. 
Share
this page with your family and friends, including a personal message describing
why the campaign is important to you!
2. 
Use Twibbon to
add a small QBF support logo to your social media profile picture, and add some
QBF Queens Pride!
3. 
Create
your own sign by taking a picture with #SupportQBF at your favorite Queens business and submit
pictures to our Facebook or Twitter pages about why you support QBF. Bonus! The
photos with the most reblogs will win a QBF prize pack! Woot! Woot!
4. 
Follow
us on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and
use the #SupportQBF hashtag to spread the word about our campaign!

Q: Is
shipping included in the perks?
A: Yes, if you live in the US.
However, for international donors, please add the specified shipping after you
choose your perk.

Q:
Will any of the perks be available for Christmas?
A:
All of the perks will be shipped in the new year. There are so many other
holidays to use them for such as birthdays (those are holidays to us!),
Valentine's Day, and more!
Q:
What will the QBF Queens Lit poster look like?
A: We will be posting a copy of the poster in the coming weeks! Yeepee! Something new to look forward to!
Q: I
purchased your t-shirt! So, how do I tell you the size I'd like?
Our
rewards coordinator will contact you via email. GRACIAS!
Q: I
bought an experience-related reward. What happens next? 
Our
rewards coordinator will contact you to give you more information. Grazie for
the contribution! Nothing like a live experience!
Q: I
bought a perk to help with the fundraiser, can I give more?
A:
ABSOLUTELY! There is an option at checkout to add more to your contribution.
MILLE GRAZIE!
Q: What
if I want to donate but don't want a perk?
A: We appreciate your support for our campaign and we
welcome your donation even if you do not wish to pick a perk. That just means
100% of your donation will go directly to QBF!
Q:
Can I donate via check?
A: Yes! Please
make your check out to "QUEENS BOOK FESTIVAL." If you would like the
contribution to be tax deductible, please make your check out to
"FJC" our fiscal sponsor. In the memo line of your check, please
write "Queens Book Festival" so that FJC will ensure your money is
earmarked for the campaign. Our mailing address is:
36-46
37th Street 
Unit 2
Long Island City, NY 11101
ARIGATO!
We
are grateful for your support. As we are a grassroots campaign, by definition
we owe any success we have to you.

story:
Liz Harpur, the aunt of Ben-Hadad Kimani, holding the only photo the family has of him.

In 2001, Ben-Hadad Kimani was charged with the killing of two people and sentenced to death in Nairobi. He was 17 years old at the time and has always maintained his innocence. His aunt Liz Harpur, who lives in Dublin, came to the Irish Innocence Project at Griffith College in 2013, after first hearing about the project when she was a student of Irish Innocence Project Director David Langwallner. The project has concerns about Ben-Hadad's conviction and through working with his lawyers, has recently been invited to make a plea before the Power of Mercy Advisory Committee in Kenya, a government appointed body that advises the president of Kenya on pardons and sentence commutations. The Irish delegation hopes to go to Kenya the first week of January. 

But we need your help!

This is a very expensive undertaking, but we believe that we could make a strong case in favour of Mr Kimani in front of the Committee, and make a difference. 

Our campaign is hoping to raise €5,000 for the necessary funding to underwrite the costs of the trip and support the operational costs of the Irish Innocence Project. Even a small donation will make a great impact to help with our work.

Ben-Hadad deserves justice, and you can be the key. 

WHO WE ARE

The Irish Innocence Project was founded in 2009 at Griffith College in Dublin by the Dean of Law, David Langwallner. We are a non-profit organisation providing free  services to people who claim to have been wrongfully convicted of crimes.

The first Innocence Project was set up in 1992 by Barry Scheck and Peter Neufield, which has grown into the Innocence Network with 68 recognized members in the United States and around the globe, with the Irish Innocence Project being one of them. We are also one of the two projects that take on both law and journalism students as part of the program.

The Irish Innocence Project and the Italy Innocence Project co-direct the newly launched European Innocence Network, which will validate new, existing, and developing projects.

How does someone get convicted of a crime they did not commit?   

· Faulty or overstated scientific evidence  

· Bad eye-witness identification  

· Poor investigations  

· Police or prosecutorial misconduct  

It is also important to bear in mind human error, as, unfortunately, sometimes people make mistakes. Although it is impossible to know for certain, researchers suggest that between 2.3 - 5% of all convictions are of innocent people. If you would like to know more about how wrongful convictions happen, please have a look at our YouTube channel. 

For more information please visit:

Irish Innocence Project         Facebook         Twitter    

For our campaign:

Facebook         Twitter         Instagram         YouTube

story:
Schmuck, also known as Munich Jewellery Week, is an internationally renowned weeklong art jewelry fair in Munich, Germany taking place from February 24th to March 3rd 2016. Annually held for over fifty years, Schmuck is attended by over a hundred thousand makers, designers, dealers, and collectors that come to experience the over eighty individual exhibitions, lectures, and events throughout Munich in conjunction with Schmuck. 


Who We Are

This Indiegogo campaign is run by, and will directly benefit the six MFA candidates in Metal from University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC): Clare Finin and Jina Seo (3rd years), Evin Dubois and Caitlin Skelcey (2nd years), Akiceri Alejandra (Ale) Carrillo-Estrada and Christina (Tina) McNealy (1st years). As graduate students preparing to enter the professional world of Metals and Jewelry, we realize the importance of professional networking that attending Schmuck would provide, as well as the creative inspiration from seeing such a diverse and international range of work.


Why We Need Help

We estimate that we need in excess of $2,500 per person to cover our travel, lodging, food, and miscellaneous costs to be able to attend Schmuck. As a student group we have been working on raising funds for over a year through hosting auctions of original work on Facebook, participating in jewelry sales throughout our region, holding campus specific events such as “Make your own Keychain” sales and face painting during football weekends, and through applying to individual and group grants and fellowships. We have been thrilled at the amount of support from our professional field and our campus community, but there is still a large gap between what we have raised so far and what is needed. We are hoping that by reaching out, we will receive aid to help us attend Schmuck and take advantage of this professional and creative opportunity.


What's In It For You

By donating you will be filled with a sense of pride that you are a supporter of students and the arts! To show our appreciation we have designed and made a variety of thank you gifts specifically for this campaign. Most campaign gifts will ship mid-December just in time for a last minute holiday gift. 

$5- An email from us to you, expressing our gratitude.

$15- A sticker featuring Billie Theide

(one sticker per $15 donation)

$ 25- A postcard from Germany (will ship late February)


$ 50- An edition print of a poster of Germany

(Pixel the cat not included)


$75- A 3D printed Gem brooch


$150- A refined 3D printed Gem brooch


$250- a pair of sterling silver earrings


$500- Everything: a Billie Theide sticker, a postcard from Germany, a poster of germany, a refined 3D printed brooch, a pair of sterling silver earrings, a Facebook highlight, and our eternal gratitude


$1,000- Everything including dinner: a Billie Theide sticker, a postcard from Germany, a poster of Germany, a refined 3D printed brooch, a pair of sterling silver earrings, a Facebook highlight, our eternal gratitude, and dinner with the six of us in Munich Germany.


$1,800- A one of a kind necklace from Billie Theide from her paint-by-number series. (will ship August 2016)


Thank You

We hope that you are willing and able to donate to help us reach our goals and further our education and professional network. Every donation is important, and we also hope that you help us through sharing this campaign through social media.

Clare, Jina, Evin, Caitlin, Ale, and Tina

story:
About Interview Room 11 and our project

Established in 2013, Interview Room 11 is an artist-led gallery based in Edinburgh, Scotland. For the past three years we ran a gallery space at the Argyle House, a 60s brutalist office building and former job centre in the heart of Edinburgh, as part of Forest Center Plus with studios and working facilities for over 80 artists. We held over 15 exhibitions, published ten exhibition catalogues, participated in two art fairs and welcomed hundreds of visitors from in and outside Edinburgh. Our main goal is to promote the work of Scottish artists and to provide a platform for exchange to the local community.  Due to our contract we were facing homelessness by the end of November.

However, our friends from Kalopsia, a textile design collective at the commercial complex of Ocean Terminal have offered to support us with a space and keep the gallery project alive.

To be able to undertake the refurbishing process we need your help!


What we will do with your funds 

A total of £350 will enable us to build a freestanding exhibition wall  between the gallery space and the Kalopsia Facility.

An additional £250 will be used for paint, wooden displays and printing materials.

£350 will serve to do preparatory work for our next two exhibitions, an exchange with Catalyst Arts in Belfast, Northern Ireland and an exhibition of works by the Scottish photographer Robert Davies together with a book launch.

Thank you!

We are very grateful and pleased about any support you can offer to help our project! Below you can find a list of rewards we can offer you in return. We will provide updates on a regular base, but please don’t hesitate to get in touch with us if you want to know more about our work or want to get involved as a volunteer!


Rewards


£7 - Individual Mini-Print

At Forest Centre Plus we have various printing facilities. As a sign of our gratitude to your support, the IR 11 team is going to produce a number of individual mini-prints related to our own artistic practice.

             

                             

£25 - Each of our exhibitions is accompanied by a small publication with texts of our committee members and a catalogue of the artist's work. You will receive one of our catalogues related to the following artists and exhibitions:

Susan Boyle - Meanwhile                              

Brian Cheeswright - 36 Years of Brainfeed

Janie Nicoll - Rough Edit

Derek Sutherland - Waste

Willem Venter - New Work 


£45 - Signed sketch or drawing

Sketches are items of everyday artistic practice and experimental playground for new ideas. You will receive a signed sketch or drawing, individually signed by one of our artists featured in Sluice!


£70 - Surprise Artwork

Each artwork is unique and a reflection of the artist's individual expression of form,  material and techniques, You will receive a surprise artwork, individually signed by one of our artists featured in Sluice!


Music by Transient - Can it be beautiful

story:
Who we are

Crescent Comics is the brainchild of world renowned techno visual artist Abdul Qadim Haqq from Third Earth Visual Arts who has teamed up with like minded artists to depict a new breed of Muslim superheroes that will inspire and appeal to people from all faiths and backgrounds.

Abdul Qadim Haqq originally made his name from designing graphics and label artwork which was grounded in futurism for the now legendary Detroit techno group Underground Resistance which symbolized messages of struggle with cutting edge audio/visual productions. Since 1989 he has been at the forefront of providing artistic direction for global music labels and has exhibited work in Japan, UK and even in his hometown of Detroit.

Those that may be familiar with some of Abdul’s work will notice a strong theme and style based in comic book art and concepts.

Abdul’s decision to create Crescent Comics came from his passion for the comic genre and also to create a counter narrative to the ever growing negative perception of Muslims portrayed by mass media and to how diverse art in Islam can really be.

The vision of Crescent Comics is to introduce people to a new generation of Muslim superheroes that will inspire, entertain and bring enlightenment to those that choose to listen to a universal message of peace.

Why we need help to raise money?

After self funding a number of editions and gradually building up a fan base through social media it is now time to take Crescent Comics to the next level.

Whilst artwork production and printing has been relatively manageable, in order for Crescent Comics to reach its full potential further investment is required for digital integration. Any money raised will go towards animation/video production and digital distribution which in turn will help to increase brand awareness amongst more tech savvy and make the comics available for purchase to a wider audience.

All help is greatly appreciated and funders will be able to access full exclusive bespoke artwork for their investment before anyone else.

story:
Greetings, 

  This campaign is the start of a new journey.  One in which I am hoping to have an incredible success and to share that with many of you.  I have been an Artist all my life and aim to share those Works and Inspirations and to give a boost to those who wish to pursue the Arts as well.  I have 15 yrs exp. in TV and Film, so I certainly know my stuff, but still always a student.  My aim is to create an online Art School, filled with useful Tutorials in both traditional Arts (life drawing etc.) and aspects of Animation and Design.  I don't imagine it to be easy to build a school, but certainly how many things are as important to youth or anyone then learning.  I ask that you help me build this New School of the Arts online, and lets see what happens!  Thank you.

An example: Remembering Nelson Mandela,

"Education is the most powerful weapon you can choose to change the World"

Primarily, the funds are in  order to cover my basic monthly expenses as I devote time to prepare material, Art, Video Tutorials, Promotion, and most importantly a brand new Highly Interactive Website which can house all the material, provide a portal that can expand into something of the like of a School setting where people esp. Children can login and partake in classes and interact with myself and get good instruction.  I do plan to move beyond this ofcourse with making this site interactive in the sense that active members can post their work, share their stories, embrace each others gifts, talk about things that inspire them and where I can Also, update them in latest Tech, Apps that apply, Learning Methods*.  
I had been a Professor of Animation at a local Toronto College, George Brown; as well as having taught privately.  My experiences with youth, and very importantly my own experiences with multiple approaches to learning, has given me Valuable insight as to what WORKS...   
This is where its at... Education is what I've concentrated on most my life.  It is the way to a prosperous future,  and its what kids need if they too want to move beyond the basic living standards...  but also, an outlet for all the emotions that come with being Human.

www.lchoifinearts.com (personal work)

Thank you for your time to read this.  If you cannot contribute, that is fair, I would just ask then if you could use the Indiegogo share tools.
TO THE FUTURE~!!
