Greetings,   This campaign is the start of a new journey.  One in which I am hoping to have an incredible success and to share that with many of you.  I have been an Artist all my life and aim to share those Works and Inspirations and to give a boost to those who wish to pursue the Arts as well.  I have 15 yrs exp. in TV and Film, so I certainly know my stuff, but still always a student.  My aim is to create an online Art School, filled with useful Tutorials in both traditional Arts (life drawing etc.) and aspects of Animation and Design.  I don't imagine it to be easy to build a school, but certainly how many things are as important to youth or anyone then learning.  I ask that you help me build this New School of the Arts online, and lets see what happens!  Thank you.An example: Remembering Nelson Mandela,"Education is the most powerful weapon you can choose to change the World"Primarily, the funds are in  order to cover my basic monthly expenses as I devote time to prepare material, Art, Video Tutorials, Promotion, and most importantly a brand new Highly Interactive Website which can house all the material, provide a portal that can expand into something of the like of a School setting where people esp. Children can login and partake in classes and interact with myself and get good instruction.  I do plan to move beyond this ofcourse with making this site interactive in the sense that active members can post their work, share their stories, embrace each others gifts, talk about things that inspire them and where I can Also, update them in latest Tech, Apps that apply, Learning Methods*.  I had been a Professor of Animation at a local Toronto College, George Brown; as well as having taught privately.  My experiences with youth, and very importantly my own experiences with multiple approaches to learning, has given me Valuable insight as to what WORKS...   This is where its at... Education is what I've concentrated on most my life.  It is the way to a prosperous future,  and its what kids need if they too want to move beyond the basic living standards...  but also, an outlet for all the emotions that come with being Human.
www.lchoifinearts.com (personal work)Thank you for your time to read this.  If you cannot contribute, that is fair, I would just ask then if you could use the Indiegogo share tools.
TO THE FUTURE~!!

story:
Why the world needs Tres Artis:

   Jon Hamm, Samuel L. Jackson, and Kristen Wiig all became household names well past their twenties and thirties.  Michael Emerson was about to give up acting when he moved to Florida, and Ang Lee took a computer class at thirty, considering filmmaking to be a dead dream at that point.  Many equally talented artists are out there right now, and are losing their motivation, their inspiration, every day.  The world won’t know their work.

   One of the biggest challenges for each artist living in the modern world, is to balance the time they are able to dedicate to their craft, with the time that they need to dedicate to all those activities that pay their rent.  Almost all of them find jobs in other sectors, in order to sustain the cost of living.  Some have to take on more than one odd job in order to get by.  Before you can say "enough," a week becomes a month, then a year, and finally a decade goes by.  You look around, and you're still in square one with this free-spirited lover you left home for.  Years spent chasing after something that doesn’t seem to love you back.  Expensive seminars, unpaid gigs, inaccessible casting calls, and lengthy audition processes, are just some of the everyday struggles that an artist has to face.  Expected to survive upon being released all on his/her own into this ever-changing jungle, without the necessary guidance to adapt, nor the essential tools to evolve from Theatre Film TV student to Theatre Film TV working professional.

 


   This is where Tres Artis comes in.  Tres Artis is a new private community of Theatre Film & Television professionals, founded in New York City.  The members of our community are provided with Craft, Career, and Lifestyle opportunities; through accessible & effective Education, Networking, and Publicity services.  Membership is granted by interview or invitation only.

   Tres Artis achieves all of this, through a team of qualified professionals cultivating individual connections with our members; we are here for you in art & in life.  Each artist will be treated as if he/she were the sole member of our community.  Besides facilitating the professional growth of each of our members, Tres Artis strives to connect the modern artist with the world that surrounds him/her. The ultimate goal being: to drive our pool of talent towards the creation of art-based volunteer initiatives & opportunities, in underprivileged communities around the world; through partnerships with humanitarian organizations. 



  

   We believe in humanity, and we need more human beings to believe in us.  But don’t just take our word for it…




 

The Tres Artis Team:

Meet Us Here


Our Mission:

  To create a like-minded community of committed artists, and guide them in the transition from Theatre Film & Television student, to Theatre Film & Television working professional; through boundless personal & professional support.


Who can become a member:

   We are always seeking committed artists who will contribute to a supportive atmosphere.


How your donations will be used to produce our June '16 Tres Artis Showcase (more info on Tres Artis Showcase below):

1) Theatre Rental - $2200

2) Rehearsal Space Rental - $600

3) Stage Manager - $300

4) Marketing costs - $400

5) Set Design - $600

6) Costume Design - $400

7) Light & Sound Design - $200

8) Unexpected costs - $300



With your support, we will produce the June ’16 Tres Artis Showcase; and when you help us surpass our $5k goal, together we will be able to do so much more for Art & Humanity…



What we've been up to so far:

- Tres Artis Studios: weekly sessions tailored for specific crafts in Theatre Film & Television, led by highly qualified industry leaders; focused on cultivating a healthy Craft, Career, and Lifestyle

     - Tres Artis Studio for Actors 

     - Tres Artis Studio for Directors

- Tres Artis Master Workshops: limited-time engagement workshops focused on a specific style or technique, led by a highly qualified professional

- “Artists Give (a sh*t)” monthly networking fundraiser: designed to bring Theatre Film & Television professionals together to support & raise funds for an urgent cause, while connecting personally & professionally through a variety of creative incentives

- Tres Artis Showcase: members from all Tres Artis Studios collaborate once a year, to bring all the elements of a production together, and present original work to an audience mixed between industry professionals & art enthusiasts.

     - Introducing "rate-pay tix:" Pay for tix after the show

          - $0: didn’t like it / $5: it was OK / $10: liked it / $20: loved it

     - Panel of industry leaders sit down with our members to exchange valuable feedback post-performance


Where your awesome support will take us:

- Tres Artis Studio for Playwrights

- Tres Artis Studio for Musical Theatre

- Tres Artis Studio for Costume Design

- Tres Artis Next Generation (TANG): Studio for Young Actors, Ages 8-12

- Tres Artis One on One: individual craft, career, & lifestyle training; OR art-business consulting

- Tres Artis Membership Card (physical & digital)

     - $25/month Tres Artis Basic Membership: 

          - Lifestyle discounts/benefits through partnerships with like-minded individuals & organizations; aiming to nurture our members physically, mentally, emotionally, and spiritually.  This includes but is not limited to: Rehearsal space, Healthcare, Housing, Film/Theatre tickets. 

          - Complementary admission to all Tres Artis Networking Events

          - 50% off all Tres Artis Master Workshops

     - $125/month Tres Artis Studio Membership includes: 

          - Basic Membership

          - Monthly access to participate in 1 Tres Artis Studio

     - $325/month Tres Artis Co-Working Space Membership includes: 

          - Basic Membership

          - Studio Membership

          - Access to Co-Working Space tailored specifically for Theatre, Film, and TV professionals


- Tres Artis Blog: news, events, opportunities, insight, and opinion by hand-picked collaborators, highly qualified to elaborate upon corresponding topic.  Includes v-logs, podcasts, and more.

- “Art to Business:” limited-time engagement master workshop bringing artistic tools to business/corporate professionals; based on emotional intelligence & public speaking

“Theatre-on-the-Go:” project seeks to make art accessible to everybody (performing free of charge, in parks, subway stations, and other public spaces) regardless of socioeconomic status; to enrich New York City culture, and contribute to New York City tourism

- Tres Artis Co-working Space: New York and possibly the world’s first co-working space built specifically to cater to the needs of Theatre, Film & TV professionals/entrepreneurs

- Tres Artis Humanitarian Volunteering: our community comes together to alleviate the suffering of human beings in need by bringing joy through the art of clowning & acting games; especially catering to children, and the elderly


Tres Artis is currently seeking new members, investors, and donors who want to be a part of our organization's growth, to expand domestically & internationally; and share its practice of -love through art- with the world.  Our team has already begun establishing strong bonds with foreign & domestic humanitarian organizations, as well government entities; paving the way to spread our ideas & practice on a global scale.  Love, through Art; can disrupt violence, silence greed, promote solidarity, and inspire change. 


Our best to you always,

-The Tres Artis Community


Like us: facebook.com/tresartiscommunity

Follow us on Twitter & Instagram: @tresartis

Visit us: tresartis.com



Can't donate but still want to help?

You can help us out still!

Share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, awesome blogs, and else anything you do on the internet!  We can make memes!

Use the IndieGoGo 'Share' Tools!

1.  Send this campaign's link via e-mail to all your contacts.

2.  May be you know someone who would be interested in supporting this project, like a family member, a friend, co-worker or neighbor?  Send us to them!  We'll love all of you!

story:
Abaddon is ON!

Support Resistance Philippines by contributing to this Indiegogo campaign!

We've designed these items with quality in mind and to share the passion for Ingress-related swag to our fellow agents across the globe. 


Contribute and get a chance to turn your Ops Sitrep into a comicbook!

By contributing at least 25 USD, you will get a chance to be chosen to send your Ops Sitrep (as a 20-page script) and we'll turn it into a comicbook!

One winner will be chosen (raffle) at the end of the campaign and will be announced in G+ by Argin Lerit.



10 USD

1 Abaddon Manila Card - Only given out to contributors to this Indiegogo campaign as a 'thank you' for your generosity.

3 Resistance Philippines Stickers - The Philippine Eagle, Three Stars and a Sun - symbols of the Philippines - are featured in this sticker.


25 USD

1 Comicbook - Recounts the events of Operation:Cassandra two years ago from the perspective of Resistance Agent kwispidood.

1 Abaddon Manila Card - Only given out to contributors to this Indiegogo campaign as a 'thank you' for your generosity.

30 USD

1 Comicbook - Recounts the events of Operation:Cassandra two years ago from the perspective of Resistance Agent kwispidood.

1 Abaddon Manila Card - Only given out to contributors to this Indiegogo campaign as a 'thank you' for your generosity.

3 Resistance Philippines Stickers - The Philippine Eagle, Three Stars and a Sun - symbols of the Philippines - are featured in this sticker.


Cards, Comicbook, and Stickers!

These swag items are shipping worldwide on the latter part of December 2015:

  • Saving Carrie Campbell Comicbook: Saving Carrie Campbell revisits the events of Operation: Cassandra from the perspective of Agent kwispidood

    two years ago (the first XM Anomaly in the Philippines). 32-pages of XM-charged adventure. Includes sketches and character studies.

  • Abaddon Manila Dossier Card: The Abaddon Manila Card features a modified “A in Flames” logo with the Rizal Monument in the middle to commemorate the 

    event and to thank the gracious supporters from all over the world.

  • Resistance Philippines Stickers: The Philippine Eagle, Three Stars and a Sun - symbols of the Philippines - are featured in this sticker. “Resist” is written in Baybayin, Philippines’ ancient writing script.

Thank you for your support!

The contributions collected will be used to offset the expenses associated with holding an Anomaly event locally (free swag for attendees!).


Acknowledgments

Thank you for the local Resistance community for the creativity and the hard work.

The Baybayin fonts used in these designs were made by Nordenx.

story:
Hello and welcome to our campaign page!


Yan Cao is a fiber artist living and working in the lovely Savannah, Georgia. She just received her Master degrees from Savannah College of Art and Design(SCAD). This exhibition will be her first show in Savannah, she was also invited by the Smithsonian Craft Show this year in Washington DC from April 21st -24th, and the Student Fiber Trends 2016 held in Claram. Eagle Gallery from May 19th to June 24th. She is a very young artist from China who loves flower growing, cats and travelling.

                          


Litao Chen will also receive his Master degrees from SCAD, he majors in Arts Administration and this exhibition will be conducted as his M.A. final project. He had gained a lot of experiences from museum and gallery management and once taken an intern in MCA, Chicago for half a year. This exhibition is his first project as an individual administrator.

                                                      


The exhibition will be held at 406 E. Oglethorpe Ave. Savannah, Georgia.

May 13th to 16th, 2016.

By supporting this project, you aren’t just supporting a single exhibition for an SCAD student; you are enabling community communication, education, and artistic exploration.


What We Need

The breakdown of what this project money will be used for is as follows:

Marketing materials(including flyer printing $59, poster printing $51,stickers printing $90, invitations printing $62 and thanks card $50) for promoting the exhibition are about $312.

Installation fee (including Introduction Board Printing$35, Mounting Holder and Support $280, and Booklets Printing$143) will be $423.

Other expenses (including exhibition area renting $500 and Desert & drinking $100) will be $600.

Thus, I intent to raise $1400 funds to help me reducing the costs for organizing this exhibition. Since they are my friends, they do not charge me as they do normally. However, as a return, I promise I will offer lunches, dinners, beverages, transportation and the most important costs, the venue. The expense will be about $ 1400.

If I cannot raise enough funds I need, I will pay rest of these money by myself.


Perks:

What YOU get!

If you donate:

Social Media Hooray: any amount 

Shout out via Facebook, and Instagram to let all your friends know how awesome you are-unlimited . 

FAN: $25

Receive an e-mailed ‘Thank You’ from Litao and Yan with a special photo attached.

ASPIRING: $50—Thanks card& Sticker& Flyer

Same Benefits as FAN, plus: A well-designed Thank you card with the signature from Litao and Yan; Exhibition Sticker; and a special designed Flyer

                 


MANAGER: $100

Same Benefits as ASPIRING, plus: a copy album of Poploquize; and a highquality poster

PRODUCER: $500

Same Benefits as MANAGER, plus: Booklet; and you can select one from the following four works.

                                           

SPONSOR: $1000

Same Benefits as SPONSOR, plus: one piece of Yan’s artwork.

     

The Impact: 

1.  Compared with exhibit painting works and other contemporary art, fiber art is a minor subject and artistic media. Your contribute will be a great incentive to this form of art!

2.  There are many international students select Savannah College of Art and Design for achieving their artistic dreams and Chinese students occupy a large proportion. Your contribute will be an incentive for a rare good work created by a Chinese student. It will also be helpful for increasing the cultural diversity with our community and encourage more overseas students.

3.  You get to tell all your friends that you are an arts supporting philanthropist.


Risks & Challenges:

1.  We may not get enough grant. If it happened, many cool ideas would not be come into reality. For example, we could not hire extra lighting and sound system for presenting artworks.

2.  There are many opportunities for exhibiting Yan’s artworks. For instance, her work was also invited to The Smithsonian Craft Show in Washington DC from April 21st to 24th. We sacrifice other excellent opportunities for this exhibition because we want to do more for our community. If there are not adequate grant we could get, the loss will double or triple to us.

3.  This is a first exhibition for Yan as a main artist to present her work and also the first exhibition for Litao as an arts administrator to manage. We don't want this opportunity of building up our own confidence to be ruined.

4.  For the ceiling of the gallery cannot be available to directly hang any art works. It will be a great deal of works to suspend the artworks with other facilities.


                    So join with us for Poploquize!

Pledge any amount you can. 

Together let’s make this thing happen!

Here is a sneak peek at our timeline so you know what we are up to:

Timeline Plan:
Address: Oglethorpe Gallery  406 E. Oglethorpe Ave. Savannah. GA

Opening reception: May 13th  6:00 p.m.~ 10:00p.m. 
Opening hour: May 14th~ 16th 10:00 a.m.~6:00 p.m.

Artist: Yan Cao
Exhibition Curator: Litao Chen

Opening Friday, May 13 2016
6:00 p.m.- 10:00p.m

May 13- May 16 2016
Gallery Hours 10am-6pm

For more info, Search ‘Poploquize’ on Facebook, Twitter. 
To support us, search ‘Poploquize’ on Indiegogo


                   What other ways you can help?

If you find yourself are interested in our project but suffering from financial burdens. Never fear! You can still help us in the following ways:

1.  Word of Mouth Promoting: you can help us promote this project by telling all your friends who are interested in arts or anyone who has the potential. We will consider this a great contribution and help if you did.

2.  Paying a visit by yourself: if you live in our community or nearby, or if you are a visitor just passing by, please take a while from your full schedule and step into the gallery, our special space, for taking a look at our works. I’m sure you will find something new!

3.  In-kind Donations: if you have(for example) an amount of unopened snacks that could be used for the exhibition opening. You could donate those and we can serve to our audience. Just let us know what you have and we’ll tell you whether it can be used！

4.  Please use the Indiegogo share tools to post about our exhibition on the internet and other social media!

breakdown of what this project money will be used for is as follows:
Marketing materials(including
flyer printing $59, poster printing $51,stickers
printing $90, invitations printing $62 and thanks card $50) for promoting the
exhibition are about $312.
Installation fee
(including Introduction Board Printing$35, Mounting Holder and Support $280,
and Booklets Printing$143) will be $423.
Other expenses
(including exhibition area renting $500 and Desert & drinking $100) will be
$600.

Thus, I intent to raise $1400 funds to help me reducing the costs for organizing this exhibition. Since they are my friends, they do not charge me as they do normally. However, as a return, I promise I will offer lunches, dinners, beverages, transportation and the most important costs, the venue. The expense will be about $ 1400.

If I cannot raise enough funds I need, I will pay rest of these money by myself.

Perks:
What
YOU get!
If
you donate:
Social
Media Hooray: any amount 
Shout out via Facebook, and Instagram to let all your friends know how awesome you are-unlimited . 
FAN:
$25
Receive
an e-mailed ‘Thank You’ from Litao and Yan with a special photo attached.
ASPIRING:
$50—Thanks card& Sticker& Flyer
Same
Benefits as FAN, plus: A well-designed Thank you card with the signature from
Litao and Yan; Exhibition Sticker; and a special designed Flyer

                 


MANAGER:
$100
Same
Benefits as ASPIRING, plus: a copy album of Poploquize; and a highquality poster
PRODUCER:
$500
Same
Benefits as MANAGER, plus: Booklet; and you can select one from the following
four works.

                                           
SPONSOR:
$1000
Same
Benefits as SPONSOR, plus: one piece of Yan’s artwork.

     
The Impact: 
1.  Compared with exhibit painting works and other
contemporary art, fiber art is a minor subject and artistic media. Your
contribute will be a great incentive to this form of art!
2.  There are many international students select
Savannah College of Art and Design for achieving their artistic dreams and
Chinese students occupy a large proportion. Your contribute will be an
incentive for a rare good work created by a Chinese student. It will also be
helpful for increasing the cultural diversity with our community and encourage
more overseas students.
3. 
You get to tell all your friends that you are an arts
supporting philanthropist.

Risks & Challenges:
1.  We
may not get enough grant. If it happened, many cool ideas would not be come
into reality. For example, we could not hire extra lighting and sound system
for presenting artworks. 
2.  There
are many opportunities for exhibiting Yan’s artworks. For instance, her work
was also invited to The Smithsonian Craft Show in Washington DC from April 21st
to 24th. We sacrifice other excellent opportunities for this
exhibition because we want to do more for our community. If there are not
adequate grant we could get, the loss will double or triple to us.
3.  This
is a first exhibition for Yan as a main artist to present her work and also the
first exhibition for Litao as an arts administrator to manage. We don't want
this opportunity of building up our own confidence to be ruined.
4.  For
the ceiling of the gallery cannot be available to directly hang any art works.
It will be a great deal of works to suspend the artworks with other facilities.


                    So join with us for Poploquize!

Pledge any amount you can. 
Together let’s make
this thing happen!

Here is a sneak peek at our timeline so you
know what we are up to:
Timeline Plan:
Address: Oglethorpe Gallery  406 E. Oglethorpe Ave. Savannah. GA

Opening reception: May 13th  6:00 p.m.~ 10:00p.m. 
Opening hour: May 14th~ 16th 10:00 a.m.~6:00 p.m.
Artist: Yan CaoExhibition Curator: Litao Chen

Opening Friday, May 13 2016
6:00 p.m.- 10:00p.m

May 13- May 16 2016
Gallery Hours 10am-6pm

For more info, Search ‘Poploquize’ on Facebook, Twitter. 
To support us, search ‘Poploquize’ on Indiegogo 

                   What other ways you can
help?
If you find yourself are interested in our
project but suffering from financial burdens. Never fear! You can still help us
in the following ways:
1.  Word of Mouth Promoting:
you can help us promote this project by telling all your friends who are
interested in arts or anyone who has the potential. We will consider this a
great contribution and help if you did.
2.  Paying a visit by
yourself: if you live in our community
or nearby, or if you are a visitor just passing by, please take a while from
your full schedule and step into the gallery, our special space, for taking a
look at our works. I’m sure you will find something new!
3. 
In-kind
Donations: if you have(for example) an
amount of unopened snacks that could be used for the exhibition opening. You
could donate those and we can serve to our audience. Just let us know what you
have and we’ll tell you whether it can be used！
4. 
Please
use the Indiegogo share tools to post about our exhibition on the internet and
other social media!

story:
WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING...



          "brilliant concept"

                                                         "amazing!"

"let's change the world...one GREAT idea at a time, shall we?"

..."a badass initiative!"

"revolutionary...a true visionary."




Paper for the people AND the planet.

8.5 BOOK STACK.  That's what I call it.  It's 8.5" x 8.5" all purpose copy + print + play paper, just like it's cousin 8.5" x 11" letter...but less.  22.27% less to be exact.
The term 'BOOK' is the equal to 'letter' or 'tabloid' or 'legal'. 
'STACK' is the quantity and package in which it will be manufactured and sold. 
A 'STACK' is the equivalent of four reams, or 2,000 sheets of paper. That means a really smart and light 9" x 9" x 9" cube of paper.

8.5 BOOK will be:
92 bright, 30% recycled content, FSC, SFI, & PEFC certified &
Manufactured and distributed in the U.S. from U.S. materials
The BOOK BINDER will be:
1" spine, 9" x 9" square
100% FSC certified post consumer waste board
100% recyclable
Manufactured and distributed in the U.S.


When I first had the idea for 8.5" x 8.5" paper, it was from my designer brain, the part of me that loves all beautiful, square, and precise things...but as I've learned over the years...this paper can do a lot of good, simply by helping us ALL to use less, and being an enjoyable way to do so.

This campaign is about raising money for our first truckload of paper to you. I can't do it without you, nor would I want to.  After all, this is for all of us, and the world that sustains us.  I need to hear that you get what I'm trying to do and that you want the paper available for all.

You are a part of RE-THINKING an entire industry.

Here's where we start...

As I said above, I will be using the money raised in this campaign to pay for the first run of paper and packaging, there's some re-tooling of equipment also, and new custom packaging that has to happen, as this size has never been created before...that's what I'm raising the funds for.
If my goal is not met, you will not be charged.  I have to be able to buy a certain amount of stock from my manufacturer to move forward, so be sure and share this campaign with any other visionaries and futurists you know.
_____________________________________________________________________________

LESS IS EASY.

It's easy to use less paper, by simply adjusting your margins...and of course, you can take it further by editing content (aren't we already SO bombarded with information...maybe we could all stand to say a little less and make more time for listening), changing fonts, and reducing font size.


LESS IS FUN.

8.5 happens to be the right shape (square) to be on the ready for fun origami play, winter snowflake cutting, playful and punchy posters, and probably a million other things that I haven't thought of.  (Let me know your ideas!).

_____________________________________________________________________________

You ARE the change WE can be.

It will take all of us together on this one.  As I said, I cannot do this without your want for the paper, and your willingness to pre-order. 

We have an opportunity to improve an entire industry's footprint.  You and me.  That's where all good projects start, isn't it.  With a few people deciding we can do better...

Be sure and visit the website for ways 8.5 has already been used, and the Q+A page to answer any questions that weren't covered here. 

BRIGHTREY.COM

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't spare the money to buy a stack of paper now, I totally get it, and if instead you simply share my campaign with people that you think would be interested in being a part, you are contributing immensely, and I thank you in advance for your willingness.

-Rebecca Rey
